Estelita and Jesus are both industrious and work hand in hand in order to survive without depending on their children.  Actually, they are the ones who help their children and grandchildren.

The buying and selling of salt is their primary source of income, but sometimes during the fishing season she also engages in fish vending. 

Her loan from ASHI is a big help for them because through the capital entrusted to them, they earn an income and through their income they are able to afford their needs and wants. They already have their own business stalls in the market. Moreover, these businesses not only give them an income, but they also provide pleasure to her.  

She is applying for a 10,000.00 PHP loan. This amount will be utilized as additional capital to help her buy and sell more salt. She hopes that someday she can become a wholesaler of salt for the entire municipality.

loans.use: To buy more salt to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 24, owns and runs a grocery store in a busy part of Nairobi. Her business has a good number of loyal customers. She has been in this business for five years, before which she was in the business of selling used clothing. She is social and hardworking and hopes eventually to be a distributor of fruits and vegetables on a larger scale. 

She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to purchase passionfruits, bananas, and avocados, and to enlarge her business premises.

Mary and her husband have three children.

loans.use: To purchase passionfruits, bananas, and avocados, and to enlarge her business premises

loans.name: Joby

texts.en: Joby C. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, detergents, sugar by the kilogram, instant noodles and junk foods in her community. She is 31 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro City. Joby has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Joby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Joby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Joby is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Bonbon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Progresando En Valores 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Ysabel is the coordinator of her group, Progresando en valores 1, 2, 3 (progress in values). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to finish building a bathroom in her house. In the meantime she continues to enjoy sewing.

Ysabel is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business, which she started with some savings, for two years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing and a sewing machine. She will use the profits to build a bathroom and a kitchen. Her dreams are to work hard and move her business forward, and with the help of God, she will.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to invest in her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's other Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy clothing and a sewing machine

loans.name: Telmo Washington

texts.es:
Telmo Washington Q. G. tiene 35 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Telmo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y pago a los jornaleros. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta ir a misa los domingos.
texts.en:
Telmo Washington Q. G. is a 35-year-old married man. He lives with his spouse and children in San Miguel county in Bolivar province. He has three children.

The members of the Solidarios Chima Chica communal bank are located thirty minutes from our San Miguel office in San Miguel county. The members of this group work as farmers in order to earn income for their families. They grow corn and a small amount of potatoes and beans.

Telmo works as a farmer and plants corn and potatoes. He buys his products in Ambato, Quito, and San Miguel, and sells his goods at the Thursday market in San Miguel.

He is requesting this loan in order to buy farming supplies and to pay day laborers. With financial assistance from this loan, Telmo will be able to supply himself with basic necessities. Telmo faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases, and changes in the weather. His dream is to buy land so that he can continue growing crops.

He enjoys going to mass on Sundays.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie O. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Eddie has a phone accessories shop, which he has run for less than a year.
To help expand his business, Eddie has requested a loan of 1,600,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more phone accessories. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Eddie hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, he hopes to own another house.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories for resale

loans.name: William Xavier

texts.es: William tiene 33 años. Se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene experiencia en su negocio, por lo que es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su actividad. William sabe que tiene que levantarse temprano para ofrecerles a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos, el recorrido que realiza es de manera ambulante ya que es así que obtiene mas ganancias. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de  calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
William is 33 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than five years. He is a very responsible gentleman who enjoys his work. William knows that he must wake up early so that he can offer his customers a wide variety of products. He travels a route as a street vendor so that he can generate the most income.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy shoes, cosmetics, general clothing, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Grimaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LA ÑUSTA III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 33 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche entre otro tipos de productos más su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, la socia a la vez trabaja en un wawawasi (lugar donde se quedan los niños mientras sus papas trabajan guardería) ella trabaja de lunes a viernes por las mañanas y en las tardes se encarga de su tienda de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes y así poder tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Grimaldina belongs to the Communal Bank “La Ñusta III”, which is located in the District and Province of Calca, Department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Grimaldina divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and many other items. She works Monday through Friday in the mornings at a day care center where parents leave their children while at work. In the afternoons, Grimaldina manages her store so that her family can get ahead. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise for her grocery store so that she can have a wider variety to offer to her customers.

Grimaldina is happy with the loan and promises to complete all of her payments.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 27 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Siemana, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tasses, de galettes, de chaussures et de tubercules.  Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.                                                                                MAMAN T. compte acheter, des ustensiles avec les grossistes du marché de Barouéli hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi group are all married, are on average 27 years old with two children and all live in traditional extended families in the village of Siemana, part of the Barouéli prefecture in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They got acquainted through ties of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They sell mugs, cakes, shoes, and tubers. The women in the Benkadi group are on their sixth cooperative loan.

Mom T. intends to buy utensils from wholesalers at the weekly market in Barouéli. She makes daily sales locally at home and in the market, for cash and credit to a largely female clientele.

She expects to attain a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA which will be used to reimburse the loan, pay contributions towards social ceremonies and the rest will be reinvested in her business activity.

loans.use: Buy utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of potato seeds.

loans.name: Mi Fortaleza En Cristo 5 Group

texts.en:
Mayra is the coordinator of her group 'Mi Fortaleza en Cristo 5' (My Strength in Christ), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Santiago, a large city known for its tobacco and beef production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children.
Mayra is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza, after she was invited by other women in her community to be part of their group and receive a loan for her beauty salon. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying hair and beauty products. She will use the profits to invest in saving towards her goal of expanding her local business into a bigger one, and to buy more equipment. She dreams of having her own house and of giving her family a better life. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products

loans.name: Nhan's Group

texts.en:
Nhan T. N. is 50 years old and has two children who are married. 

She is managing a small grocery shop at her house. She sells many kinds of products such as wine, rice and beer. Her business has developed well since she got a loan from our credit program in 2005. Everyday she gets 100,000 VND profit from this shop and it helps her cover her family's expenses. 

Besides, she also is growing flowers and raising four pigs for meat.  

Currently, she wants to have a loan of 4,142,000 VND to buy fertilizer for the flowers and food  for the pigs.

Lai T. N. is 36 years old with two children. She is a builder. After 6 years of  working very hard, she can rebuild her own house. Now, she needs to have a loan of 8,066,000 to buy some construction supplies.

Hong T. N. is 34 years old with two children. She is a tailor and has been managing a shop that makes dresses for three years. She needs to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND.
 
Ha T. D. is 40 years old. She is raising a cow and 200 chickens for eggs. She needs to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to  buy  fertilizer for her flower crop and food  for her pigs

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam M. is able to earn a living by selling a few items in a public school, in Battambang province. She sells such items as study materials, sweets, and soft drinks. From this sales business, she usually generates an income of around $4 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who makes revenue as a horse cart deliverer in and around his community. They have five single children; one of them assists Sam M. in the same business while the others are studying. 

Recently, part of Sam M.’s inventory has been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan to expand her inventory to continue selling. With the remainder of the  funds, she will buy a new horse for her husband to replace the old one.

loans.use: to buy additional items to continue selling.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Triunfadoras lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es Rosa Esperanza L. Castillo de 35 años quien inicio con 400 córdobas hace tres años a invertir en la compra de ropa.
Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de pedidos que tiene.
Las otras integrantes son Rosa Isabel E. Sánchez desde hace un año tiene una venta y María Karolina Hernández de 35 años tiene una fritanga desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The Las Triumfadoras (The Triumphant Ones) group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising women from Managua.

Rosa Esperanza L. Castillo, age 35, is the group coordinator.  She started three years ago by investing 400 córdobas in the purchase of clothes.  She will use the loan to buy clothing to fill the orders that she has.

Rosa Isabel E. Sánchez is a member of the group.  She has had a sales business for one year.  María Karolina Hernández, another member, is 35 years old.  She has had a “fritanga” (an establishment that sells fried foods) for eight years.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is married with seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her eldest son sells garments as well as runs a juice stand. The second one has a welding shop, while the 3rd one is an electrician by trade. Her remaining children are getting their education from a local school. Her husband has a business doing furniture polishing. He is well known for his work and people come to him for services.
 
Robina supports her family financially by selling artificial flowers. She operates her business from her home and supplies flowers to different flower shops to earn income. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s juice stall. With the loan, he will buy a juice extracting machine that will help him provide good quality juice to his customers and increase his profits.  He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Robina hopes that an investment will bring better profits to him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: To buy a juice extracting machine for juice stall.

loans.name: Construyendo Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es: El señor YONO D. 43 años D. edad, es casado pero no tiene hijos , es  obrero D. profesión y con la ayuda D. su actual pareja aperturo un bazar en un mercado ya que en esos momentos no había una obra D. construcción  para que el trabaje. Los crédito otorgado por EDAPROSPO los invierte en la compra D. productos para surtir el bazar. En el futuro al Señor YONO le gustaría aperturar un negocio en otro lugar.
texts.en: Yono is a member of the "Building A Better Future" group. He is 43 years old and married but has no children. He is a laborer by profession and with the help of his wife he set up a general store in a market since at this time there are not construction jobs for him to work. With the group loan approved by Kiva partner EDAPROSPO, he plans to purchase products to stock his store. In the future, Yono would like to open a business in another location.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock a general store.

loans.name: Solano Group

texts.es:
El grupo lo conforman  Hortensia, Silvana e Ulises tres personas trabajadoras provenientes del reparto Martín Castellón de Nindiri. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Hortensia,  ella inicio con la venta de variedades (chiverías, torta de papa, enchiladas, tacos…etc.) luego con las ganancias puso una comideria e inicio a prestar para levantar su negocio.

Ella junto a su esposo trabajan hombro a hombro para salir a delante en su pequeño local y distribuyen comida a distintas empresa. Hortensia con el crédito comparar arroz, aceite, frijoles, cebolla, carne…etc.

El señor Ulises trabaja en un microbús como cobrador y tiene una comideria la cual mira su esposa y Silvana  desde hace 16 años vende  mariscos.
texts.en:
This group includes Hortensia, Silvana and Ulises, three hardworking people who come from the Martin Castellon housing development in Nindiri.  Hortensia is the coordinator of the group.  She started a business selling a variety of food items (snacks, potato cakes, enchiladas, tacos, etc.)  Later with the earnings from that enterprise she started a catering business, and started investing to grow the business. 

Hortensia works side by side with her husband to make her business work; they deliver food to a number of different companies.  With this loan, Hortensia will buy rice, cooking oil, beans, onions, meat and other items.

Ulises works as a fare collector on a minibus, and he also has an eatery that his wife looks after.  Silvana has been selling seafood for 16 years.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni vive en el barrio Los Cedros del municipio de Soledad, con sus tres hijos en las edades de 14 a 21 años, con quienes sueña trabajar mucho para sentarle las bases de un futuro próspero.   Marleni tiene un negocio que consiste en vender mercancía en general como ropa, calzado, bolsos   productos domésticos, que distribuye entre comerciantes del centro de Barranquilla en calidad de créditos y recauda los fines de semana. Marleni está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 16 años en los cuales ha recibido 12 créditos, los que  ha invertido muy bien, logrando aumentar su capital de trabajo     y con ello sus ingresos  de manera significativa para aumentar el bienestar de su familia y su principal logro es que ha logrado mediante su trabajo persistente la  educación de sus hijos. Su credikiva es el financiamiento # 13 con el comprará jeans, calzado, carnes frías, suéteres y colonias, que tiene encargado con esta inversión planea  continuar incrementando su capital de trabajo una vez más, imprimiendo todo sus esfuerzos al fortalecimiento y la sostenibilidad de su negocio, cuya rentabilidad   es no menor del 43%.
texts.en:
Marleni lives in Los Cedros neighborhood, in the town of Soledad, with her three children who are between the ages of 14 and 21.  Marleni dreams of working hard so that she can lay the foundations for a prosperous future for her children.  She has a business selling general merchandise such as clothes, footwear, bags and household products which she delivers to salespeople in the center of Barrnquilla.  She provides the goods on credit and collects payment on the weekend.

Marleni has been working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 16 years and has received 12 loans.  She invested them all very well and managed to increase her working capital and also significantly increase her income, thereby improving her family's well-being.  Her main achievement is that, through her persistent work, she has managed to provide her children with an education.  This Kiva loan is Marleni's 13th loan and she will use it to buy jeans, footwear, cold meats, sweaters and cologne which she has orders for.  Through this investment, she plans to continue increasing her working capital, putting all her efforts into strengthening her business and making it sustainable.  Her business profitability is no less than 43%.

loans.use: to buy jeans, footwear, cold meats, sweaters and cologne

loans.name: Elvis Alexis

texts.es:
Elvis Alexis tiene 20 años, Es soltero vive con los padres no tiene hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Elvis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es tener comprar un carro y una casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Elvis Alexis is 20 years old.  He is single, lives with his parents, doesn’t have children and lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The members of the “OUR LAND” cooperative bank find themselves located in the San Luis de Zapotal precinct, belonging to the canton of Ventanas.  This area dedicates itself to agricultural tasks related to short cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Elvis dedicates himself to farming, planting corn and rice.  He buys his products at the AGRIPAC corporation, and sells them at the wholesale market of Ventanas.

He requests this loan to plant corn and rice, to buy seeds and fertilizers.  The support of this loan would help him financially to supply his needs.  He faces challenges such as crop plagues and a lack of funds to pay for more workers.  His dreams are to buy a car and a house.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers for his corn and rice crops.

loans.name: Ma. Merlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Merlinda is 46 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, Ma. Merlinda has run a sari-sari (retail) store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other grocery items like snacks and noodles. 

Ma. Merlinda  is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell including milk, groceries, and other items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 41 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Mila sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to purchase more containers of fish for sale. 
Mila has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Mila hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more containers of fish for sale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Gloria tiene 30 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 1 hija de 12 años; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista; ella compra y vende papa. La socia compra papa al por mayor  y vende de forma minorista, la socia recibe en camiones la papa y las pone en costales de plásticos y los vende por kilos y arrobas. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de papa al por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor papa y distribuirlas según el tipo y calidad en costalillos de plásticos llamados rafia.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Siempre Unidos", meaning "Always Together". It is located in the district of Huanchac, in the market of Virgen Asunta, of the province and department of Cusco.

Gloria is 30 years old and she is married common-law. She has a 12-year old daughter. She has a retail business, buying and selling potatoes. She buys potatoes in wholesale and she resells in retail. Potatoes are delivered to her in trucks and she stores them in plastic sacks to sell them by the kilogram or by the bushel. She requires the loan to invest in the purchase of potatoes in wholesale. She requests a loan to purchase potatoes in wholesale and sort them according to the type in plastic raffia sacks.

She is thankful for the support that is given to her and she is committed to make her loan payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in wholesale and sort them according to the type in plastic raffia sacks.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
La señora Leonides está solicitando un préstamo para podré invertir en comprar herramienta y equipo que necesita para su local de salón de belleza.
Lo que le hace falta de herramienta es (tijeras especiales para cortar cabello, maquinas, peines, secadora de pelo y pinzas para planchar el pelo) y de quipo es (sillones espaciales y espejos). Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para acondicionar su local. 
Doña Leonides se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de belleza a domicilio y ayudarles a sus amigas en su trabajo, pero desea ya tener su propio negocio y establecerlo en su casa y así poder atender a su pequeño hijo, que esta bajo su responsabilidad ya que es madre soltera. 
Con una parte de sus ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de salón de belleza planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Leonides is requesting a loan in order to buy tools and equipment she needs for her beauty salon. 

She needs tools such as special scissors for cutting hair, machines, combs, a hair dryer, and a hair flattening iron, and also equipment such as special chairs and mirrors. She does not have the money necessary to outfit her salon.

Leonides has been doing beauty work in people’s homes and helping her friends with their work. But now she wants to open her own business in her home so that she can take care of her young son. He is her responsibility because she is a single mother. 

With part of the income she will earn from her beauty salon, she will make her re-payments.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is leading the agricultural business of the family, particularly in hog raising. She has had this business for four years and she is able to generate an income of P1,000 for each piglet. Aside from the hog raising business, she also has rice farming which is managed by her husband. 

Teresita is requesting her ninth loan in the amount of P10,000 to purchase feed for the daily maintenance of her hogs.She needs to feed them three times a day so that she can sell them at a greater price. She plans to increase her profit in the hog raising business so that she can let her children finish their studies and sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the daily maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is taking another Kiva loan of 40,000 KES to establish another business raising fish in his fish pond. He will purchase fingerlings to raise and be sold later when they have grown up. He dreams of expanding the fish selling business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. Ilham is a noble worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells at commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him because raising animals is what he enjoys most. His earning from this business is $150 US.  Ilham requires an additional amount of money to increase the number of his cattle. His goal is to increase his production and thereby increase his household income, in addition to remaining solvent in order to continue working at buying and selling animals.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder

loans.name: Ma. Annabelle

texts.en:
Thirtysix-year-old, Ma. Annabelle, is a married woman with 3 children aged 13, 11 and 9. Her husband is a farmer.

Ma. Annabelle has had a sari-sari store business for 13 years. She sells items like canned goods, school supplies and soap. Each month Ma. Annabelle earns 4000 PHP with her business. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, biscuits and soap. Ma. Annabelle plans to use her profit to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, biscuits and soap.

loans.name: Max

texts.en:
Max is a 34-year-old married woman with two children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the bar and restaurant business for three years. She began with 100,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. 

Her main hardship is limited financial resources, and her wish is a good strategic location for the restaurant, a stock of 10,000,000 shillings, plus a house. Max needs the loan facility to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 46 years old and lives in Canal, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Marcelina has a business selling snacks. She earns about 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Marcelina has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Marcelina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months. In the future, Marcelina would like to have savings for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Ufanisi Group

texts.en:
Henry is the facilitator of the Ufanisi group. Henry and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Henry takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and in order to ensure food security for his kids. In the recent 2011 season, Henry had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 12 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Henry was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Henry and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Henry will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ufanisi group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.es:
Nemesia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino, tiene 46 años, es madre de 2 hijos, vende ropa en ferias, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 1 año, los primeros préstamos que recibió los invirtió en la compra de ropas, le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal porque le enseña a ahorrar a ser puntual, responsable con el dinero y la familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropas y mandiles. 
Su meta comprar una lancha para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Nemesia is a member of the Amor Divino (Divine Love) communal bank.  She’s 46 years old and the mother of two children.  She sells clothing at different fairs and has been a FINCA Peru member for one year.  She invested her initial loans into clothing.  She likes the training she gets in her communal bank because they teach her to be punctual and responsible with money and family.  She is asking for this loan to buy clothing and aprons.

Her goal is to buy a boat to transport her products.

loans.use: to buy clothing and aprons

loans.name: Una Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Doña Leti tiene 40 años de edad y es originaria de un pueblito muy tranquilo lleno de vegetación  donde muy cerca se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca el cual atrae al turismo mexicano y del extranjero a su visita, ella es parte del grupo Una Nueva Vida y dice que le pusieron ese nombre porque a través de los créditos ella y la gente que conforma su grupo han mejorado sus condiciones de vida. Platica Leti como de cariño le dicen que no continuo con sus estudios porque sus papas no tuvieron dinero para seguirla apoyando. Ella tiene un negocio desde hace 2 años de venta de paletas y helados de sabores y en la época de invierno bajan sus ventas y se dedica a vender pan ya que su suegra hace para vender y ella le compra para revender en localidades aledañas a su población, comenta que quiere pedir un crédito para la compra de un refrigerador ya que el que tiene está descompuesto y no tiene dinero para mandarlo arreglar y ella  quisiera comprar uno nuevo ya que el que tiene le ha invertido mucho dinero y le conviene mejor comprar uno nuevo. También si le dan el crédito dice que  comprara pan para venderlo y seguir ayudándoles a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que tiene cuatro hijos de nombres Ana Karen de 17 años de edad la cual estudia la preparatoria, Beatriz de 14 años estudia secundaria, Alma Cristina y  Bernardo de 11 años los cuales estudian la primaria. Comenta que con el préstamo la beneficiara ya que tendrá su nuevo refrigerador el cual le ayudara a tener sus paletas en buen estado y no gastara tanto en luz, dice que una de sus metas será poner un local especial para sus paletas y ahí vender su pan que hace su suegra. Ella esta agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible los créditos ya que les ayudan demasiado a tener sus negocios bien surtidos. Los otros cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman María Magdalena, Ma Victoria, Efraín y Petra los cuales invertirán sus créditos en una panadería, en una tienda de abarrotes en una cenaduría y en venta de frituras y jugos y licuados.
texts.en:
Doña Leti is 40. She is from a very small and peaceful village, filled with vegetation. There is a monarch butterfly sanctuary close by which attracts tourism from within Mexico and abroad. Leti is part of the Una Nueva Vida ["A New Life"] communal bank. She says that they chose this name because all the group members have improved their living conditions through their loans. With obvious affection for her parents, Leti tells us that she did not continue with her studies because her parents did not have enough money to keep supporting her.
She has had her own business for two years, selling popsicles and ice cream. Her sales are lower in the wintertime, so she sells bread. Her mother-in-law bakes the bread, and she buys it to later sell in the neighbouring towns. She tells us that she is requesting a loan for the purchase of a refrigerator, since hers is broken down and she does not have enough money to have it repaired. She would like to buy a new one because her current fridge has already eaten up a lot of money, so it makes more sense to buy a new one. 
Upon receiving this loan, she says she will also buy bread to sell so that she can continue supporting her husband with the household costs. They have four children: Ana Karen, age 17, in high school; Beatriz, age 14, in middle school; and Alma Cristina and Bernardo, both 11, in elementary school.
Leti says that this loan will benefit her because she will have a new fridge to keep her popsicles in good shape, and she won't spend as much money on electricity. She says that one of her goals is to open a special store for her popsicles and for selling her mother-in-law's bread. She is grateful to all of the people who make these loans possible, since they help so many people to have prosperous businesses.
The other group members are María Magdalena, Ma Victoria, Efraín and Petra. They will invest their loans in: a bakery; a grocery store; a restaurant; and in selling fried food, juice, and shakes.

loans.use: to sell popsicles and ice cream.

loans.name: Santos Vicenta

texts.es: Santos Vicenta de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; Ella se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas de diferentes colores, estilos y tamaños, tiene varios años de trabajar en este ámbito y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor además de obtener las mejores hamacas, su negocio está ubicado en su residencia comercia en diferentes zonas y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque siempre elabora el producto con mejor calidad, a buenos precios y con un servicio inigualable; Santos es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le ayudan a dar un paso más hacia el éxito; quiere hacer crecer  el negocio y necesita de capital para invertir en insumos y lograr aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hilos por mayor, madera, cuerda, etc. Santos Vicenta tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.

loans.use: hilos por mayor, madera, cuerda

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura is a 26-year-old married mother of one child. To give back to her community, Zuhura is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers in her nearby secondary school teaching life skills to students. Zuhura requests a Kiva loan to buy a motorcycle for a renting business. She will employ a driver who will run the business of driving customers to different places and receive cash. Zuhura will use the obtained profits from the loan to pay for regular maintenance to her motorcycle and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for a business

loans.name: Nelson David

texts.en:
My name is Nelson David and in my community I am very well known for my sale of sweet ice cream. My business is located near the catholic church in my city. I've been selling ice cream for 4 years and it has generated income to support my family. My children help me to sell in other neighboring communities. Now is the time when sales increase and I need to be able to cover the demand of my clients. This loan will help me get to that point.

SPANISH

Me llamo Nelson David y en mi comunidad soy bastante conocido por mi rica venta de helados, mi negocio esta ubicado en la parte de atras de la iglesia catolica en mi ciudad. Tengo cuatro años de tener mi venta de helados que me ha generado ingresos para mantener a mi familia, mis hijos me ayudan a vender en otras comunidades vecinas en sus ratos libres, ahora que es epoca de calor mis ventas aumentan y necesito poder cubrir la demanda de mis clientes.

loans.use: Sorbetes, ice cream, servilletas, vasos desechables.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en: Temukisa, 49, married, grew up in a banana farm. Her business involves supplying different types of bananas to the local market. One of the reasons why her business is successful is that she also caters to several other small businesses in her village that produce banana chips.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers, pesticides and planting materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en: When Mrs. Benedict O. heard about what LAPO is doing for the poor, she asked for their help. She needs a loan of US$750 for buying more provisions and foodstuffs to sell in her store. Mrs. Benedict is from Asaba of Delta State in Nigeria.

loans.use: Purchase of more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Ndri Yolande

texts.en: Djé Ndri Yolande is a dynamic 44 year old woman. She is married and lives with her family in Port-Bouët, a very populated suburb in the south of Abidjan District. She has 3 children. The 2 elder daughters are in secondary school and the younger boy is in primary school. She believes that her children are her future and invests a lot in their education. Yolande has sold utensils at Port-Bouët market for many years and joined the AE&I Microcredit Program in 2005. She wants to expand her business and diversify her product range by selling high quality steel utensils which will provide her with a better return.

loans.use: Djé Ndri Yolande will use the loan to diversify her products offer

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya M., age 46, is a widow who sells porridge for a living, earning $12.50 per day in revenue. She has seven children, two of whom work at a garment factory earning $100 per month each. Two are students, and three are married. Ya would like to borrow $800 to purchase a motorbike for one of her sons to use to operate a moto-taxi business. She anticipates this will bring in another $2.50-$5 per day in income to help her family. She is pictured in the photograph next to her son .

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
My name is Amna B.. I am married and a mother of seven. I live with my family in Lahore, second largest city in Pakistan. My husband makes and sells cardboard boxes that are used to store various kinds of objects including soaps, shampoos, shoes etc. My son operates a motorbike rental store. Currently, he has six bikes in his store. His rental store generates a revenue of $500 a month approximately. Now, he wants to expand his business further, and buy an additional bike. 
My son is very ambitious to grow his enterprise by leaps and bounds. He wishes to buy a big house for us and go on a tour abroad. I wish him success in all his plans. You could help my son fulfill his dreams by lending him $825.

loans.use: Buy an additional bike for the rental store

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou A. was born in 1977 and is married and the mother of two children. Her main business is selling personal care products which she presently carries through the streets in a basin balanced on her head. Very ambitious and intent on helping her husband provide for their family, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 so that she can open a little kiosk where she can display and sell her products. This will free her from the necessity of walking from place to place to sell her wares.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akou est née en 1977, marié et mère de deux (2) enfants. Son activité principale est la vente des produits cosmétiques qu’elle fait promener dans les quartiers. Très ambitieuse et voulant plus contribuer aux charges du ménagé, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour ouvrir un petit kiosque et exposer ses produits. Ceci l’épargnera des kilomètres qu’elle parcourt afin de vendre ses produits.

loans.use:
Opening a little kiosk for her personal care products business

Achat et vente de produit cosmétique

loans.name: Mutundwe 2B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Esther is 24 years, married and has two children. Her husband owns a butcher shop. Esther provides tailoring services. She usually earns 100,000 shillings in profits each week. She wants to use the extra profit to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

Betty has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy a steamer.

Florence has a retail business and wants to increase her stock of goods.

Margret sells firewood and Betty sells charcoal.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es:
Mr. Walter is a free-lance photographer with a 12-year experience. His profession has allowed him to make a living for his family. He covers weddings, birthdays, baptisms and graduations, among other events. He has a good number of clients that hire him on a temporary basis, but he is always on the outlook to make new clients and to cover important business events. Because of their tough financial situation and the high living costs, his wife sells cosmetics by catalog in workplaces and to family and friends. In this way, they support their two children. Having prioritized other expenses, they haven’t been able to repair the roof of their house living room, which is cracked and has holes, after many years of use. Moreover, some of the zinc sheets are loose due to the strong winds and Mr. Walter is afraid that might facilitate thieves breaking into his house. He is requesting a loan to tend to this urgent need of changing the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Walter es fotógrafo de profesión, con 12 años en esta actividad,que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. El señor cubre bodas, cumpleaños, bautizos y graduaciones, entre otros eventos. Cuenta con un buen número de clientes que lo contratan temporalmente, pero siempre está en busca de capturar nuevos clientes y cubrir eventos importantes en empresas. Viendo que la situación económica se encuentra difícil y lo cara que está la vida, la esposa se dedica a ofrecer cosméticos en centros de trabajo, a familiares y amistades. De este modo mantienen a sus dos hijos. Por priorizar otros gastos, no han podido cambiar el techo de la sala de la vivienda, el cual se encuentra rajado y con orificios debido a los años de uso, y hay ciertas láminas de zinc que están flojas debido a los fuertes vientos, por lo cual teme que se le metan a despojarlo de sus pertenecias. Siendo esta una necesidad urgente, el señor solicita un préstamo para cambiar el techo.

loans.use: Purchase of zinc sheets and anti-corrosive paint.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem L., 19, sells beef at the Seri Sorpoant Market, Banteay Meanchey Province. Her husband Tek Bak also sells beef, and together they earn about $30 per day. L. hasn’t had children yet. With her stable business and desire to expand for the future, L. requests a $1,000 loan to purchase more cows and oxen to kill to sell beef. This investment will help expand her business and hopefully increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and oxen

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Casilda is a very diligent person with a desire to get ahead. She started her agricultural activities as a child and recently decided to raise sheep and in little time she improved her stock and her business has been growing by the day. She sells her animals and also shears them after several months. Her main concern is supporting her dear children and this is the reason she wants to increase her investment capital to buy more sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Casilda es una persona muy diligente y con deseos D. superación. Dio comienzo a sus actividades agrícolas desD. niña, y recientemente decidió criar ovejas y en poco tiempo mejoró sus razas, su actividad se ha estado capitalizando y aumentando cada día más, ella venD. sus animales pero a la vez después D. varios meses los trasquila, su mayor preocupación es apoyar a sus amados hijos y por esa razón quiere incrementar su capital D. inversión para comprar más ovejas.

loans.use: Injection of capital to muy more sheep

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 26 year-old Stella M.. She is married, and has a 3-year-old child. In 2006, Stella established her crop wholesaling business. Stella requires a loan to purchase rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ramata D. is a 60 year old widow who lives with her four children in Secoura, a district located in the periphery of the town of Ségou.

She was never schooled due to socio-economic reasons. In order to have a lucrative business, she decided to enroll in a training centre to learn the technique of Bogolan.

With more than 15 years of experience in the production of Bogolan cloth, she is highly sought after by NGOs in the area of training young promoters geared towards filling this gap.

To obtain financial resources for her business, she decided to take part in the solidarity loan association in her district. After 10 rounds of solidarity loans (group loans) with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, she is on her second individual loan after repaying all her previous loans without incident.

She supplies herself in the villages near Ségou and sells her products very generally within the Sinignasigui Cultural Centre.

She intends to use this loan to buy 100 bolts of indigo cloth, 20 bags of "n'galama" leaves, 20 bags of "Pékou" bark, 45 loads of clay, 20 litres of bleach, 1 packet of powdered soap, and 1 box of soap.

She hopes to realize a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA. With this profit, she will contribute to the family expenses (health, education, and food), and she intends to enter the transport business in the future.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Ramata D. est une veuve de 60 ans qui vit avec ses quatre enfants à Secoura un quartier situé à la périphérie de la ville de Ségou.

Elle n’a jamais été scolarisée pour des raisons socio-économiques. Afin d’avoir une activité lucrative, elle décida , de s’inscrire dans un centre de formation pour l’apprentissage de technique du Bogolan ..

Avec plus 15 ans d’expériences dans la confection des tissus Bogolans, elle est beaucoup sollicitée par les ONG dans le cadre de la formation des jeunes promoteurs orientés vers ce créneau porteur.

Pour obtenir des ressources financières pour son activité elle décida d’intégrer une association de crédit solidaire de son quartier. Après 10 cycles de prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.

Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Ségou et vend sa production très généralement dans l’enceinte du Centre Culturel Sinignasigui de Secoura.

Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter : 100 pagnes de tissu indigo ; 20 sacs de feuilles « n’galama » ; 20 sacs d’écorce de « Pékou » ; 45 baignoires d’argile ; 20 litres d’eau de javel ; 1 sachet de savon en poudre et 1 carton de savon.

Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 75 000 CFA. Avec ce bénéfice, elle contribuera aux dépenses de la famille (santé éducation nourriture) et envisage dans l’avenir s’insérer dans le domaine du Transport.

loans.use: To buy raw materials used in the production of "Bogolan" cloth

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Amy S. is a 47 year old woman who lives in the Cite Lamy district of Thies with her family. She has run a small business for more than 5 years, selling breakfasts near her house. With the goal of strengthening her working capital, she is asking for this loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

AMY S. EST UNE FEMME AGEE DE 47ANS ET QUI VIT AU QUARTIER CITE LAMY DE THIES AVEC SA FAMILLE .ELLE FAIT DU PETIT COMMERCE DEPUIS PLUS DE CINQ ANS ET VEND DU PETIT DEJEUNER PRES DE CHEZ ELLE.C'EST DANS LE BUT DE RENFORCER SON FONDS DE ROULEMENT QU'ELLE DEMANDE CE PRET.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson González soltero de 28 años de edad, es de profesión contratista de obras, este oficio se encarga de la contratación de hombres para realizar trabajos de albañilerías siendo el encargado de trabajar con el Arquitecto o Ingeniero para realizar las obras de acuerdo a los planos de estos profesionales. Actualmente cuenta con a 5 albañiles, que de acuerdo a los trabajos que tiene los contrata.

El capital lo obtuvo gracias a largos años de trabajo en Argentina y además trabaja actualmente en sociedad con su tío el Sr. Sixto Reyes con quien asume todos los compromisos.

Ambos tienen casa propia, y viven modestamente gracias al esfuerzo conjunto de llevar adelante su negocio. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de herramientas tales como mezcladora, corta piso, carretilla etc. que permitirán mejorar y agilizar el trabajo y además dar el mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson González is single and 28 years old. He is a contractor. In his job he hires people for construction work and works with the architect or engineer to build what is necessary according to the professional plans. He currently employs 5 construction workers, who he hires on depending on the amount of jobs he has. The start up capital he obtained thanks to the long line of years he worked in Argentina, and he is also currently partnered with his uncle Mr. Sixto Reyes with whom he assumes all the commitments of their work. They both own their own house, and live modestly thanks to their joint effort to get their business ahead. The credit he requests is for the purchase of tools such as a concrete mixer, floor cutter, wheelbarrow, etc. which will improve and speed up the work and improve the service he provides to his clientèle.

Translated from Spanish by Luis Lopez Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing tools such as: wheelbarrow, concrete mixer, floor cutter, etc.

loans.name: Jose Juan

texts.es:
José Juan esta casado, y aprendió el oficio de carpintería de su papa, tiempo después el decidió independizarse para tener ingresos en su propio negocio y poder así ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a su familia, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio y ha aumentado sus clientes.

El necesita un préstamo por US$300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una sierra, con tu ayuda el saldrá delante.
texts.en:
Jose Juan is a married man. He learned the trade of carpentry from his father and decided to branch out on his own to earn his own money from his own business to provide his family with a better quality of life. Slowly his business has been growing and his client base has increased.

He requires a loan in the amount of $300 US, that will be repaid in a term of 6 months. The funds will be used to purchase an electric power saw. With your help he will be successful.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a power saw.

loans.name: Maisara

texts.en: Maisara makes national bread and sells it at the market. She doesn't have much money for her business because flour and other ingredients are getting so expensive. She also has five children in her family. Her husband went to the Russian Federation searching a better paying job so they could feed their family. Maisara wants to borrow money to expand her business so she can provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: Buy flour and other ingredients for making national bread.

loans.name: Tasleem Zahida Mushtaq Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Tasleem Zahida baji is a wife of M. A. and resides in a city named Shah Rukn, Pakistan. Shah Rukn city is  famous for its shrines and hand-made items. Tasleem is 30 years old, mother of six (five sons and one daughter) and owns her own two-room, brick house. Her daughter helps her in her decorative embroidering business. Her elder son works in his father’s spare parts shop where he sells bicycles spare parts. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Tasleem baji makes decorative clothes on order. She is requesting a loan to buy more bicycle spare parts for her husband’s shop. 

She is joined in her loan group by a the following members: Parveen baji requests a loan to buy material (leather and nails) for her shoe making business. Ghazala baji requests a loan to buy edible items (nimko, chips and cookies) for her canteen. Ghulam Fatima baji requests a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread and sketches) for her boutique. Kosar parveen baji requests a loan to buy (flour) for her bread making business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bicycles spare parts

loans.name: Sourou

texts.fr: Né vers 1965 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur  B. Sourou est marié et père de 1 enfant non scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GM SENABLO DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 130 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1,5hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1965 in the district of Kessounou in the town of Dangbo, Mr. Sourou B. is married and the father of one child, who is not enrolled in school. He is a farmer in the village of Glahounsa in the Ouémé valley and is a member of the GM Senablo group of Glahounsa.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the Ouémé River is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay laborers who are indispensible to them in getting their land sown.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Sourou B. has requested a loan of 130,000 F CFA which will allow him to farm about 1.5 hectares, growing the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: farming 1.5 hectares of land, growing maize (corn) and hot peppers

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.en:
Dzifa A. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Denu near Elmina. Dzifa has received primary education. She is married and has 2 children and her husband is a fisherman.

Dzifa has been selling fish since 2001. She spends most of her income on the business since her husband takes care of the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Rasul

texts.ru: Расул 37 летний мужчина, отец троих детей,работает слесарем на заказ.Также он занимается уходом за скотом.У него сейчас 25 коз.Для увеличения числа скота он решил взять кредит.В его отсутствии за скотом ухаживает жена.Но целый день пасёт скот его друг вместе со своими.Жена Расула продаёт вязанные своими руками носки из козьей шерсти.
texts.en:
Rasul T. is a 37 year old man and the father of three children. He works as an on-demand mechanic, and also raises livestock. He currently has 25 goats, and decided to take out a loan to expand the herd. When he is absent his wife takes care of the animals, but a friend tends to them on pasture all day with his own herd. Rasul's wife knits and sells goat hair socks.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is a mother of 4 and she is 30 years old. Blessing sells provisions, wine, and cosmetics in her shop. She learned this business in 2 years and she has been in the business for the past 4 years. Blessing lives in Mebamu in Lagos State, Nigerian. Blessing is requesting the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more wine, provisions, and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and wine to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is 43 years old and married with six children. She lives in Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria.

Esther sells provisions and drinks. She needs a loan in the amount of N120000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all that will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en:
Erdenebat P. lives with his wife and two teenage daughters in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His elder daughter is a student in the National Medical School in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and his younger daughter is a local high school student. 

Erdenebat and his wife have been running a small business retailing meat since 2005. Erdenebat visits herders in the countryside and purchases livestock at a discount whenever he can. Once he brings the livestock home, he slaughters and butchers the meat into small pieces for individual sale. When it has been prepared for market, his wife sells the meat in the local food retail market. 

In the future, he would like to open a large butcher shop. He hopes to be able to afford his daughters' college tuition. He requests a loan to purchase more livestock from herders in the countryside.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock from herders

loans.name: Juanito Genaro

texts.es:
El señor Genaro es esposo de la señora Marcela Añamuri quien es una cliente antigua. En esta oportunidad el señor Genaro es titular del crédito por que su esposa tuvo que dejar su actividad de venta de frutas. Ellos tienen una pequeña hija a quien crían con mucho cariño y dedicación. Don Genaro es chofer propietario, tiene una Vagoneta con la que trabaja en el sindicato “Litoral” de trufi, es un taxi pero con ruta fija. Para la mivilidad es lo que requieren el credito, comprar un acumulador de electricidad (bateria), bujias y realizar un mantenimiento general del vehiculo.
Ellos trabajan con mucha responsabilidad y esmero. Uno de sus principales sueños es poder comprar su casa y ver crecer a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Genaro is the husband of Marcela Añamuri who is a former customer. On this occasion, Genaro is the titular of the loan, because his wife had to leave the fruit business. They have a small daughter who they raise with lots of care and dedication. Don Genaro is a driver and owner of a Vagoneta, with which he works in the “Litoral” line of minibuses, like a taxi but with a fixed route. He needs a loan to buy a battery, spark plugs and do general maintainence of the vehicle.

They work with responsibility and care. One of their biggest dreams is to be able to buy a house and watch their small daughter grow.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a battery and spark plugs

loans.name: Tumejidhatiti Group

texts.en:
Time has been a soap seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Time is 25 years old, married, and cares for three dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Amina, who has her own small business selling charcoal and khanga in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy soap for resale

loans.name: Scola

texts.en:
Scola owns a car (Haice - a Toyota model) for business and a small shop for clothes sales in the Ruaha neighborhood of Iringa. She belongs to Kibwabwa group loan (Group code 2016). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $225. Every day she works at her business for twelve hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale and to do some small maintenance on her car. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Scola is 34 years old, married, and has three children: ages 10, 6 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale and to pay for maintenance on her car

loans.name: Rachabmoh

texts.ru: Тагоева Рачабмох проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 58 лет. Разведена, имеет 9 детей. Рачабмох более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она покупает мелкий и крупно рогатый скот, откармливает и продает. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы закупить скот.
texts.en:
Rachabmoh T. lives in the Varzob district. She is 58 years old, divorced and has 9 children. Rachabmoh has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. She buys small and large livestock, feeds and sells it. Our client is requesting this loan in order to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 48 years old, single and mother of three children; two are in school and one is learning a trade. She prepares and serves wheat porridge in the morning, and she sells that through hawking. Ama switches over in the afternoon with the sale of rice with stew. Her food is very tasty and affordable and, because of that, many buy from her stand. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi, which is a nearby city. She is requesting a loan to buy wheat, rice, vegetables etc. to meet the daily demand of her customers. With her four years experience, she hopes to utilize the loan to make good income for taking care of the children.

loans.use: To buy cereals like wheat, rice, sugar, vegetables, meat etc.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a member of the Kinegamgosi A borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. Her children are 18, 15 and 10. She also cares for two other dependents. 

Rehema started her own cafe business for selling food five years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Shillings (about $130).

This is Rehema’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rehema hopes to do repairs, get more food for her family, pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a member of the Tujikomboe borrower group. She is a 30-year-old woman, is married and is the mother of four children aged 11, 10, 7, and 1 years.

Four years ago, Khadija started her own shop selling cooking oil, rice, etc. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000 TZS.

This is Khadija’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 450,000 in order to buy more commodities for her business.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan, Khadija hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities like cooking oil and rice for her business

loans.name: Mayra Yamileth

texts.es:
la sra. Mayra Yamileth L. tiene 35 años de edad, se dedicaba a la venta de zapatos desde hace varios años, la cliente vendia en un mercado local de comayaguela en la quinta avenida, el jueves 30 de julio hubo un incedio en el cual perdio todo su negocio y quedo completamente calcinado, la perdida fue aproximadamnete de $ 3,750,00 ella solicita el credito a la institucion para comenzar de nuevo ya que no cuenta con un capital para invertir de nuevo en su producto, la alcaldia de Tegucigalpa les va a ayudar a hacer los puestos de venta de madera, y si no es asi, ella va a comenzar a vender como vendedora ambulante por mientras se lo hacen, ella vive con su esposo quien labora en una empresa privada como guardia de seguridad y lo que el gana es para el sustento de los alimentos y la escuelas de sus dos hijas.
Fue bien triste platicar con la cliente ya que se encuentra bien decaida por la perdida de su negocio, su meta a corto plazo es poder comenzar de nuevo con la venta de zapatos ya que viene una temporada alta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mayra Yamileth L. is 35 years old and has been selling shoes for many years. She sold them at a local market on Fifth Avenue in Comayaguela, but she lost her entire business due to a fire on July 30th. Everything was completely reduced to ashes and the loss was approximately $3,750. She is requesting a loan to restart her business since she doesn't have capital to reinvest in more products. The mayor of Tegucigalpa is going to help rebuild the wooden market stalls, but if this doesn't happen, she is going to become a travelling salesperson in the meantime. She lives with her husband who works as a security guard at a private business. Her earnings help provide food and education for her two daughters. It was very sad talking with Mayra because she is in low spirits after the loss of her business. Her short-term goal is to start selling shoes again now that peak season is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes and flip-flops for men, women, and children

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 35 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 4 hijos. Actualmente habitan en la casa de uno de sus familiares, a modo de cuidador. En terrenos alquilados y temporales (según la lluvia) siembra papa, olluco y cebada. Entre todos, prefiere el olluco y la papa; por ello, todos los años alterna dichos cultivos y la cebada es para su consumo familiar. Esta labor la realiza en compañía de su esposo, trabajan removiendo la tierra, quitando las hierbas y fumigando las hojas para lograr cosechar productos de buen tamaño y sin ningún gusano, para que cuando los lleven al mercado no demoren mucho en venderlos. Por ello, Adela siembra confiada tales productos, puesto que sabe que aunque bajen los precios en el mercado la producción en grandes cantidades compensa su inversión.
Este es su 4to crédito consecutivo con MFP y durante este tiempo ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos, por ello se ganó el aprecio de sus compañeros de banco comunal y eso la hace sentirse muy bien. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su siembra de papas en el mes de octubre.
texts.en:
Adela is 35 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother of his 4 children. They currently live in the house of one of their relatives, as caregivers. They farm seed potatoes, olluco (a root vegetable) and barley on leased and temporary (according to the rain) land. Among these, she prefers olluco and potato, which is why every year, she alternates the crops, while the barley is for family consumption. This work is done in partnership with her husband. They work tilling the ground, removing the weeds and spraying the leaves to achieve good-sized harvests with no worms, so that when the bear market arrives they don’t have to wait too long to sell. Therefore, Adela sows the crops confidently, since she knows that even with lower prices at the market, the high volume production compensates her investment. This is their 4th consecutive MFP loan and during this time she has proved timely in her payments, thus earning the esteem of her companions at the community bank and that makes her feel really good. The money that she is asking for now will be invested in buying chemical fertilizers for her seed potatoes in the month of October.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fertilizers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn F. is a 58-year-old woman, who is blessed with three children.  She has a rice farming and hog raising business in Surallah, located in the province of South Cotabato, Philippines.  Evelyn owns a one and a half-hectare rice field, and one sow.  Evelyn started her business in 1968, and she has a good return during harvest time, especially when prices are high. 

Evelyn joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in August 2008.  Today she needs a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI to refinance her business with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: Refinancing

loans.name: Fok Nou Chanje De Grand Basin Group

texts.en:
The “Fok Nou Chanje de Grand Basin” or “We must Change of Grand Basin” Group is a made of twenty male and female entrepreneurs. After hearing about the good things that are happening to other business owners in the area they are happy tom receive their loans. There is a wide variety of businesses in the group from gas for small lamps to oil for cooking, and food to motorcycle and bicycle repair. Ulysse C. is one of four representatives of the group. He is 35yrs old, married, and has one child.
The hardworking father runs a small motorcycle and bicycle repair shop, and also sells parts to other clients and shops in the area. He has two other mechanics that help him with the repairs depending on the work. In retrospect Ulysse says “he wished he joined earlier…because Esperanza wants to help the poor change their situation.” He hopes for a better tomorrow for himself and his family as he strives to grow his business. On behalf of Ulysse, Fok Nou Chanje, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: various bi cycle and motorcycle parts, tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open an Internet café in Cruz Pata

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen L., 24, is married and lives in Phnom Penh City with her husband. She is engaged in the business of selling various kinds of meatballs near her home. Also, she is a skillful tailor who sews shorts and trousers for wholesale to her new and existing customers, earning an income of US$7 per day.

The family is assisted mainly by her husband who provides laundry services to the people in his village, earning an income of US$2 per day to help cover the household expenses.

L. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, L. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase fabrics to expand her current business of sewing. She hopes that her business plan will enable her family to generate more income.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for her tailoring business

loans.name: Souadou

texts.fr: Souadou B. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 7 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE où elle a fait de bonnes performances depuis 7 ans. Elle est vendeuse de fruits et de pâte d'arachide au grand marché hebdomadaire de sa localité. Ses bénéfices lui servent à assurer la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Souadou B., aged 46, is a widow and the mother of seven children for whom she cares. She is a member of the village bank Diaobé, in which she performed well for the past seven years. She sells fruit and peanut butter at the weekly great market of her town. The profit enables Souadou to provide food, health and schooling for her children.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
