La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 14 años atrás del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 60 años de edad, no cuenta con estudios, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos (2 de ellos viven con ella y 4 son independientes).
Sabina se dedica a la compra y venta de frazadas y manà y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital comprando maná y frazadas.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar un toro.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa, comer mejor, y vivir tranquila. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Sabina has been a member of the Communal Bank “Tupac Amaru I” for the past 14 years; she is from the Yunguyo District and Province, in the Puno Department. She is 60 years old, does not have any formal schooling, and is a widow with 6 children (2 of them live with her, and 4 are living on their own). Sabina purchases and sells blankets and Peruvian candy, and tells us that with her first loan of 300 PEN that she requested through the Manuela Ramos Movement she was able to purchase blankets and candy. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN with which she will be able to purchase a bull. Her dream for the future is to own a house, eat better, and live peacefully. What Sabina most enjoys about her Communal Bank is saving, and the meetings with other group members.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Mirian, de 35 años, es una mujer muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en una habitación alquilada y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida.
La actividad que realiza diariamente es la venta de habas saladas, gracias a este negocio a podido darle a su familia el sustento económico que necesitan para vivir. Ella vende sus habas de manera ambulatoria por la calles de Juliaca, su producto es muy delicioso por eso es vendido rápidamente.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede decidir en que momentos trabajar y en que momentos dedicarse a sus otras actividades, lleva 5 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es caminar todo el día por las calles, puesto que el clima no siempre es el más favorable. 
Para más adelante anhela comprar una carretilla donde pueda vender sus habas saladas y otros productos más como maní, papas fritas, etc.

Este es el primer préstamo de Mirian con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagarlo a tiempo y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos. En su banco comunal es muy tranquila, pero siempre participa en las decisiones que toman entre todas las socia. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus habas saladas y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mirian, age 35, is a very sincere and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented room and works very hard to improve her quality of life. She sells salted beans every day. Thanks to this business she has been able to provide for her family's daily needs. She sells the beans on foot in the streets of Juliaca. Her product is very delicious and sells quickly. What she likes best about the work is that she can decide when to work, allowing her to do other things as well. She has been doing this work for 5 years and thinks the most difficult part is walking all day in the streets, because the weather isn't always favorable. In the future, she wishes to buy a wheelbarrow so she can sell salted beans and other snacks like peanuts, french fries, etc. This is Mirian's first loan from MFP and she is eager to make her repayments on time without fail, so that she can continue to receive loans. She is very content in her community bank, because she always participates in the decisions the members make. With the 600 PEN she is requesting, she will buy more ingredients to prepare salted beans and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es:
La señora Demetria es socia del Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” desde hace 13 años atrás, del distrito de Santa Rosa, provincia de El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 57 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudio primaria completa,  ella se dedica a la compra y venta de combustible.

Demetria nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo comprar mas mercadería.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar kerosén, gasolina.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su grifo en Mazocruz.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Demetria has been a member of the Generation 2000 Communal Bank for the past 13 years. She is from the district of Santa Rosa in El Collao province, in the department of Puno. She is 57 years old, married and has 2 children.She completed her primary school studies and works in the purchase and sale of fuel. Demetria says that with the first loan she requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for 300 new soles, she was able to buy more supplies. She is asking for another loan of 1,500 new soles with which she will buy kerosene and gasoline. Her dream for the future is to have her own gas station in Mazocruz. What she likes most about her communal bank is being able to save.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kerosene and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groundnuts

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Juana es casada, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos, Juana tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende cereales, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz y trigo.
Los sueños de Juana son aumentar su mercadería y brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes). She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Juana has a vending post at the April 12th Market where she sells grain. She engages in her business every day.

Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy corn and wheat. Her dreams are to acquire more merchandise and provide a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn & wheat

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa J. farms a small rice field. She is from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato and is living with her relatives because she doesn't have a husband yet.  Now, she is busy raising pigs. She needed additional money to buy piglets and feed. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to support her piggery.

loans.use: Piglets and feed

loans.name: Lilian Akinyi

texts.en:
Lilian Akinyi O. is 27 years old, married, and the mother of one child. After quitting her house help job, Lilian decided to venture into business selling vegetables in Nyalenda, Kisumu, Kenya. She started her business in 2006 to generate income and support her husband in providing for the family.
Lilian dreams of expanding her trade so that she is able to buy a car for her business. For this reason, she decided to join the microfinance program of Kiva partner, K-MET, to expand her business knowledge. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to increase her stock, with the hope of seeing her income grow. With her new profits, she hopes to build her own home, but this does not mean that her dream of buying a car has disappeared!

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: María Estebana

texts.es: María Estebana C. P. de 56 años de edad, reside en Santa Rosa de Lima, ubicado en el departamento de La Unión. Vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 18 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar ultimo año de bachillerato. María posee una venta de ropa interior, escobas, lazos, bolsas con agua y bebidas en lata, venta la cual esta ubicada enfrente de su casa, la cual se encuentra sobre la calle principal del lugar en donde circulan muchas personas a pie, así como también personas en el transporte públicos, lo que permite que su venta sea muy visible para muchas personas. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa, ya que es este el fuerte de su negocio, aumentando las unidades de prendas de vestir comprando mayor cantidad de tallas, estilos y colores con e fin de poder abarcar mayor cantidad de clientes, lo cual será de mucho beneficio tanto para ella como para su familia.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old and lives in Santa Rosa de Lima, which is located in the department of La Unión. She lives with her husband and 18-year-old daughter who is finishing her last year of high school. Maria sells underwear, brooms, ribbon, water bottles and canned drinks. Her store is located in the front of her house, which is located on the main street. There is a lot of foot traffic as well as people using public transportation on the street. This provides a lot of visibility for her business. Marîa is looking for a loan so that she can buy more clothes, as clothes are the best selling item in her business. She would like to buy more sizes, colors and styles of clothes. In this way she will be able to attract more customers. This will benefit both María and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy clothes

location.town: Santa Rosa de Lima, departamento de La Unión

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius K. is forty-six years old, married, and has four children aged between twenty-two and two, and they hope to give their children a good education. His business is located at Malinya in Kakamega and it is well-known by the name 'White Star Dress Making'. He sells dresses and materials to the local people. He has been doing this business for ten years now. 

Julius says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his and so customers are have a lot of choice. He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more materials. He hopes to open a tailoring school in the future and also to buy cows. He is very hard-working and visionary.

loans.use: Materials for resale and dressmaking

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Mrs. Teofista P. is from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old, married, and has three children. Teofista is a PDP-LP member. She owns a sari-sari store (variety store). Her husband is a farmer and sometimes also a laborer. All her children went to school. Teofista has managed her business for one year and earns approximately 3000 a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. This is her first loan from PMPC. She requests a loan of 3000 PHP. This loan will be used to expand her business and to provide additional capital for it. She intends to use the additional revenue generated from the business to help improve her family's standard of living.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her variety store

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion L. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family through her general store business. She lives in So. Dinandan, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Bonifacio, a passenger jeepney driver. They have five children aged between 8 and 21 years old, all of whom currently go to school.
Salvacion has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 PHP.
Salvacion is now borrowing 18,000 PHP to expand her general store business. This will be her seventeenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Salvacion aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her general store business

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Claveles en donde aprendió a ahorrar. Felicitas es casada y tiene 3 hijos. 
Felicitas al inicio viajaba a las ferias y vendía frutas y cereales, actividad que dejo de realizar porque debía de cuidar a sus hijos, actualmente se dedica a la crianza de cuy y a la siembra de papa en sus terrenos de Simbapata, además en el ultimo año inicio con la siembra de maíz negro y salió bien su cosecha. Su préstamo será destinado en la compra de abono. 
Los sueños de Felicitas es construir su casa de material noble pues la que tiene es de material rustico, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y sembrar en mas extensión de tierras.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to the Los Claveles communal bank, where she learned to save up. She is married and has three children. Felicitas used to travel to markets, selling fruit and cereals, but she gave this up to look after her children. Now she raises guinea-pigs and grows potatoes on her plot of land at Simbapata. In the last year she also started growing maize, and had a good harvest. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer. Felicitas' dreams are to improve her house, because hers is built of rough materials; to give her children a good education; and to farm a bigger area of land.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda M. is from the village of Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Minda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Minda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Minda has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Minda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Minda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Minda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hold Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Hold Sorbeh” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Makeni city.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 3,100,000 for the entire group to enable them to further improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured in the left is Fatmata M. who is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in Makeni and she is age thirty-two. She is married to a businessman and the couple has four children, two of whom are in primary school and one in secondary school.

Fatmata sells “rice-bread” (a cake made out of bananas, flour and sugar) and has had over fifteen years of experience in business. With her share of the loan, she will buy ingredients for making rice-bread – sugar and flour – in large quantity so that she will be able to produce a larger quantity of rice-bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to produce a larger quantity of rice-bread

loans.name: Felipa's Group

texts.en: Felipa B. is from the village of Pangalalan. She is 57 years old and is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. Felipa is married and has six adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Felipa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes nació en la comunidad de Cajamarca del distrito de Cachimayo y tiene 40 años. Actualmente, Mercedes vive en la ciudad de misma ciudad junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos. La ciudad de Cachimayo  se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Mercedes se dedica a la venta de comestibles, donde la pueden encontrar los 7 días de la semana, desde las 5 de mañana hasta las 8 de la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de pan. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Juana que espera recibir S/. 1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. 

El banco comunal “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” tiene tres años y medio de funcionamiento, Mercedes pertenece desde hace tres años al banco comunal y le va muy bien. Los socios de este lugar son devotos del Taytacha Ccoyllority (El señor de la Nieve Brillante) y por esa razón le pusieron el nombre al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Mercedes was born in the community of Cajamarca, in the Cachimayo district. She is now 40 years old and lives in the same area, together with her husband and her three children. The town of Cachimayo is 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Mercedes' work is selling food products. She can be found working at her business 7 days a week, from 5 in the morning until 8 in the evening, or until her bread supplies run out. With her next loan, Juana hopes to receive 1000 Peruvian new soles. She would like to use the funds from the loan to buy food products such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. The communal bank “Señor de Ccoyllority Cachimayo” has been operating for three and a half years. Mercedes has belonged to the communal bank for three years, and it is going very well for her. The members from this area are devoted to Taytacha Ccoyllority (The Lord of the Shining Snow), and thus they chose this name for their communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food products such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 28 years old and is married to Annah Wangari. They have one child. His source of income is his motorcycle which he uses to transport people around Naivasha town.  

He started by being employed as a taxi rider before he bought his own motorcycle with his first loan of Kshs 63,000 from KADET.  He paid the loan well and on time.

He is now requesting a second loan with which he will buy another motorbike. He will employ someone else to operate the old one for him. This will greatly increase his daily income.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en: Narantuya L. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two sons. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her son attends a local secondary school. Her husband runs a taxi service to supplement the family income and helps with Narantuya's business. She has been operating a small grocery shop near her home since 1999. She provides a variety of food products to her customers. For the near future, she plans to finish their own rental house and warm garage, which are in the middle of construction process. She is an honest and hardworking person who says, " I'll be relieve after finishing to build our house." Her business progress and earnings have enabled her to greatly improve her family's quality of life. Narantuya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to install a plumbing system for her warm garage.

loans.use: To install a plumbing system for her warm garage

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, on the right, lives in the second largest city of Pakistan, Lahore, known for its history and culture. She is a working woman who operates a business sewing clothes to support her family. She sews for neighboring clients and charges between 100 and 150 PKRs on each dress. Her quality of work brings her customers returning. Her earnings allow her to pay for the utility expenses of her family. She is married to M. Y. who operates a canteen business in the school. He sells food items such as Kabas (made with potatoes) and French fries, and Samosas to students and makes a reasonable income every month. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s canteen business. With the loan her husband will diversify his business by introducing more items such as cold drinks and tea. Nasreen hopes that by doing this her husband will double his income and improve the financial condition of his family.

loans.use: To buy items for canteen business

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en: Jovelyn C. is from the village of Minabang. She is 27 years old. Jovelyn is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jovelyn C.'s Group. Jovelyn is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Jovelyn runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. Jovelyn is working hard to support the needs of her child and of her future children. In 2010, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joyce Nduki

texts.en:
Joyce M., age 47, is married to Peter Muasya and together they have two children, a son aged 13 years and a daughter aged 9 years. She lives at Tala and hawks clothes from Tala market to Kagundo town and from house to house.

Joyce has been running this clothes business for four years and her monthly profit is Kshs 5,000. She uses her little profit to help her husband educate and feed their children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by the loan officer in charge of the Tala office.

Joyce is good at selecting the clothes she is selling to her customer and this has made her customers very proud of the clothes she sells.

After getting this loan, Joyce intends to increase her stock of clothes she is hawking to make more profit.

If the loan boosts the business, Joyce plans that the extra generated income will enable her to rent a house in Tala market where she can do her business instead of moving around.

Joyce is very hardworking and has big dreams for the future.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes for hawking

loans.name: Torbio

texts.en:
Torbio is sixty-seven years old.  He and his wife live in the village Cusupe near Monsefu, in the province of Lambayeque about forty minutes outside of the major city of Chiclayo.  The two maintain a happy and stable home.  They do not have any children that live with them.

Torbio and his wife raise animals in the field behind their home.  They have a wide range of animals, including sheep, rabbits, and guinea pigs.  They raise these animals for their meat and to sell them in local markets.  In addition to raising animals, Torbio's wife makes sombreros which she sells to locals or in regional artisan markets.  At times Torbio will work as a farm hand in order to assist his neighbors and earn extra income for the family.

This will be Torbio's second loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He used the previous loan to expand his herd and purchase feed for his animals.  He is requesting this loan so that he can purchase more sheep and begin to raise more medium sized animals.  He is proud to see his business grow and to better his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante L. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Renante owns and operates a business buying and selling fruit like mangoes, apples, sweet bananas, and watermelon in the local community. Renante has been engaged in his business for over 14 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Renante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renante has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fruit to sell. Renante is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Renante from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Olga Morena

texts.es: Olga Morena G. D. L. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, en donD. vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja vendiendo relojes, y así mismo con dos hijos D. 9 y 11 años D. edad. Olga se dedica a la venta D. ropa para mujeres y hombres, así mismo venD. zapatos y sandalias, y venD. ropa para embarazadas. El negocio se encuentra en el centro D. Ahuachapán, donD. inicia su trabajo desD. las 8 D. la mañana hasta las 6:30 D. la tarD., posee mucha competencia, ya que en este lugar existen diferentes tipos D. ventas, pero en su mayoría son ventas D. ropa en donD. los precios son muy competitivos. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder aumentar su inventario, y D. esta forma contar con el dinero necesario para comprar por mayor para obtener la ropa y los zapatos a precios más bajos y así vender más barato, lo que le permita contar con más clientes, lo que se traduzca en mayores ganancias y un mayor beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en:
Olga Morena Garcia D. L. is 35 years old.  She lives in Ahuachapán department with her husband who sells watches.  She also lives with her two children aged 9 and 11.

Olga sells women's and men's clothes.  She also sells shoes, sandals and maternity clothes.  Her business is located in the center of Ahuachapán.  She starts work at 8.00am and finishes at 6.30pm.  She has a lot of competition since there are a number of different types of sales businesses here.  Most are businesses which sell clothes and their prices are very competitive.  For this reason, Olga is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory and thereby have the necessary money to buy wholesale, obtaining her clothes and shoes at lower prices so that she can sell them more cheaply.  This will bring her more customers which will translate into better profits which will be good for her household.

loans.use: To buy clothes and footwear to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de golosinas, ella distribuye a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes todo tipo de golosinas como caramelos, chupetes, galletas entre otros, la socia trabaja en forma ambulatoria, ella por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to communal bank ¨San Jose de Urubamba¨ which is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. Carmen is a 38 year old single mother of two. She alternates her daily activities between buying and selling candy. She distributes to various grocery stores all types of sweets and candy such as caramels, lollipops and cookies, among others. She works as a traveling saleswoman and attributes her success to her kids. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase larger bulk quantities of candy. She is happy for this loan and promises to repay it with interest.

loans.use: Purchasing bulk quantities of candy

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire owns a beauty products shop. She is 40 years old, and divorced. She has three children who are enrolled in school. She says that her business has done tremendous things and allowed her to purchase things like a TV set, refrigerator, pay school fees and much more. Therefore, she was inspired to request a new loan to add more beauty products in her shop. With the profits from this business she will reinvest. In the future, she has zeal to create a cooperative of a large number of people for a better working environment.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” AHORRO ES PROGRESO – SAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Saylla, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; ella tiene 35 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en una chicharroneria cerca de su casa a la socia le gusta mucho este tipo de negocio el cual ya sabe cómo administrarlo a raíz de eso es que la socia desea a perturar su propio negocio trabajar para ella y no para otros desea empezar ahora y de esta manera seguir haciendo lo que le gusta pero de forma independiente para así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su propio negocio como mesas y sillas y otras cosas más  que le faltan.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel, 35, is a member of the “AHORRO ES PROGRESO-SAYLLA” (Savings Means Progress-Saylla) communal bank located in Saylla district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has three children.  She works in a chicharronería (fried pork shop) near her house.  She likes this type of business very much and already knows how to run it.  Because of this she wants to open her own shop so that she can work for herself and not for others starting now to do what she likes but independently to provide a better quality of life for her children and family.

She requests the loan to set up her own business with tables, chairs and other items she needs.

She is happy with the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: She needs the loan to set up her own business with tables, chairs and several other items she needs.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa, 53, is widowed and lives with her two daughters and a niece in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a house that they purchased with a loan from the bank in 2010. Her older daughter works for a company as a microbus driver, and her younger daughter works as a translator for the same company. 

Tsetsegmaa operated a shoe repair service shop between 1998 and 2007 while she was living in Darhan, the second biggest city in Mongolia.  Then she came to Bayanhongor, her hometown, where she currently lives. She started a retail business selling used Korean clothing at a local market.  Her working capital was 1,500,000 MNT when she first started her business, and now it exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. With revenues from her business, she bought a kiosk that she currently uses to operate her thrift shop. 

She wants to expand her business and diversify the types of goods that she sells. Tsetsegmaa is a hardworking person who says, "I want to finish paying off my home loan in the near future." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more old clothing to sell at her thrift shop.

loans.use: To purchase more old clothing

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar, 31, is married and lives with his wife in a house that they own in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife currently works for an NGO. Uuganbayar began operating a PC game center in 2007. Now he has a photography studio that he began operating in 2009. He learned the Photo Shop program when he used to operate his PC game center. 

Uuganbayar wants to continue his business and expand it further. He is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to upgrade some of his tools and to purchase a printer and scanner. Uuganbayar is a hardworking and proactive person who is trying hard to have a bigger photo studio. His wish is to have his own place where he can operate his photography studio and computer business.

loans.use: To purchase a printer and scanner

loans.name: Sá's Group

texts.en: Five people make up the group loan. Mrs. Sá was born in 1967, and she is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She earns her living by selling sugar cane. Currently her sugar cane business has finished, because she doesn’t have any more sugar cane for selling. Thus in order to get more income from outside sugar cane, she would like to start a new business. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy thread and silk to weave and sell. Her husband, Mr. Phat, is a worker who is able to earn a small salary to support his family. This couple has four children who all are students and also help their mother with her businesses.

loans.use: To buy thread and silk.

loans.name: Help Sisters Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Help Sisters” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, earn more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sereh S.. Sereh is 30 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a teacher. Sereh sells foods, such as peppers, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, onions, etc. She has been selling these items for many years. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy peppers, margi, salt, onions, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: To purchase peppers, margi, salt, onions, etc.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S. is 41 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish and vegetables in the Phsar Leur market for more than four years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Duch Saroun, 43, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community. 

Currently, this family's life has been disrupted because their house is broken. Because of this reason, Sem S. has requested a loan in order to buy planks and zinc to cover the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy planks and zinc to cover the roof of her house

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en:
Chosen by the other members, Mrs. Chum is the village bank president for this village bank loan composed of eight people. Mrs. Chum's husband, Mr. Sun, is a Khmer cake seller and fisherman who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. This couple has five children, three of whom are laborers, one a seamstress, and one a farmer.

Mrs. Chum, a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she grows various vegetables for a living, is now requesting a loan to enable the cultivation of a greater variety of vegetables. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fishing supplies to support her husband's fishing.

loans.use: to cultivate a variety of vegetables.

loans.name: El Museo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Museo lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es Ileana Z. Chavarría de 32 años quien hace cinco años inicio vendiendo frescos y comida de las ganancias instalo una pequeña venta en la que invertirá el crédito con la compra de granos básicos, carne…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Flor de María S. de 58 años desde hace 7 años tiene una tortillería y Joaquina Avilés Gonzales de 50 años desde hace 3 años tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The 'Museo' (Museum) group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women from Managua.  The group's coordinator is 32 year-old Ileana Z. Chavarría, who started selling soft drinks and food five years ago.  With her profits, she set up a small sales location.  She will invest her loan in her business, buying basic grains, meat, etc.

The other members of the group are 58 year-old Flor de María S. who has owned a tortilla bakery for seven years, and 50 year-old Joaquina Avilés Gonzales who has owned a grocery store for three years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been a businessman operating a hotel for the last five years. He is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. Being this is his first loan, he planned to purchase goods, such as sugar, maize flour and tea leaves, for the hotel and furnish his business premises. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in the business and invest in farming.

Joseph’s dreams are to be the best and a well-known businessman in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of goods for the hotel

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.en:
Juan Bautista, Maria Estela, and Raul from San Lorenzo, Honduras formed the Emanuel Solidarity Group. As part of this group they will collectively serve as guarantors for each other’s loans. 

Juan Bautista, who is 49 years old, married, and has two children, has operated a convenience store for the past 10 years, selling refreshments, basic foodstuff, and personal hygiene products. He has had three previous loans, all of which he used to invest in and grow his convenience store business. Juan Bautista is currently requesting a loan of HNL 8,000 which will be used to purchase merchandise for his store. He is very grateful for the previous financing he has received and aspires to continue expanding his business. 

Raul is 58 years old, married, and lives with his wife and granddaughter in a house he built himself 19 years ago. He operates a small convenience shop, selling basic foodstuff, refreshments, and household cleaning products. Raul is requesting a loan of HNL 5,000 with which he will buy additional merchandise to sell in his store. 

Maria Estela is 31 years old and married with five children. She has been selling tortillas from her home for the past two years, working seven days a week. Maria Estela gets up early every morning to grind the cornmeal that she uses to make fresh tortillas. This will be her first loan, and she is requesting HNL 5,000 to purchase corn, firewood, and lime—three essential inputs used to make fresh tortillas. Her dream is to eventually invest in a machine for making tortillas.

loans.use: To purchase snacks, sodas, juices, meats, cheeses, butter, salt, fruits, vegetables, cornmeal, light bulbs, candles, hygiene products, household cleaners, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Suhey  Esther

texts.es:
Suhey de 35 años,es originaria de la ciudad de Leon ,esta casada es madre de dos hijos,ella es licenciada en Farmacia, es dueña de una pulperia. Ella empezo con este negocio hace 3 años con un capital de $300 dolares los cuales se lo habia prestado su hermano,ella compro un pequeño estante,una mesa ,productos comestibles de consumo masivo,despues hizo otros prestamos y fue incrementando poco a poco su inventario de esta manera ella pudo adquirir activos fijos tales como vitrinas ,refrigeradora . Ademas su esposo la ayuda con un negocio que el tambien tiene el es dueño de un cyber cafe que le genera otra fuente de ingreso para su familia.Ella solicito el prestamo para comprar granos basicos tales como arroz,frijoles,azucar,aceite,productos de consumo masivo diario que los clientes demandan diariamente.Esta inversion en su inventario le ayudara a crecer su negocio,mejorar sus ingresos, ella dice que le permitara invertir tambien en compra de nuevos productos tales como pollo y carne comprar al por mayor productos de facil rotacion de venta. 
Ella en lo futuro quiere convertir su pequeña pulperia en una miscelanea(distribuidora),tambien establecer una pequeña farmacia.Su mejorar su negocio hacerlo sostenible,comprar un vehiculo para trabajo y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
35 year-old Suhey is from the city of Leon.  She is married and has two children.  Suhey has a pharmacy degree.  She owns a grocery store.  She started out in this business three years ago with $300 worth of capital which her brother loaned her.  She bought a small shelf, a table and some essential groceries.  She took out other loans and gradually increased her inventory.  In this way, she was able to acquire fixed assets such as display cases and a refrigerator.  Suhey's husband helps her with a business that he runs.  He owns an Internet cafe which is another source of income for their family.

Suhey requested this loan to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, sugar, oil and essential household products which her customers ask for every day.  This investment in her stock will help her to grow her business and improve her income.  She says that it will also allow her to invest in new products such as chicken and meat and buy products that have an easy sales turnover wholesale.

In the future, Suhey would like to turn her small grocery store into a general store.  She would also like to set up a small pharmacy.  She would like to improve her business and make it sustainable, buy a vehicle for her work and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en:
Auntie sells smoked tilapia, salted tilapia and onions at a market called Jukwa market near Abura. Auntie has received a senior high education. She is divorced and has 2 children.

She sees to the well-being of the home with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke for resale.

loans.use: to buy more fish to smoke for resale

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer trabajadora de 32 años de edad. Ella vive en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque y goza de buenas referencias personales por ser empeñosa en la labor que realiza.

Mercedes se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral y cerdos, desde hace 3  años. Conoce su negocio a la perfección y cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Mercedes tiene muchos deseos de superación y se esmera en su trabajo para poder cumplir su meta principal que es mejorar su calidad  de vida.

Mercedes solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y el alimento balanceado que estos requieren. Además, arreglará su corral para darle una mejor crianza a sus cerdos y aves, con ello incrementará la producción de su negocio.

Mercedes es una clienta antigua de nuestra institución y cuenta con un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a hard-working, 32 year-old woman who lives in the rural part of Lambayeque district.  She has good personal references owing to the effort that she puts into her work.

Mercedes' business is raising and selling poultry and pigs.  She has been in this business for three years and knows it like the back of her hand.  She already has an established customer base in her area.  Mercedes has a great desire to do well and she does her work carefully so that she can achieve her main goal of improving her quality of life.

Mercedes is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals and the balanced feed that they need.  She will also fix her pen so that she can better raise her pigs and birds.  This will help her to increase her production.

Mercedes is a long-standing client of our institution and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed, and to fix her pen

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo, 57 years old, is married to a farmer with four grown-up children. Her family lives in the Philippines, their native land. She has operated a "sari sari store" (a community-based store) to make a living for her family for almost a year.   

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy different groceries such as canned goods and drinks to sell in her store. She dreams of seeing improvement in the business five years from now. Her business monthly income is usually spent to maintain their immediate needs at home.

loans.use: to buy different groceries such as canned goods and drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, a 26-year-old married mother of one, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for the past seven years. A member of HSPFI since 2010, she has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy more beverages, canned goods and snacks to sell. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Juan Daniel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Juan tiene 19 años de edad,  el socio es soltero; el socio trabaja junto a su mamá con la preparación de extras, el socio trabaja con la madre cocinando en el mismo restaurante, el socio estudia cocina en un instituto particular, el está estudiando para cheff; el socio desea invertir el crédito en el pago de sus mensualidades de estudio, el socio invertirá el crédito en el pago de sus estudios de cocina.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan belongs to the communal bank "Siempre Unidos."  This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the Virgen Asunta market in the province and department of Cusco.

Juan is 19 years old and single.  He works with his mother making food that he has special orders for.  He works alongside his mother cooking in the same restaurant.  He is studying cooking in a private educational center.  He is studying to become a chef, and he wants to use the loan to pay his tuition.  He will invest this loan to pay for his cooking school.  He is grateful for the support that is being granted, and so is committed to making his loan payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to pay his culinary school tuition

loans.name: Duarte

texts.es: Duarte de 33 años de edad, natural de la  ciudad de Santa Rosa, él es un hombre soltero y vive en su propia casa construido a base de material rustico madera y techo de calamina. Duarte con tanto esmero logró volver sus parcelas en áreas verdes, rodeado de árboles frondosos a la vez cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y raíces de barbasco. Dicha actividad lo viene realizando durante 10 años, y además cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros; menciona además que desde muy niño aprendió a labrar la tierra gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres y hoy trabaja sobre sus propias tierras. Su producto más rentable es la venta de raíces de barbasco, porque los vende al por mayor y menor a las empresas elaboradoras de insecticidas y fungicidas. Gracias a los ingresos obtenidos logró comprar mas espacios de terreno y una mototaxi donde trasporta sus productos. Los meses de agosto a octubre son tiempos donde mayormente se siembra todo tipo de semillas, razón por la cual Duarte acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar sus prestamos y llevar consigo uno de sus propósitos, sembrar más raíces de barbasco. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo mas espacios de terreno para así sobresalir de la pobreza. Este será su primer crédito y esta muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su proyecto planeado. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles, comprará más semillas de barbasco.
texts.en:
Duarte is 33 years old and a native of the city of Santa Rosa.  He is single and lives in his own house built from rustic wood, with a metal roof. With great care, he has managed to turn his land into a verdant place, surrounded by leafy trees and cocoa plants, coffee plants, and barbasco root.

He has been doing this for 10 years, and also has the support of laborers.  He also mentions that when he was a small child he learned to work the land, thanks to the teachings of his parents, and now works on his own land.

His most profitable product is barbasco root, because he sells it to companies that use it to make insecticides and fungicides.

Thanks to the income he has earned, he has managed to buy more land and a mototaxi, which he uses to transport his products.

In the months of August through October, his main activity is planting all types of seeds; for this he has sought a loan to be able to carry out the planting of more barbasco seeds.  The plan he has in mind is to continue planting and buying more land so that he can overcome poverty.

This will be his first loan, and he is very happy to know that he will have financial support, as this way he will feel secure in going forward with his plans.  With the 2,500 nuevos soles, he will buy more barbasco seeds.

loans.use: to buy barbasco seeds.

loans.name: Pleav

texts.en: Pleav, 46 years old, is a pig feeder who earns $5 per day. Her husband is a road repairer who earns $5.50 per day. They have two children, both of whom are studying. Every month, she has to spend $99 on food, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy pigs to feed. This loan can help her family to have enough money to buy pigs to feed because they don’t have enough money to buy them. If they borrow from their neighbor, they have to pay a lot of interest. She plans to feed more pigs when she earns a good profit this time. For her children, she wants to help them to study at the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 27-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling distilled alcohol in Kator, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.
Julia requested this loan through Kiva partner, BRAC South Sudan, with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more distilled alcohol for sale.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en:
Tofiq is 30 years old. He is married and the father of two children. Tofiq is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. 

Tofiq has been in the agriculture business for more than five years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. His loving wife is also engaged in this business. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money for the well-being of his family. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN).

loans.use: to purchase organic seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dilara's Group

texts.en: Dilara is the leader of this group. She is 33 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and a son. The son studies at school and the daughter is preschool age (under 7). In order to earn money for the family's livelihood, Dilara takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national blankets and pillows. She invests the profits gained from this activity in livestock. Dilara applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase hay to feed the livestock during the winter season. In the future, she plans to finish the house construction. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for livestock.

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi is a married man with two children who are still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has piped water and he pays electricity bills. For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators in the area. He dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future.

With this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, vegetables and rice. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, vegetables and rice.

loans.name: Harris

texts.en:
Harris had been operating a motorcycle transport service in his village for three years. He is 30 years old and married to Imee but the couple have not been blessed with a child. They are praying to have a child soon. 

Income generated from his business is just enough to cover their expenses for meals and the monthly electric bill. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy gasoline and for the maintenance of the motorcycle. He is facing financial difficulties at this moment so he needs additional capital.

In the future, he wants to improve his services and acquire a good income to continuously operate the smooth flow of his operation.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en:
Cipriano, who is 55 years old, married to Gloria, and has two young children, completed a vocational course in photography and established a photography business to serve as his primary source of income. Providing services to weddings, birthdays and christenings, he usually earns about P30,000 monthly. Part of his income serves as revolving capital, while another part pays for the allowances and matriculation fees of his children.

Now requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy photo papers, film, albums and frames, Cipriano hopes to further develop his business and keep satisfying his customers.

loans.use: to buy photo paper, film, albums and frames for use in his photography service.

loans.name: Jhony Emmanuel

texts.es:
Jhony reside en el departamento de Masaya, es casado y tiene la edad de 24 años, su núcleo familiar es de 3 personas y posee su propio negocio de ventas de celulares de todo tipo.

Su clientela pertenece a Masaya y una parte de Managua. Actualmente esta teniendo mucha demanda más por la temporada navideña por lo que se acerca a Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo que le ayudara a incrementar su negocio y por ende sus ventas. El crédito lo usará para la compra de teléfonos celulares, entre los que menciona Nokia 6120, Claros sencillos, Movistar, Sony Ericsson w580, Blackberry Perla.

Considera que este financiamiento es de mucha ayuda porque le proporciona una mejor condición de vida por los ingresos que obtendrá.
texts.en: Jhony lives in the department of Masaya, Nicaragua. He is married and is 24 years old, and his nuclear family is three people. He has his own business selling all kinds of cellular phones. His clientele comes from Masaya and a part of Managua. Currently, he is experiencing very high demand due to the Christmas season, so he is turning to Kiva partner Ceprodel to request a loan to help him expand his business and, in turn, his sales. He plans to use the loan to purchase cell phones, specifically mentioning, Nokia 6120, Claros Sencillos, Movistar, Sony Ericsson w580 and Blackberry Pearl devices. He thinks this loan will be very helpful because he can improve his living conditions with the profits he'll make.

loans.use: to purchase cellular phones, including Nokia 6120, Movistar, Sony Ericsson w580 and Blackberry Pearl devices.

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
El Sr Aldo es soltero, tiene 26 años, vive con su Papa en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo,su Mama y Hermana están trabajando en España. El es un joven muy trabajador y emprendedor, que no tiene miedo a ningún tipo de trabajo.
Nos comenta que hace 5 años tiene una ferretería en su domicilio el cual mantiene con la ayuda de su papa mientras el trabaja en otras cosas. Cuenta que la mejor manera de ganar clientela es tratarle bien a la gente.
El Sr agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza puesto en su persona. El solicita el crédito para abastecer su ferretería con caños, mangueras y demás articulos para sanitarios.
texts.en:
Aldo is single, twenty-six years old, and lives with his father in the city of Coronel Oviedo. His mother and sister work in Spain. He is a hard-working and energetic young man that is not afraid of any type of work.
He tells us that he has had a hardware shop in his home for the past five years, which he maintains with the help of his father while he does other work. He says the best way to win customers is to treat all people well.
Aldo is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the confidence it has placed in him. He requests the loan to supply his hardware shop with pipes, hoses, and other bathroom items.

loans.use: to purchase pipes, hoses, and other bathroom items.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline is age 36 and married with 3 children who are between 15 and 1 years old. He has been in farming for four years and currently employs two farmhands on his farm. He produces cabbages, maize and passionfruit for the local market. He runs a butchery business in addition to farming.

Frankline has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him boost his farming by buying irrigation pipes to ensure he has constant water supply on his farm. He is optimistic his farming income will grow and enable him to educate his children.

He says the challenge is unpredictable weather conditions resulting in crop failure.

loans.use: To buy irrigation pipes

loans.name: Todos Juntos Podemos 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group, Todos juntos podemos, "All together we can" 1, 2 & 3. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The group is composed of 15 micro entrepreneurs dedicated to selling miscellaneous products, by walking or from their house. Marie makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children, being a single mother for many years. She is dedicated to working hard to provide her house income for clothing, food, education and other things.

Marie is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing for women and kids and some pairs of shoes. She will use her business profits to save and build her house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: 4 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “4 DE AGOSTO” iniciará el ciclo vigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Filomena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, frituras de habas y postres, venta de cosméticos, tejidos, venta de deportivos, venta de CD’s y alquiler de vajillas, venta de verduras, venta de regalos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Filomena es una integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hermana que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, ella nos cuenta que este negocio lo inicio con el primer prestamos que se hizo de nuestra institución y en actualidad le va muy bien gracias a la ayuda de su familia 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar, fideos, etc.) que comprará de las comerciantes que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el prestamos inmediato y los consultorios.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora Martha porque fue a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The lending club "4 de agosto" will begin their 26th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focus group of Cascada. There are 8 members and have a board of directors led by the president Filomena. The members have various business like a corner shop, fried beans and desserts, cosmetics sales, tissues, athletic clothing sales, CD sales and rental of dishware, vegetable sales and gift sales.

The loan will benefit these small-business owners, including Filomena. She has been a part of Proj Mujer for 3 years, joining at the invitation of her sister who is a partner in the institution. Currently she has a corner store. She tells us that she started this business with the first loan from the institution and it's going well thanks to her family's help. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital by purchasing sugar, noodles, etc that merchants will buy in bulk to sell in their stores. This work will allow her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she is married and has 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the immediate loans and the consults.

In the picture, Martha is missing because she was at a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret  is married with three children and only one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 20 years.  She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  She works at the market and works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 22. She is not married and lives with her family. Maria is a volunteer in her nearby secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide. She is involved in buying and selling clothes outside her home, where she hangs up clothes because she doesn't have a frame. Maria requests a loan from Kiva to find a stable room for her business and to increase the amount of clothes. Her main challenge is getting enough capital. The profit from the loan will be used to expand her shop by buying enough clothes.

loans.use: to find a stable room for her business

loans.name: Nadjegueton  A Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  NADJEGUETON A sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Flazambougou, un des villages de la ville de  Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso enfin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. lls sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Monsieur Moulaye en troisième position de la gauche vers le droite  sur la photo, il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 350.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et payer les frais de labour

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
My Name is Julia and I sell used clothes around many different districts in my city.

I've been doing this for several years. I recently acquired a car which will help me be less tied to selling out of my house and will enable me to travel to the busiest places where I can sell the most clothes.

Now I need a loan to enable me to buy more used clothes that I can sell with my increased mobility.

loans.use: Compra de fardos de ropa clasificada y otros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Florence would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business of selling used clothes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria E. is 38 years and is married with three children. She has a chemist store where she sells drugs and treatment to people. She worth N150, 000 good and needs $450 to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more drugs

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
A 41-year-old widow with 5 children, Mrs. Phen N. lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 
To supplement her family income, she rents different rooms of her house to the people in her community, earning around $5 each day. Four of her children work for a private company, and their salaries also help to pay for some of the household expenses. Mrs N. is seeking a $600 loan to be used to build more rooms so that she can generate additional profits from her room rental business.

loans.use: To build more rooms to accommodate more tenants.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
I am a widow and the mother of four children. My eldest son is a turner and the breadwinner of our family. My daughter and I make jewelry tassels on order from a jewelry shop.

A couple of years ago, I took out a loan for my son's turning business. The business grew better and increased our household income. Now my son needs to buy a lathe (a machine which is used to turn and shape metal objects) for which I require a loan of US$ 550.

loans.use: buy a lathe for my son's metal-working business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sari

texts.id:
As wife of a tenant farmer husband, Ni Ketut Sari is expected to help her husband to increase family income. Farming and opening a kiosk is her choice occupation, since in that business she could still be a house mother. Kiosk business has been her occupation for a while, however results is far from maximal. Starting from selling few family items main needs, Ni Ketut Sari plans to increase the items for sale so that her customers could get it readily from her kiosk. From the Rp4000,000 (about US$420) capital, Ni Ketut Sari could sell Rp200,000 (about US$ 21), at a nett profit of Rp15,000 (US$1.60). With the requested additional loan to Dinari, Ni Ketut Sari hopes to add capital that she could turn around, and profit could double today's. Therefore it would increase family's income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai istri dari suami yang bekerja sebagai seorang petani , Ni Ketut Sari dituntut untuk mampu membantu suami dalam hal menambah pendapatan keluarga. Bertani sekaligus membuka usaha warung merupakan pilihan hidup yang dia jalani, karena dengan usaha itu ia masih dapat mengerjakan semua aktifitas sebagai ibu rumah tangga. Usaha warung sudah lama dia tekuni, akan tetapi belum mampu memperoleh hasil yang maksimal. Berawal dari menjual beberapa macam kebutuhan pokok keluarga , Ni Ketut Sari berencana menambah macam barang yang akan ditawarkan agar pelanggan yang membutuhkan barang akan dapat tersedia di warungnya. Dari Modal Rp. 4.000.000.- yang dia punya selama ini setiap harinya Ni Ketut Sari mendapat penjualan sebesar Rp. 200.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih Rp. 15.000,-. Dengan penambahan modal yang diajukan ke DINARI Ni Ketut Sari berharap akan bisa menambah modal yang akan diputar kembali dan keuntungan yang diperoleh akan dapat meningkat 2 kali lipat dari sekarang. Jadi dengan demikian jelas akan dapat meningkatkan pendapatan keluarganya.

loans.use:
To add business capital

Menambah modal usaha

loans.name: Cirilia

texts.es:
Cirila is single and has one adult daughter, who works with her in a pharmacy that she owns. The business is ten years old and she tells us that it is going very well.

Cirila is asking for a loan as she wishes to buy stock (medication, make-up, cream, soap etc.) in large quantities. Purchasing them in this form gives an 8% discount on the merchandise, which will help to ensure that her prices are better than those of the competition!

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Cirila es Soltera tiene una hija mayor de edad y que trabaja junto con ella en una farmacia que ella posee. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de 10 años y nos cuenta que les va muy bien.

Cirilia solicita el crédito ya que desea comprar mercaderías (medicamentos, maquillajes, cremas, jabones, etc.) en grandes cantidades, pues adquiriendo de esta forma le conceden un descuento de 8% sobre las mercaderías, lo que le ayuda a que sus precios puedan ser mejores que los de la competencia.

loans.use: Purchase medication, make-up, creams, soap etc.

loans.name: Yung

texts.en: Mrs. Yung S., age, 36, works selling make-up products and perfume, earning around $5 each day of profit. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver making only $1.60 per day. They have five children: one is employed by a factory; one is a make-up artist; and the rest are enrolled in school. She would like to request this loan of $800 of to purchase more make-up products to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more make-up products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Virginia Oralia

texts.es:
Mrs Virginia G. is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. She sells clothes at a stand in the City’s main market. She has been selling clothes for 13 years and now owns two market stands.

She is 41 years old; she is married and has 5 children that also help her with the business. Her husband has a car and helps her to transport the clothes from her home to the market.

She sells a great variety of clothes for children, men and women. Now she wants to use the loan to buy summer clothes.

Her objective is to keep on growing as a business woman and to create new sources of employment.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Virginia G., es una señora muy emprendedora y trabajadora, sobresaliendo con su familia en una venta de ropa, ubicado en un mercado de la ciudad capital; tiene 13 años de vender en su puesto, actualmente cuenta con 2 puestos iguales, tiene 5 hijos, los cuales le ayudan en los puestos que ella tiene.

Es de edad de 41 años, es casada, igual su esposo, le ayuda con un carro donde transporta la mercaderia, del mercado a su casa. Cuenta con ropa para vender, de niño, niña, mujer y hombre, en gran variedad, pero ella quiere aprovechar la época del verano para adquirir ropa.

Tiene su visión puesta en seguir creciendo como empresaria, y crear nuevas fuentes de trabajo.

loans.use: To buy summer-clothes for children, women and men

loans.name: Vimla's Group

texts.en:
My name is Vimia G.. I was married 21 years ago and have four children: one girl and three boys. I reside with my family in Lahore, Pakistan, where my husband operates a catering business, providing his services at a variety of functions, including weddings. It is now the high season and in order to promptly respond to the many catering orders we will receive, we need loan assistance.

The loan will be disbursed to my group fellows as well so that they can also improve their businesses. Saima is borrowing to fix her husband’s rickshaw; Nasreen embroiders clothes; Allah R. will invest her share of the loan to improve her family’s barber shop, and Khursheed B. needs this loan for her grocery store. The dream of each of these members is to get out of poverty. They simply want to escape from the clutches of a reality that does not allow them to develop to their full potential.

loans.use: To expand the catering business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is forty-two years old and the mother of six children. Three of her children are in school. She prepares and sells local dishes like banku (a meal prepared from milled maize, eaten with palm nuts or peanut soup) and fufu (boiled cassava and plantain or cocoyam pounded together, and it is eaten with all kinds of local soups). These traditional foods are very popular for most Ghanaians and therefore the demand for such meals is high. Fautina wants to use her loan to buy more bags of cassavas, plantains, cocoyams, meat, and vegetables to expand her operation. She is a member of the called “Eye Nyame” (meaning It Is God). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan. Her photo was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To more bags of maize, cassavas, plantains, cocoyams and vegetables.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Sophia M.. She is married and has two children, ages one month and 8 years.

In 2000, Sophia established her cushions and clothing business. Sophia needs a loan to expand the range of clothing and cushions in her store. She thanks you for your support.
