SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing and cushions.

loans.name: Komla Mensah

texts.fr:
Komla Messah A. was born on June 21, 1977. He is single, and his main business is the sale of a local beverage made from palm wine. He started this business in 2002. He imports this beverage from the village of his birth, MESSIWOBE. This initial loan that he is requesting will enable him to buy ten drum of the local beverage and one box of non-alcoholic beverages.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Komla Messah est né le 21 juin 1977. Il est célibataire et a pour activité principale la vente de boisson locale préparée avec du vin de palme. Il a commencé cette activité depuis 2002. Il importe cette boisson depuis son village natal MESSIWOBE. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 bidons de boisson locale et 1 carton de boisson non alcoolisée.

loans.use: To buy the local beverage

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Before her Esperanza Bank of Hope loan, Daisy had a business selling water in her Boca Chica community.  Now, just two loans later, she runs a school for children of the community.  It currently teaches 40 students 6 days a week.  The school has the help of 6 volunteers, who help with preparing juice and conducting lessons, but Daisy would like to expand the business by hiring employees with future loans.  Her school is a prime example of the improvements microlending can bring to communities as well as to individual borrowers.

loans.use: Refugio Infantil Comunitari Tia Daisy (school)

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirta, es una señora de 42 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños.

Durante las festividades del 8 de Diciembre en que en nuestro país se conmemora el día de la Virgen de Caacupé y es un feriado nacional, ella comenta de que posee buen movimiento de ventas, ya que su negocio está ubicado a en e1 centro mismo de la ciudad y durante los meses próximos a esa fecha la ciudad recibe muchos visitantes.

Las ropas de mayor movimiento son las zapatillas, shorts, remeras y los jeans. El préstamo que solicita en esta ocasión lo invertirá en la compra de remeras para caballeros, damas y niños, vestidos para fiestas de muy buena calidad.

Mirta, tiene un proyecto a corto plazo que es la de ampliar su negocio con la diversificación de sus productos incorporando mas estantes de vidrio del modelo exhibidor, tiene pensando llenarla con productos de platería y perfumería.
texts.en:
Mirta is a 42 year old woman. She is married and she has two children. She is the proprietor of a business that focuses on selling all types of clothing for women, men, and children. During the festivities of December 8th, that in our country commemorates the day of the Virgin of Caacupé and is a national fair, she told us that she has good turnover, and that her business is located in the center of the city and the next few months from this date she gets many visitors. The clothing that has the best turnover are shoes, shorts, jackets, and jeans. The loan that she is asking for on this occasion is to invest in the purchase of jackets for men, women, and children, very good quality clothing for parties. Mirta has a short term project to grow her business with the diversification of her products, incorporating a glass exhibition counter; she has thoughts that she will fill it with products of silver and perfume.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for men, women, and children

loans.name: Siempre Alegres (Forever Happy) Group

texts.es:
La   asociación “siempre Alegres” ha encontrado oportunidad de negocio en la fruta, de la diversidad de frutas que produce la localidad de Caranavi (provincia  de La Paz). Ellas adquieren productos de los productores,  para luego, en algunos casos venderlos al detalle y en otros casos, convertir  éstos frutos en riquísimos  jugos y zumos naturales que los comercializan en mercados de la ciudad de El Alto. 
La asociación siempre alegres se reúne en el centro focal de Villa Adela, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Felipa Agostopa es la líder del grupo, cuenta que  trabajan con la institución de Pro-Mujer hace mas de siete años y la situación económica de sus hogares a mejorado notablemente desde que reciben el apoyo de dicha institución. Actualmente desean ampliar sus ventas por lo que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de fruta en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The "Siempre Alegres" (Forever Happy) association has found its business opportunity in the fruit business, because of the diversity of fruits produced in the Caranavi locality in the Province of La Paz. They buy products from the producers, then, in some cases, sell them retail and in other cases, convert the fruit into very rich natural juices and nectars that are sold in the markets of the city of El Alto. The "Siempre Alegres" association meets in the Villa Adela town center, located in the city of El Alto. Felipa Agostopa is the group leader. They have been working with the Pro-Mujer (Pro-Woman) institution for the last seven years, and the economic situation of the members has noticeably improved since they have received the help of this institution. Currently they want to increase their sales, for which they need increased capital to purchase larger quantities of fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need capital to purchase greater quantities of fruit.

loans.name: Rashma

texts.en:
Rashma M. is a resident of Tikhidewal. Tikhidewal is located in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses.

Mrs. M. lives in a single-family home with her husband and two daughters. Her husband's name is Mr. Sanu Babu M., and he works in a catering shop. Both of her daughters are studying in preschool.

Mrs. M. is a grocery shopkeeper in Tikhidewal. She opened her grocery shop a few months ago in hopes of improving the living standard of her family. She sells different types of groceries in her shop, like rice, maize, paddy, noodles, and so on. Mrs. M. is requesting her first loan of Rs. 10000.00 ($150.00) to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy goods for grocery shop

loans.name: Agness F.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Agness F. N. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 10 and 20. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependents because they are street children.

Agness has been running a milk business since 1998. Her business is selling milk from her cows to individual consumers. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Agness currently earns about $60 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $425 in order to buy more cows so that she can get more profit by selling more milk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Agness thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more cows so that she can get more profit by selling more milk

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr: Né vers 1973 dans l’arrondissement de  KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, dame  A. Félicienne est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 scolarisés. Elle cultive dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement   GM SENABLO DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc qui sont des aliments de grande consommation au Bénin. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future à un nanti pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique elle a sollicité un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in the district of Kessounou, in the town of Dangbo, Mrs. Félicienne A. is married and the mother of 6 children, of whom three are enrolled in school. She is a farmer in the village of Glahounsa in the valley of the Ouémé River and is a member of the group GM Senablo of Glahounsa.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc which are staple foods in Benin. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land. The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Félicienne A. has requested a loan of 100,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1 hectare, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1 hectare in maize (corn) and hot peppers

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.es:
El señor Leobardo C. esta agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito. 
 Su negocio ha crecido mucho, en este momento el desea contar con su apoyo para otro préstamo para surtir su negocio de ropa nueva y zapatos. Ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo. 
Se instala en diferentes mercados de la cuidad y eso le ha ayudado para progresar y consolidarse en este ramo.
texts.en:
Leobardo C. is grateful for the help he received with his previous loan. His business has grown a lot and now he would like to count on your help for another loan to supply his business with new clothing and footwear which his customers are asking for. He sets up in different markets in the city and this helps him to grow and consolidate his line of business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en: Mrs. Samorn K. lives in Ta Dork Pong village in Takeo province, where she makes a living breeding pigs. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she has decided to request a loan to buy more pigs to breed. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's life. Her husband, Mr. Pech Sarith, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Samorn K. is 47 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Her second child is enrolled in the local school and the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is seen her with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina A., a single parent with four dependents, has been selling fish and operating a beauty salon at Bantama near Elmina since 1997. Purchasing from the fishermen, she brings the fish home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale. Christina has received no formal education.

Christina is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale and to purchase a variety of hair products to meet customer demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she plans to build for the children.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities and a variety of hair products to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Graciela Dionisia

texts.es:
La señora Graciela G. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina”, en el distrito de Platería, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 41 años de edad, es viuda y esta al cuidado de 05 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su negocio es la artesanía (tejido a mano), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de lana para sus tejidos.  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas materiales para sus tejidos al por mayor (lanas de diferentes tonalidades), con ello podrá tejer chompas, chullos y otros que entrega a los intermediarios en la Feria Juliaca, su anhelo es formar una asociación de artesanas para poder vender sus productos de manera directa y sin intermediarios a los mercados de la región y poder exportar sus productos, asimismo quiere educar a sus hijos y verlos profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the communal bank called Flor Andina in the district of Plateria, Puno province. She is 41 years old and widowed. Graciela takes care of 5 children. She was able to complete her secondary education, and has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She works in handicrafts, (knitting). With her first loan, she purchased wool for her handicrafts. Today she needs an additional loan, which she will repay in 4 payments. She will use the money to invest in materials needed to make her blankets, ponchos and other hand knit goods which she sells through vendors at the fair in Juliaca. Her goal is to form an artists association where they can sell their goods directly, without intermediaries, in the regional markets and for export as well. She also wants to be able to provide an education for her children so they can have good professions in the future.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to make her hand knit goods

loans.name: Оrif

texts.ru:
Ориф мужчина в возросте 38 лет ,женат имеет шестерых детей.Жена на дому занимается продажей пряжи.Сам Ориф работает в Горно обогатительном комбинате г.Адрасмана.Раньше он работал пастухом в колхозе.Но т.к.
ему не платили за работу ,он устроился на работу в комбинат.Кроме своей работы он имеет бизнес откорма и продажи скота.У него сейчас 10 коз и 15 баранов.Ориф решил увеличить свой бизнес в сезон , когда скот дешёвый на рынке, для чего и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Orif is 38 years old, married and has six children. His wife sells yarn at home. Orif works at a mining and concentration plant in the city of Adrasman. Previously, he worked as a shepherd at an agricultural collective; however, because he was not receiving pay from the collective, he went to work for the plant. Besides this work, Orif also has a business of raising and selling livestock. He currently owns 10 goats and 15 sheep. Orif decided to expand his business now, during the season when livestock market price is low. This is why he reached out to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa T., 42, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $140).

She has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, weed killer, knives and sacks of  fertilizer

loans.name: Bigedinawe

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier de Sogbossito qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle est mariée et est mère de 04 enfants, son mari est un enseignant. Pour pouvoir aider son mari à subvenir convenablement aux charges du foyer, elle s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce de charbons de bois. Le charbon de bois est très utilisé par les femmes togolaises dans la cuisine. Elle vend en gros et en détail. Son stock actuel étant épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 50 sacs de charbons de bois
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in the Sogbossito neighborhood, an outlying neighborhood in the city of Lomé. She's married and the mother of 4 children, and her husband is a teacher. To help her husband provide for the family expenses appropriately, she started selling charcoal in 2007. Charcoal is very much used in cooking by Togolese women. She sells wholesale and retail. Her current stock has run out, and she's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 50 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Logie

texts.en:
Logie G. is from the village of Danao. She is 33 years old. Logie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Logie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Logie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Logie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Logie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Logie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Logie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 30 años, la mayor parte de su vida la ha pasado trabajando y tratando de salir adelante. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 32 años, quien siempre la ayuda y acompaña en sus actividades cotidianas. Su tienda escolar está situada en el Colegio Secundario “Tupac Amaru”, la cual es muy visitada por los niños, quienes a la hora del recreo no dudan en usar el dinero que le dieron sus padres en los ricos pasteles que vende Lourdes en su kiosco, ella es muy carismática y alegre por lo cual siempre atiende con mucho cariño a los estudiantes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es distraerse con los niños, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Para un futuro cercano, Lourdes espera tener una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual pueda incrementar sus ingresos y así tener una vida mejor. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta por la nueva oportunidad, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados incrementará la cantidad de golosinas y pasteles que vende en su tienda escolar.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 30 years old and for most of her life she has been working and trying to get ahead. She lives in her own house with her husband José who is 32 years old. He is always helping her and accompanies her on her everyday activities. Her store is located in the Tupac Amaru Secondary School where it is frequented by the young people during recess, and they never hesitate to use the money which their parents have given them to buy the delicious baked treats that she sells at her stand. Lourdes is very charismatic and cheerful and always treats the students with great affection. What she likes best about her work is to entertain herself with the children. She's been doing this for three years and she thinks that what she likes least is having to remain at her stand all day long without being able to leave. In the near future Lourdes hopes to have a grocery store which would allow her to increase her income and thus have a better life. This is her sixth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she is very satisfied with this new opportunity. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time in order not to do a disservice to the other members of her communal bank where she is very well liked. The 9,000 Sols that she is requesting will be used to increase the inventory of sweets and baked goods that she has in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: Omowumi is very grateful to Kiva for their financial support. With her last Kiva loan, she was able to purchase more cement and this has increased the productivity of her business and the general well being of her family. Omowumi is 35 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more cement to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase of more cement to sell

loans.name: Marom

texts.en:
Mrs. Marom Y., 52, and her husband, Mr. Chantha Em, 54, have been married since 1983 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One of them iss married and lives in separate house, one is a garment factory worker and other two attend school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Marom has been selling pickled papaya for two months. In addition, she also sells fruit. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi for two years. He wants to drive Tuk Tuk taxi because it would be better for him to earn income to support his family. Tuk Tuk is a motorbike with a passenger trailer in the back. 

Marom is asking for her first loan of $800 to purchase a passenger trailer to help fund her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a passenger trailer

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is married with a grown daughter. She lives and works in Zaporozhye, a big industrial city in the south-eastern part of Ukraine. Antonina sells lingerie and knitted wear in the biggest city market, which is called Angolenko. She owns a vending kiosk there. She also sells her inventory at regular clothing fairs in local malls. Antonina has a hired employee who works for her as a salesman in the marketplace. It helps her focus more on other aspects of business management and has proven to be a good tool on her way to success.

Antonina has been in this business niche for 10 years. Her enterprise has grown up to 50,000 Grivnyas in merchandise and 3,000 Grivnyas in net profit. Today she is seeking a loan of 11,300 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise for her retail business.

loans.use: To restock her merchandise for the fall season

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres está casado con la Sra. Leonora, tienen hijos  y su vivienda es propia. Andres se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife , tiene bastante experiencia prueba de ello que además de comercializar los productos también son capacitadores de los mismos. No hay mucha competencia  con este producto, ya que el deudor es muy conocido  en la zona. El destino del crédito es para capital operativo de productos Herbalife, ya que tuvo un pedido. En la central de riesgo y otros burós de información presenta solo una deuda en Agrocapital la cual han estado cancelando con puntualidad.
texts.en:
Andres and his wife Leonora have children and own their own home. Andres sells Herbalife products and has quite a lot of experience with them; in addition to marketing the products, he and his wife are also Herbalife coaches. This product does not face much competition since the borrower is well known in the area. The loan will be used as operating capital for Herbalife products, since one order has already been placed. The credit bureau and other sources report only one debt to Agrocapital, which was paid in full on time.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital for Herbalife

loans.name: Patience Group

texts.en:
Patience Group is a group of five borrowers led by Patrick G., a university student, and single father with two children. Both of them are 10 years old and they are in the 5th grade. Patrick lives and works in West Point, a very crowded and poor community with a high crime rate. West Point is also filled with fishermen and it is south of and close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Patrick’s business is general goods like door locks, hinges, nails, files, spoons, combs and clothes pegs that he buys wholesale and sells retail to the residents of West Point.

Patrick started by buying rice by the bag and selling it retail but later realized he has to run a bigger business than that, so he started his general goods business. He always sells at a low price to his customers and gives them good service. That’s why the customers always want to come and buy from him.

Patrick needs this loan in order to buy more goods to improve his business. He hopes to grow his business and become a big business person in society and dreams of providing himself and his family with a better life and educating his children for the future.

loans.use: To buy more goods to improve business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario” ubicado en  Villa Queñuani, del distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Yunguyo, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 64 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Sucana, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace muchos años es una D. las socias fundadoras y su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. aji.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/.3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado vacuno, por otro lado la señora se dedica a la compra venta D. aji.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is an associate of the "Virgin of the Rosary" Communal Bank, located in Queñuani Village , of the district of Yunguyo, Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 64 years of age, married and has 4 children. She lives in the community of Sucana and has completed her studies through secondary school. The lady began working with the Manuela Ramos Movement many years ago. She is one of the associate founders and her initial loan was for 300 soles, which permitted her to increase her capital for the business of buying and selling peppers. Currently she requires a new loan of 3000 soles, which will permit her to buy cattle. In addition she is dedicated to the buying and selling of peppers. Her greatest desire is to continue working.. She appreciates the savings and the flexibility of the loans from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel C., está solicitando un crédito para pagar la diferencia que necesita para adquirir su vivienda.
Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar y no quiere perder esta oportunidad que se le esta ofreciendo de comprar su propia casa, ya que donde vive  es prestada, y le están pidiendo que desocupe la vivienda. 
Es empleado de un puesto de tacos es la persona que se encarga de elaborarlos esté ingreso es el que tiene para su familia y con el cual un parte será para el préstamo.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Susana Garcia, ya que Don Manuel se encontraba en su trabaja el día que se tomo la foto.
texts.en:
Don Manuel C. is requesting a loan to cover the remaining amount he needs in order to buy his house, since he doesn't have the money on hand and doesn't want to miss the opportunity to own his own home. He currently lives in someone else's house, and they have requested that he vacate the property. Manuel is in charge of making tacos at a local taco stand. This is how he supports his family; he will also use part of his income to pay off this loan. The person in the photo is his wife, Sra. Susana Garcia, since Don Manuel was at work the day the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for part of a house being offered through a government housing credit

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem N., 23, is married and resides in Phnom Penh with her husband. She is currently employed in a local garment factory and earns an income of US $3.00 per day. Their family is supported mainly by her husband who is a construction foreman in the city. He earns US $5 per day, which is the primary source of income for the family and helps to pay for their household expenses. 

N. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. Therefore, N. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more cement so her husband can finish building his customer’s house.

N.'s husband appears in the accompanying photograph.

loans.use: To buy cement to finish a construction job

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and calendars to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 9 meses atrás (reingresante) del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 45 años de edad, estudiò primaria incompleta, es casada y tiene 6 hijos (5 de ellos viven con ella y 1 ya tiene su familia).
Delia se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado porcino y ovino y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con los que podrá comprar una vaca lechera.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse un carro. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Delia has been a member of the “Tupac Amaru I” community bank for the last 9 months (when she rejoined) in the district and province of Yunguyo, department of Puno. She is 45 years old, did not finish primary school, is married, and has 6 children (5 of whom live with her and one who already has their own family). Delia buys and sells pigs and sheep, and she says that with her first 500 soles loan from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos she was able to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles so she can buy a dairy cow. Her future goal is to buy a cart. What she likes best about her Community Banks are the savings and the meeting with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo Noe, de 29 años, y con sus 2 hijos: Zaraí de 8 y Jesús de 3 años. Su casa está a medio construir y se ubica en un apacible pueblo de la sierra peruana algo alejado de la ciudad. 

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la  siembra de papa, con la ayuda de su padre, quien le enseñó a cultivar la tierra y todo lo necesario de la actividad agrícola. Con las ganancias de la comercialización de su producto logró construir la mitad de su vivienda, por lo que espera que esta próxima cosecha sea más productiva para ganar lo suficiente y concluir con la otra mitad, para poder darles un hogar adecuado a sus hijos, quienes son el motivo que la impulsa para salir adelante en su sacrificada labor.
Betty, en el futuro desea sembrar en mayor cantidad e independizarse, además tiene planeado aperturar una tienda de abarrotes que le ayude a obtener más ingresos económicos, y así ahorrar algo de dinero que invertirá en la educación de sus hijos y también le permitirá sembrar papa de mejor calidad.               

Ella asegura que en su banco comunal ha aprendido a ser muy responsable, por ello paga puntualmente sus cuotas, como lo hará en esta séptima oportunidad en que accede a un préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita lo usará para comprar varios sacos de fertilizantes y litros de insecticidas para fumigar sus cultivos y así asegurar una producción de calidad.
texts.en:
Betty is 25 years old. She lives with her husband Noe, who is 29, and their two children: Zaraí (age 8) and Jesús (age 3). Her house is halfway built and located in a quiet village in the Peruvian mountains situated away from the city.

Betty has been growing potatoes for four years with the help of her father, who taught her how to cultivate the land and other necessary farming skills. With the profits from the sale of her crops, she has been able to pay for the construction costs of her house thus far. Betty expects to be more productive with her next harvest and earn enough money to finish the other half of her house. This will provide a proper home for her children, who are the reason behind the sacrifices she makes in order to succeed.

In the future, Betty wants to plant potatoes in greater quantity and become independent. She also plans to open a grocery store to help generate more income. This will help her save some money for her children’s education and allow her to plant potatoes of better quality.

Betty says that being part of her Communal Bank has taught her how to be very responsible and make her payments on time. This is the seventh time she has accessed a loan from MFP. The money she requested will be used to buy sacks of fertilizers and liters of insecticides to spray on her crops to ensure a crop that is of high quality.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & insecticides

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
En la imagen aparece la esposa  Yoana Díaz Miranda.
Carlos Cárdenas López es una persona trabajadora que esta preocupado por el bienestar y seguridad de la familia. Es por ello que quiere comprar una protección para la puerta para que este mas segura al momento de el irse a trabajar. Como apenas esta familia tiene poco de haber adquirido su vivienda quieren ir poco a poco haciéndoles mejoras para que sus hijos vivan lo mas comido que se pueda.
texts.en:
In the photo above we see the borrower's wife, Yoana Díaz Miranda. Carlos Cárdenas López is a hard-working individual who is concerned about the well-being and security of his family. For this reason, he wants to buy protection for the door of his home so that it will be more secure when he leaves for work. Because this family has not had the house for long, they want to make improvements little by little so that their children can live as comfortably as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Protection for the door of the home

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  RAQUEL, pertenece al banco comunal “ricchary purisun - oropesa”, la socia vive en el distrito de Oropesa dentro del departamento del Cusco, a 30 minutos de la ciudad imperial.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año; nuestra socia es ama de casa y también alternando las actividades del hogar con el comercio, ella vende cuyes, al por mayor y menor, la socia cría cuyes los engorda y luego los vende, la socia tenía cerca de 700 cuyes y se han procreado y ahora necesitan alimento más que nunca porque son gazapos (bebes), ella tenía un terreno, en el cual ella sembró alfa alfa (es un vegetal que contiene proteinas y sirve de alimento a los conejos), la socia proveía a sus animales alfa alfa de este terreno pero la semana pasada, llovió en 24 horas lo que correspondía a 1 mes de lluvias y 11 provincias de la ciudad del Cusco fueron inundadas, dejando graves daños, está zona no fue tan arrasada pero igual sufrió pérdidas económicas. Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder comprar alfalfa que es la comida de sus cuyes, la inundación se llevó el terreno de nuestra socia que tenía alfalfa ahora ella debe comprar el alimento a sus cuyes para seguir vendiéndolos.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our group member, Raquel, belongs to the "Ricchary Purisun-Oropesa" community bank. She lives in the district of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the capital city of Cuzco. She is 31 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are 4 and 1 year old. She is a housewife and alternates the activities of the home with working in a business. She sells guinea pigs in bulk and in smaller quantities. She raises the guinea pigs, fattens them, and later sells them. She has around 700 guinea pigs and they have reproduced and now she needs more food than ever for the babies. She has a plot of land where she planted alfalfa (a vegetable that can serve as food for rodents and other animals). She has always provided for her animals from this land but last week it rained very unexpectedly, and in 24 hours they got the equivalent of 1 month of rainfall. Eleven regions of the city flooded, leaving behind a lot of damage. This region was not as demolished, but it still suffered economic loss. Our member needs the loan to be able to buy alfalfa to feed to her guinea pigs. The flood that harmed the city of Cuzco carried away the alfalfa she had planted on her land and now she needs to buy food for her guinea pigs to keep selling them. She is thankful and values the opportunity given to her, and she promises to finish paying off the debt at the established rate.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pig food, as a flood carried away her alfalfa crop

loans.name: C 3516 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
M. is 56 years old and he is the president of a group called Abishyizehamwe. M. and his team sell charcoal wholesale. This is their second successful year in this business. The hours of their business are from early in the morning until late in the evening hours.

M. and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their business by buying more charcoal to satisfy the demand of their customers. With this loan, this group hopes that their sales will increase, as well as their profits. The added profits will allow them to create many sources of income by reinvesting in the same business but in different locations. By expanding the business, each member of this group has a hope for the future.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Atalia Acacio

texts.pt:
Atalia Acácio C. nasceu em Maputo tem 28 anos de idade é viúva mãe de um filho de 8 anos que se encontra a estudar. Para alem do seu filho responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive em Gaza enviando lhe mensalmente 500.00mt para pagar a empregada que toma conta dela pois já e muito idosa.

Atalia tinha apenas 6 anos quando muda se de Maputo para vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia devido a separação dos seus pais e passa a viver com a tia esta que a maltratava, inicia os estudos muito tarde e quando frequentava a 7ª classe esta fica grávida e é expulsa de casa e abandona os estudos. No mesmo ano consegue arranjar um emprego num restaurante onde trabalhou durante 4 anos, teve que abandonar quando contrai a tuberculose (TB) e tinha que cumprir com os tratamentos num período de um ano. Após sua recuperação ela consegue arranjar um emprego nas águas de Namaacha como servente. E funcionaria permanente a mais de 4 anos trabalha das 7h as 17h auferindo mensalmente 2.500.00mt, mas devido a morte do seu marido ela não consegue mas cobrir com as despesas porque vive numa casa alugada e paga 800.00mt por mês então aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo para legalização de um terreno e a construção no mesmo.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Atalia na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. O primeiro de 8.000.00mt foi usado para legalização de seu terreno, o segundo de 12.000.00mt foi para dar inicio da sua obra que se encontra na parte da viga, estes 15.000.00mt serão usados para iniciar com a cobertura da mesma e em breve poderá mudar se para sua própria casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir um outro empréstimo para reboco da mesma.
texts.en:
Atalia Acácio C. was born in Maputo. She is a 28-year-old widow and mother to an 8-year-old son who goes to school. Besides her son, she also cares for her mother, who lives in Gaza, by sending her 500 MZN every month to pay the person who takes care of her since she is very old. Atalia was only 6 years old when she moved from Maputo to the village of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland, owing to the separation of her parents. She went to live with an aunt who mistreated her. She began school very late, and when she was in 7th grade, she became pregnant, was thrown out of the house, and left school. That same year she got a job in a restaurant, where she worked for 4 years. She had to quit when she contracted tuberculosis (TB) and had to have treatments over the course of a year. After her recovery, she got a job as an assistant at the Namaacha water company. She has been a permanent employee there for more than 4 years, working from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm and earning 2,500 MZN monthly, but because of her husband's death she can no longer cover her expenses, since she lives in a rented house and pays 800 MZN per month. She approached Hluvuku and Kiva to ask for a loan to purchase a title to some land and build a house on it. This is Atalia's third loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. The first, for 8,000 MZN, was used to purchase the title to her land, and the second loan of 12,000 MZN was to begin construction, which has been completed up to the roof beams. These 15,000 MZN will be used to begin roofing the house, and soon she will be able to move in. She is confident that she will pay ahead of time and ask for another loan to plaster the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, etc.)

loans.name: Anor

texts.ru: Алимова Анор проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. Она в основном выращивает овощи. В этой деятельности ей помогает муж. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Anor A. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 50 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a secondary education. Anor has been involved in agriculture for over 15 years. She primarily grows vegetables. Her husband helps her with this business. Anor is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mrs. Yorn Yem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has thirteen people who all live in Akreiy Ksat village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Yorn Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fruit seller who is able to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to sell.

Mrs. Yorn Y. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a construction worker and the other is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Wassomagni Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe WASSOMAGNI (7 femmes mariées, deux célibataires et une veuve) ont en moyenne  26 ans,  ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivent dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités qui sont entre autres la préparation vente d’encens (tels CHATA D.),  de condiments alimentaires,  de chaussures, de vêtements  pour enfants,  des boissons,  des bazin teintés, de  l’atiécké et   bien d’autres produits alimentaires.
CHATA D.  comptent acheter avec son  prêt 25kg de guénni (graines ) + 5 types de parfums + autres petits ingrédients et une trentaine de bouteille pour préparer son encens et les embouteiller . Pour se faire  elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville.  L’encens est vendu,  la plupart au comptant,  en famille, au  marché du quartier SANOUBOUGOU et dans les structures professionnelles le plus souvent sur commande à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 18.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten members of the WASSOMAGNI group (seven married women, two unmarried and one widow) are on average 26 years old with two children, living in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the boroughs in Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. This is the first time they collaborate with the Soro Yorowaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs. They carry out several activities, among which the preparation and sale of incense (for example group member Chata D.), food condiments, shoes, children’s clothing, beverages, dyed “bazin” fabric, atiécké (dried cassava preparation), and many other food products. Chata D. wants to use her loan to buy 25 kilos of guénni (seeds), five types of perfume, several other ingredients, and about 30 small bottles to prepare and present her incense for sale. She gets her supplies from the main market in Sikasso. The incense is sold mainly for cash, by family members at the local SANOUBOUGOU borough market and on order to professional retailers, to both men and women customers. She expects to achieve average monthly earnings of 18,000 FCFA of which part will be put into savings for social use and the remainder invested in her commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for the preparation of incense

loans.name: Adita

texts.en:
Adita G. enjoys the beauty of nature from her house, situated 300 meters away from the fine sand of the wide seashore and the crystal-blue water of the ocean. Her family also enjoys life in its simplest form. 

From the time she married, Adita's family has made use of the abundant resources of their surroundings by using fishing, managed by Adita's husband, as their main source of income. Their livelihood from fishing is how Adita has been able to see her eldest child graduate from college and the needs of her four other children, aged 13 to 26, supported.

In 2008, Adita and her husband decided to expand their fishing activities into a business. Adita joined Kiva's partner, ASHI, to gain access to financial support for their aspirations. Over time, their fishing business has been improving. They were able to purchase a fishing boat, which now has to be repaired after several years of use. 

For this, Adita is requesting a much larger loan amount. She hopes that by reconditioning the engine and the boat itself, her husband will be able to catch more fish for her to sell directly to people in their village. She also wishes to put aside some savings for renovating their house and hopes to support her eldest child, who works for ASHI as a Development Officer. 

Adita’s eldest child is her inspiration to work hard and support her youngest child's education, as her three other children have not finished their college education due to lack of financial support.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair her husband's fishing boat

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is from the village of Brgy. Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old and single. To make a living, Marilyn owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Marilyn joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok M., age 66, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. She raises pigs for an income of USD 1.5 per day. Her husband buys silk products for resale, earning an income of USD 2 per day.  M. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase silk products for her husband to resell. She would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy silk products for resale.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita A. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old, is separated from her spouse and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Sherlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Sherlita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Sherlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sherlita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Sherlita from HSPFI. She chose to have a loan of 3,000 PHP for her second loan because she would find it easier to pay if she decreased the amount of her loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from her home  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Mary is 42 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Jeannette is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jeannette owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. Jeannette has been engaged in her business for over 2 years. She also helps her husband maintain their rice farm. She also helps sell their harvest to the market.

Jeannette joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeannette has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jeannette is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. She also plans to buy farm inputs. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Jeannette from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future, and to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark C. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 29 years old. Mark is single. To make a living, Mark owns & operates transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services locally known as "habal-habal". Mark has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mark joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mark has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mark is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Mark from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).  Hadjah has a business selling snacks like samosas, Chapatti and pancakes.  She has been in this business for six years and she works 7 days a week. Hadjah sells her products at the market at wholesale and at retail. Hadjah has requested a loan of 300,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cooking oil, wheat flour and charcoal. The main business challenge(s) for Hadjah include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big, own a big bakery and a plot of land. Hadjah lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, baking flour and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 34-year old single man from Lebanon. He has twelve years of experience working as a farmer. He has owned his own farm since 2003.  He works independently on his farm and he lives on his own.  He is specialized in cultivating lemons and potatoes on his land. And he cooperates with some markets to deliver his products. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new farming tool to cultivate his land.  He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: purchase a new farming tool to cultivate his land

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine H. is married with 2 children, living with her father-in-law. Karine rents a trading booth at the busy city market from where she sells women’s clothing. Karine’s husband is employed, and contributes to the business’s success by investing his savings. To meet her clients’ needs Karine needs to travel to the neighboring country to purchase autumn clothing stock.

loans.use: purchase new clothing stock

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en: Mrs. Sokly P., 37, and her husband, Mr. Sophal Chum, 39, have been married since 1991 and have five sons. One of them is a garment factory worker, one is a construction worker, and the other three are still young. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mrs. Sokly P. has been a weaver since she was 16 years old. Her husband is a farmer. She is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add more money to his business

loans.name: Evelyny Karol

texts.es:
Evelyny es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román  y departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y  no tiene hijos. La señorita tiene estudios de educación secundaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses, su primer préstamo fue S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio fabricación de polos.

La señorita solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de materiales para su negocio de confección de polos.
	
Su sueño para el futuro  es ampliar el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Evelyny is a member of the “Las Mensajeras” (Messengers) community bank which is located  in Juliaca district, San Román province, in the department of Puno.  She is 22 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She completed her secondary education.

Evelyny has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 months.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business making polo shirts.

She is requesting a new loan of 200 nuevos soles to invest in buying fabric for her business.

Her dream for the future is to expand her business.

What she most likes about her community bank is the ease of acquiring a loan and the punctuality.

loans.use: To buy material for making polo shirts

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila N. M. is a 37-year-old lady who is married to Msanifu Rashid, a businessman.  They are blessed with four children. She is a poultry farmer in Likoni, Mombasa and her business has been doing well with great profits. She has been in this business for the last four years. 

She has applied for a loan from KADET Ltd. which she plans to use to purchase one-day-old chicks for rearing and later selling at a profit. The anticipated profits will be directed towards boosting her hotel business, which she does as a secondary business.

Her dream is to succeed through KADET loans and later on to be able to maintain the living standards of her family by the provision of their basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase young chicks

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: El señor Enrique nacido el 16 de julio  en Cochabamba, tiene su esposa y 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  El tiene su pequeña parcela de 2 hectáreas pero como el trabaja fuerte se ve en la obligación de a alquilar más tierras y así poder sembrar mas y tener mas ingresos,   El se dedica a la siembra de ají porque el personalmente lo lleva a Sucre a vender para poder ganar un poco más, También siembra Papa, eso el lo vende en el mercado de El Torno por que no se puede llevar a otro lugar, el dinero del crédito es para lo que implica el gasto del preparado de la tierra la siembra y el traslado de sus productos al mercado, es una persona muy responsable y  trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Enrique was born on July 16th in Cochabamba.  He has a wife and three school age children.

He has a small parcel of land that is two hectares.  He is a hard-worker, and he is obliged to rent more land to be able to plant more and get more income.

He grows peppers, and he personally takes them to Sucre to sell in order to earn a little more.  He also grows potatoes, and he sells them at the El Torno market because he is unable to take them to another place.

He will use the loan for the expense of preparing the land for planting and for transporting his products to the market. 
 
He is a very responsible and hard-working person.  He is grateful to the institution for the help provided.

loans.use: For planting peppers and potatoes

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique owns a business that sells sugar, mineral water, flours of different products and tomato sauces.  She is 23 years old, married and has one child of three weeks. Her husband is a mason. Angelique has been selling sugar, flours of different products for three years. Her loan will be used to buy more items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business for saving to build a house. Angelique dreams of  having a shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, mineral water and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Ambe

texts.en:
Ambe P. M. was born in 1947. He is a polygamist  with seven children, two younger then 15 years. He lives in a small three-room house with his family in Mubang Nkwena quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Ambehas has faced many challenges in life, among them the death of his parents when he was very young, and meeting the basic necessities of life such as clothing, feeding, and educating himself and his children. Also difficulties in raising money to pay taxes for his craft workshop that helps sustain him and his family. He plans to invest this loan in a business doing wood carving, selling firewood and raising pigs. He believes the business will succeed because the previous loan he took out increased his income. The wood products he produces are in high demand in the market and he also trains youths in the skill. Ambe will plough his profits back into his business and use part to care for his family including his children’s school fees. He prefers GHAPE because of the training he receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE: The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account and most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: piglets and feed, fire wood, and wood for wood-carving

loans.name: Carlos Gonzalo

texts.es:
el señor Carlos Gonzalo C. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Jose en San Marcos de Colon, Carlos se dedica a dar el servicio de moler maiz, tiene un motor adaptado para moler maiz y brinda este servicio a todos los habitantes de su comunidad, Carlos se levanta todos los dias a las 3 de la mañana para lograr salir con todos sus clientes.
Carlos trabaja muy fuerte para poder darle lo necesario a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de unos repuestos para darle mantenimiento a su molino que es el alma de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Gonzalo Cárcamo, 59, lives in the San José neighborhood in San Marcos de Colon.  He provides corn grinding services.  He has a motor modified to grind corn and he provides this service to all the residents of his community.  He rises every day at 3am in order to take care of all his customers.

Carlos works very hard to provide for his family’s needs.

He will use the loan to buy some replacement parts and to provide maintenance to his mill which is the soul of his business.

loans.use: To buy bands, sand paper, discs, oil.

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
Phann T. is a 38-year-old married man who earns his daily living by driving a motor taxi in Siem Reap province. He normally generates a profit on average of $5 each day. Phann T. has a life partner in his wife, a tailor in Phnom Penh City, earning a profit around $5 per day, which she shares with Phann T. for daily expenses. This couple has two children; both of them are studying in a local school. 

Unfortunately, their existing motorbike has often broken down during use. Because of that, Phann T. has decided to seek a loan of $1200 from Kiva, which he will use to change the broken motorcycle. With the rest of the funds, he will support his wife's business.

loans.use: To change their broken motorcycle and support his wife's business

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past five years.  Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Louis faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During rainy season it becomes a challenge to operate her business. She hopes to expand and build rental houses.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase two blow dryers, 30 razor blades and hair oil. Louis joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase blow dryers and razor blades

loans.name: Jennyvi

texts.en: Jennyvi P. is from the village of Mibando, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Jennyvi is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jennyvi runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, snack foods, canned goods and beverages in the local community. Jennyvi has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Jennyvi joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennyvi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jennyvi is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Jennyvi from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Israel Cirilo

texts.es:
Israel de 53 años, es un ahombre trabajador que tiene muchas aspiraciones para su familia por eso el comenzó con un negocio surtido entre tienda de víveres y papelería. 

Tiene un aproximado de 6 años con su tienda, ha podido surtirla y administrarla al punto que todo le ha ido bien. En la actualidad vende arroz, bebidas, cuadernos a un precio bajo. Trabaja en su negocio desde las 06h00am hasta las 23h00pm con ayuda de su esposa. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando con el préstamo comprar arroz, bebidas, papelería.
texts.en:
Israel, 53, is a hardworking man who has many aspirations for his family, so he began a business stocked with basic supplies and stationary.

He has run his store for about 6 years. He has been able to keep it stocked and manage it so that everything is going well for him. Today he sells rice, drinks, and notebooks at low prices. He works at his business from 6:00 am until 11:00 pm with his wife's help. He has many plans for his business and so he wants to continue working. With the loan he will buy rice, drinks, and stationary.

loans.use: To purchase rice, drinks and notebooks

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: From the province of Kampong Chhnang, Chum B., 45, earns a living by making bricks in a local kiln. Her husband also works in the same job as her. On average, the couple can make a daily profit of around $7.50 to cover the family’s needs. They are blessed with four single children, two of whom are working different jobs and always contribute their salary with them. She would like to apply for a loan in order to purchase a machine for providing electricity to her house.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for providing electricity to her house

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run A., age 41, is married to Ha Horn, age 32, who works with her in the farming business, and both of them are shown in the photo. She has three children; one is single, and two are married. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing and tapping the palm trees behind his house. 

Run A. would like to apply for a loan in order to buy some planks to repair her old house and to pay for mending costs. She will use any remainder of the loan towards purchasing pig-feed and piglets to raise so as to get more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy some planks to repair her old house and to pay for mending costs.

loans.name: Consuelo Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Consuelo es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales como por ejemplo los créditos escolares que le sirven de mucho y por las facilidades para los créditos. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 19, 15 y 11 años de edad, los mismos que  estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño local en la calle Chile donde muchos comerciantes venden sus productos en la ciudad, en este pequeño puesto ella vende ropa interior de caballeros, trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Sus productos los compra en Picoaza en una distribuidora que le deja a buen precio. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio 8 años y que siempre le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar, camisetas, calzoncillos, medias y otras prendas  interiores de caballeros.
 
Su sueño es tener un  bazar con mucha mercadería.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the '22 de Julio' community bank meet in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known as a very commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and the cheerfulness of its people.

Consuelo is a founding member of her community bank.  She likes it for the additional benefits it provides such as the educational loans which are very helpful and the payment terms for the loans.  Consuelo is 34 years old, married, and has three children aged 19, 15 and 11.  Her children are studying at university, high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Consuelo is a saleswoman.  She has a small sales location in Chile Street where there are a lot of salespeople selling their products.  From her small stall she sells men's underwear.  She works from 8.00am to 5.00pm.  She buys her products in Picoaza, from a wholesaler who provides her with a good price.  She tells us that she has been in her business for eight years and it has always done well.

Consuelo will use this loan to buy undershirts, underpants, socks and other men's undergarments.  Her dream is to own a general store with a lot of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy undershirts, underpants, socks, etc.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida is 28 years old, married with two daughters. Both of them are very young and have not started their education yet.  She is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household tasks. She has good administrative abilities and manages her household expenses very well. 

Her husband is a welder by trade and operates a welding shop in the market. He welds and repairs iron, steel items, machinery and spare parts with the welding machine. He is known as an expert in his field and has a good number of clients who request his services regularly and pay reasonable rates.
 
Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will buy a new welding machine to be able to provide better quality welding services to his clients. His current welding machine doesn’t work well and needs a replacement. 

Rashida hopes that by purchasing a new welding machine her husband will be able to increase his profits which will help Rashida save some income for the school admission of her elder daughter who is of school-going age. She is very confident that her husband will successfully be able to improve the condition of his business.  

Rashida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application to Asasah. In the previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rashida.

loans.use: To buy a new welding machine.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 21 años de edad, ella es soltera vive en casa de padres, vive en una comunidad grande en vías de crecimiento llamada San Lorenzo ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, a unos 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Su vivienda cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz eléctrica.

Maribel se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado mochoqueque ubicado en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz , está actividad la realiza la viene ejerciendo en forma ambulatoria, cuenta con una experiencia de 3 años en forma continua, su madre también cuenta con un puesto de venta de verduras.

Maribel está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000  nuevos soles , este  dinero lo utilizará para comprar más mercadería aduciendo una oferta en precios, con el cual piensa incrementar sus ventas y por consiguiente mejorar su calidad de vida. Maribel tiene como visión comprarse una posesión de puesto fijo y así aumentar su capital de trabajo.

Maribel es una joven entusiasta, responsable, las personas que la conocen la describen con una buena persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus madre.
texts.en:
Maribel, 21, is single living in her parents’ house located in a large, developing community called San Lorenzo in José Leonardo Ortiz District, about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  Her house has electricity and water.

Maribel sells vegetables in the Mochoqueque Market located in José Leonardo Ortiz District.  She’s been a vendor for three years; her mother also has a vegetable stand.

Maribel is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy merchandise citing a price offer that she’ll use to increase sales and thus improve her quality of life.  Maribel’s future goal is to buy the rights to a fixed sales stand to increase her working capital.

Maribel is a young, enthusiastic person.  People who know her describe her as quite dedicated and hard working.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman to improve her and her mother’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her business.
