loans.name: Solidario Mujeres Comalapenses Group

texts.es:
G.S. MUJERES COMALAPAPENSES
EL GRUPO ESTA INTEGRADO POR LAS SIGUIENTES SOCIAS  MARIA CLARA, GLENDA AMARILIS, Y CRISTOBALINA. 

DOÑA CLARA ES MADRE DE CUATRO HIJOS PERO YA LOS CUATRO SON CASADOS SOLO TIENE A UNA NIÑA A SU CARGO PERO ES ADOPTADA, ELLA TIENE 55 AÑOS DE EDAD, SE DEDICA ALA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES A MANO Y TAMBIEN A LA CRIANZA DE ANIMALES, ELLA DICE QUE NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA CONFECCION DE ROPA TIPICA, 

GLENDA ES SOLTERA ELLA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES A MANO, FAJAS A MANO Y TAMBIEN TIENE CRIANZA DE POLLOS, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA ELABORACION DE GUIPILES DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS SE DEDICA A ESA ACTIVIDAD, SU CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA CONFECCION DE ROPA, 

DOÑA CRISTOBALINA  ES CASADA TIENE TRES HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, ELLA TIENE 36 AÑOS DE EDAD, SU ESPOSO LA APOYA EN SU NEGOCIO ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE DELANTALES, ELLA NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA COMO LO SON CORTES, ADORNOS PARA PODER ELABORAR SU PRODUCTO, SU VISION ES QUE PUEDA PODER VER CRECER A SUS HIJOS Y QUE PUEDA DARLES SU ESTUDIO PORQUE EL MAYOR APENAS TIENE SIETE AÑOS.
texts.en:
MUJERES COMALAPAPENSES COMMUNAL BANK

This group is composed of the following members:  Maria Clara, Glenda Amarilis and Cristobalina.

Clara is the mother of four children but all four of them are now married.  She only has one little girl in her care but she’s adopted.  She is 55 years old and makes “guipiles” (traditional Guatemalan skirts) by hand.  She also raises animals.  She says that she needs the loan to be able to buy raw materials and to be able to have more products.

Glenda is single.  She also makes hand made guipiles and sashes.  She also raises chickens.  Her main activity is the guipil making and has been in this line of work for five years.  She needs the loan to expand her business.

Cristobalina is married and has three small children.  She’s 36 years old. Her husband helps her in the business.  She manufactures aprons.  She needs the loan to buy raw materials like fabric and decorations to make her products.  Her vision is being able to see her children grow and to provide them with an education since the oldest is barely seven years old.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto nació en la provincia de la Convención (Perú) y tiene 31 años de edad. Actualmente, Alberto vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Alberto tiene una pequeño taller de carpintería pero el local es alquilado, el nos cuenta que tiene clientes fijos y fabrica sus productos a pedido del cliente. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Alberto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como laca, pintura, madera y otras cosas más. 

El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in the province of Convención, Perú and he is 31 years old. Currently, Alberto lives in the city of Cusco. He runs a small carpentry workshop that is in a rented space. He has steady customers and manufactures his products upon order by his customers. He has been running his business for twelve years and he does very well thanks to the dedication he puts into his work. Alberto needs the loan to buy raw materials such as lacquer, paint, wood and some other supplies. 

He is a very responsible and hardworking person, which is why his companions invited him to participate in the "Mosoc Killa" Communal Bank of the Asociación Arariwa (Arariwa Association).

loans.use: to buy lacquer, paint, wood and other raw materials.

loans.name: Anjeline

texts.en:
Anjeline is a married woman with four boys, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills and clothing.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other poultry operators. Her major goal is to expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase chicken feed and more chicks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed and more chicks.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is a 48-year-old married woman with 11 children living in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. The oldest child is 24 years old and the youngest is 12.

Charita and her husband are both farmers. She helps him till the land where they grow rice crops. Charita works hard to support her family. She said it is not easy sometimes because they have a big family. But Charita is still happy with her life.

Charita is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She hopes to start another business that would help augment their income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 45, grows small trees for sale at her home. Her husband, Phous, 51, is a motor taxi driver. They live along National Road Number Two about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children; two sons and three daughters. Two are garment workers and the other three are in school.

Phally is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her children.

Photo: Phally and her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children.

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres Damas Unidas es de la ciudad de San Ignacio. Actualmente cuenta con 11 integrantes, donde todas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de de respeto y ayuda mutua. El objetivo de cada de una de ella es seguir dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres y de esa forma poder desarrollarse plenamente.
La Señora Alejandra es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la peluquería hace varios años. Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y brindar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para tener una vida digna y decorosa. Uno de sus sueños es poder seguir creciendo profesionalmente y de esa forma generar un poco más de ingresos para su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para habilitar un salón de belleza en su domicilio, para que de esa forma pueda trabajar de forma más cómoda y relajada en su casa. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que esta le da pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Damas Unidas is from the city of San Ignacio.  Currently there are 11 members in the group and all of them work in an atmosphere of respect and mutual help.  The goal of each one of them is to continue in the group so they can fully develop.

Mrs. Alejandra is the president of the group and she has run a beauty salon for several years.  Through her work she has been able to get ahead and give her family everthing they need to lead a dignified, proper life.  One of her dreams is to continue growing professionally in order to generate more income for her family.

She is requesting a loan to install a beauty salon in her home so she can work more comfortably and relaxed.  She is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity to obtain a loan that will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: To install a beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, a 38-year-old married mother of three children, lives in Dinas Sinacaban Misamis Occidental where, for the last 11 years, she has raised goats to sell to the Municipal Public Market. Her net monthly income of PHP 3,000.00 enables her to send her children to school.

A member of Gata Daku MPC for four years, Analiza has requested a loan for Php 3,000 to purchase additional goats to raise. In the future, she wishes to have a large goat farm, as she currently has only five goats.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase additional goats to sell.

loans.name: Sanam

texts.ru: Санам проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее среднее образование. Она при доме имеет участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Sanam lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 47 years old, married and has a secondary education.  She has a plot of land by her house, where she sows wheat and grows vegetables.  Sanam has been involved in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El señor Sabino tiene 64 años de edad, esta acompañado, y vive con sus cuatro hijos (todos menores de 18 años).

Sabino se dedica a la agricultura, particularmente al cultivo de maíz, maicillo, y frijol. Este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, con quienes cultivaba hasta 24,500 metros cuadradros. Todas las labores de cultivo las elaboraba la familia, sin emplear a nadie. Actualmente Sabino cultiva con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos. Sabino tambien tiene vacas, toros, y terneros para la producción de leche para la venta.

Sabino ha pedido un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de madera y láminas de zinc para mejorar el techo de su vivienda. Actualmente la madera que soporta el techo esta en mal estado, y las láminas dejan entrar el agua a la casa cuanda llueve. Con la ayuda del préstamo Sabino podra proporcionar una vivienda más comoda y segura para su familia, evitando problemas de salud causados por la humedad.

Sabino desea seguir mejorando su vivienda. Inicialmente la casa fue construida enteramente de láminas de zinc (paredes y techo). Poco a poco Sabino pudo construtir las paredes de cemento que ahora tiene. Sabino desea en un futuro construir su casa totalmente,instalar piso de cemento (actualmente es de tierra), y colocar soportes de hierro en el techo.
texts.en:
Sabino is 64 years old.  He has a companion and lives with his four children (all under the age of 18).  Sabino’s a farmer, particularly corn, sorghum and beans.  He learned this occupation from his parents with whom he farmed 24,500 square meters.  All of his farming chores were done by the family without having to hire anyone.  Currently, Sabino farms with help from his wife and children.  He also has cows, bulls and calves to produce milk to sell.

Sabino has asked Fundación Campo for a loan to buy lumber and metal sheeting to improve his roof. Currently, the wood that holds up the roof is in poor condition and the metal sheets let water seep through when it rains.  With help from the loan Sabino will be able to provide a more comfortable and safe home for his family preventing health problems caused by the dampness.

Sabino wants to continue improving his house.  Initially it was built entirely of metal sheets (walls and roof).  Gradually, Sabino has been able to build the walls out of cement.  He wants eventually to build the house completely and install a cement floor (it’s currently dirt) and to install iron roof supports.

loans.use: to buy lumber and metal sheeting to repair his roof.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Fatuma has a business selling used clothes.  She has been in this business for six years and she works seven days out of every week.  Fatuma sells her products from home at retail.  Fatuma has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Fatuma include increasing prices of clothes and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and build rental rooms. Fatuma lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO est formé de deux personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante  de ce groupe, nommée Akoko Séfako, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Akoko Séfako est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Lucien. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Akoko Séfako vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Il y a environs huit ans que Akoko Séfako exerce comme activité, la vente des produits de coiffure et des mèches, ce qui lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de la maison. Dans le souci d'élargir davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Akoko Séfako désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Akoko Séfako sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group Jesukpego is composed of two people living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Akoko Séfako, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the third time that this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to increase the level of their activity.

Akoko Séfako is 38 years old and is married to a mechanic named Lucien. The couple has five children, some attend school and all are under their financial responsibility. She lives with her husband and children. The couple provides together for all the household expenses.

For about eight years Akoko Séfako’s business has been selling hair products and hair extensions. This allows her to contribute without much difficulty to the needs of the household. In order to further expand her business and to better meet the needs of her customers, she wishes to increase her stock of products. To do this, Akoko Séfako requests together with the other group members of Jesukpego (Missessin), a third loan from ALIDé.The first two loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: purchase hair products and hair extensions.

loans.name: Rodante

texts.en: Rodante is involved in growing agricultural crops. He is married and has three child. He grows corn. His wife helps him in this business, and they work well together. Rodante wants to expand his business and maximize his profit. He wants to use the resulting profit to build a house. Rodante is requesting a loan in the sum of P 15,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita makes herself busy all day long in her food selling business. Early in the morning, she cooks and prepares food for daily meals to sell. She cooks chicken and pork viands such as chicken curry, fried food and vegetable dishes to offer to her customers. Teresita's customers are mostly students. Her business is located near the school.

Teresita is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy pork and chicken meat, eggs, and soft drinks to use in her food selling business. She hopes to make her business more profitable despite the hardships encountered in her business. 

She has two children and hopes to educate them very well to earn a degree in order to improve their lives some day.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken meat, eggs, and soft drinks to use in her food selling business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 44 años convive con Berta de 43 años; viven en casa propia junto a sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea ofrecer un mejor futuro. Pedro, es un hombre muy trabajador con el arduo esmero que dedica a su trabajo trata de sobresalir ante las dificultades del destino. Pedro es comerciante tiene un a pequeña tienda de abarrotes ubicado en el distrito de Quimbiri. La bodega de Pedro desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su negocio para luego recibir a sus primero compradores, sabiendo la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de poder encontrar los productos que necesitan. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y así estar al tanto de las cosas que pasan en su barrio, lleva 04 meses que empezó con su negocio y considera que lo mas difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el día. Con el crédito solicitado comprara más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería. Este es su préstamo numero 07 con MFP, esta contento por saber que obtendrá un apoyo financiero el la cual podrá cumplir con su trabajo. Asimismo. agradece a su banco comunal por trabajar responsablemente. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar productos para incrementar su tienda como: arroz, variedades de bebidas, fideos, azúcar, conservas, etc.
texts.en:
Pedro, aged 44, lives with Berta, who is 43, in their own house, together with their 3 dear children for whom they wish to offer a better future. Pedro is a hard-working man with an ardent concern to dedicate himself to working to overcome the difficulties presented by destiny. Pedro is a merchant with a tiny grocery store located in the Quimbiri district.

Pedro opens the doors of his store very early to receive the first customers, who can be sure to find the merchandise they need. What he likes most about his work is conversing with his customers and keeping on top of what occurs in his barrio.

It has been 4 months since he began his business and he finds the most difficult part staying on his feet almost all day. With the solicited loan he will purchase more groceries for his business and resupply the store with merchandise.

This will be Pedro's 7th loan through MFP and he is content  to know that he will obtain the financial help that makes it possible for him to continue his work. At the same time, he is grateful to his communal bank for working so responsibly. With the 1,500 new sols Pedro will buy products to improve his inventory, including rice, a variety of drinks, beans, sugar, preserves, etc.

loans.use: buy rice, a variety of drinks, beans, sugar and preserves to sell.

loans.name: Yuli Andrea

texts.es: La señora Yuli Andrea a sus 25 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración desde su casa de un plato típico de la región Antioqueña llamado tamal, este producto lo comercializa en el municipio del Santuario localizado al oriente de Antioquia, este negocio brinda los ingresos necesarios para el sustento familiar. La señora Yuli Andrea necesita de la compra de insumos para realizar su producto tales como maíz, verduras y condimentos, con lo anterior, la señora Yuli Andrea podrá mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos y así tener la oportunidad de brindarle una buena educación a su hija y cumplir su sueño de tener un restaurante.
texts.en: At 25 years old, Ms. Yuli works from her home preparing a typical dish of the Antioqueña region called "tamal." She sells this product in the municipality of Santuario, located in the western part of Antioquia. This business provides the necessary income to sustain her family. Yuli Andrea needs to purchase ingredients for making her product, such as corn, vegetables and condiments. This will allow Yuli Andrea to improve her sales and will provide her with an opportunity to offer her daughter a good education and to reach her dream of owning a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn, vegetables and condiments

loans.name: Bara

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune, célibataire qui s'active dans l'achat, la réparation et la vente de véhicules.Il est dans ce secteur depuis près de 10 ans.Avec les bénéfices tirés de son activité, il prend en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de ses deux parents qui sont à sa charge.Pour améliorer ses revenus, il sollicite un prêt de 300000f pour réparer un véhicule en achetant 4 portes et des accessoires.Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: The borrower is a young single man who is into buying, repairing, and selling vehicles. He's been in this business for about 10 years. With the profits gained from this activity, he provides for himself and his two dependent parents. To increase his income, he is applying for a 300000f loan so he can buy 4 doors and some accessories which he needs to fix a vehicle. His ambition is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy 4 doors and some accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry and piglets.

loans.name: San Juan 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Juan II” se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 13 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción. Todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas con las cuales desean poder ayudar a sus familias. Todas se esmeran esperanzadas, para poder dar a sus hijos un futuro  mejor del que a ellas les toca vivir.
Rosa es una de las integrantes, ella nos comenta que vende todo tipo de prendas, las cuales vende a muy buenos precios, ya que son de muy buena calidad, pero a bajo costo. Eso le ha ayudado a tener una buena clientela que la ayuda a tener mayores ingresos. Ella comenta que su sueño es poder tener una tienda para ofrecer mayor comodidad y variedad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener variedad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “San Juan II” committee is in its first cycle in the Mujeres Emprendedoras ["Women Entrepreneurs"] program in Fundacion Paraguaya. The group has 13 members and is located in the Asuncion zone. All of the members already have businesses with which they hope to help their families. They all try very hard with a great deal of hope; they work to be able to give their children a better future, better than what they have lived.
Rosa is one of the group members. She tells us that she sells all types of garments at very good prices. Her garments are of very high quality but low cost. This has allowed her to have a good customer base and income. She tells us that her dream is to be able to have a store in order to offer her clients more comfort and variety.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of summer clothing, with which she will be able to stock up and have a variety of garments to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy garments for the next sale.

loans.name: Margarita Elizabeth

texts.es: Margarita Elizabeth es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su trabajo. Ella vive junto a sus hijos y su esposo  con quien se dedican a la siembra de frijoles y maíz, un trabajo muy duro pero bien remunerado, debido a que estos granos básicos son los principales en la dieta del país, los cuales posteriormente comercializan en diferentes tiendas de productos perecederos. Margarita solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de semillas de maíz y frijoles para sembrar y de este modo incrementar la cantidad de cosecha que comercializan y así aumentar sus ganancias con lo que pueden contar con una vida mejor.

loans.use: Compra de semillas para sembrar

loans.name: Yahoska Rafaela

texts.es: Yahosca es una mujer casada, con un hijo menor de cuido se dedica a vender ropa, cosméticos variados de la Avon desde hace cinco años. Tiene 24 años  y es emprendedora. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa variada, cosméticos de la Avon como perfumen, delineadores, colonias, crema para cuerpo, crema para manos, etc.
texts.en: Yahosca is a married woman who has a minor child in her care.  She's had a business selling clothing and a variety of Avon cosmetics for 5 years.  She is a 24 year-old small-businesswoman.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of a variety of clothing and Avon cosmetics such as perfume, eyeliner, body cream, hand cream, etc.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing and Avon cosmetics such as perfumes, men's colognes, creams, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Mathe is 35-years-old. He is married with four children aged between 2 and 13 years, and they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been in a business for the past six years. His wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve her standards of livings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.en:
I have been dedicated to tortilla sales for some years, unfortunately I did not have the resources to prepare. The reason why I work strongly is so that my children can go to the university and who they have a good style of life. At the moment I work next to my mother and we shared the daily profits. Now, I want to contract another girl to increase my sales and power to give tortillas in neighboring areas.

SPANISH

Me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace algunos años, desafortunadamente no tuve los recursos para prepararme, por lo que trabajo fuertemente para que mis hijos puedan graduarse en la universidad y que tengan un buen estilo de vida. Actualmente trabajo junto a mi madre y compartimos las ganancias diarias, por lo que quiero contratar a otra muchacha para incrementar mis ventas y poder entregar tortillas en colonias vecinas a la mia.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, leña y otros.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Auntie Mary operates a "drinking spot" in her community. She sells many kinds of drinks in the spot. She has improved her business through the TEACH lending programs. Auntie Mary is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and needs a Kiva loan of $900 to buy more drinks for the store.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Business Description

Mauro sells fresh fruits from a stand in front of his home. He began his business with some money that his son loaned him. Today, Mauro sells fruits from the coast and the sierra and also those that are in season and occassionally those requested by his customers as well.

Loan use

Mauro needs to purchase more fruits and is considering purchasing them on wholesale because this would allow him to make more money. Furthermore, Mauro has an opportunity to construct a store within his home, which means he could keep more fruits fresh and clean while he displays them.

Personal Information

Mauro is 40 years old and has one son who lives with him. His home is made of reed. His main goal is to be able to build a house made of cement and to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

Mauro se dedica a al venta de frutas frescas en un sitio adecuado frente a su casa. Mauro empezó el negocio con un dinero que le prestó su hijo. Actualmente Mauro vende frutas de costa y sierra y las que están de temporada y que además son solicitadas pro sus clientes /p>

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita comprar mas frutas y ahora tiene pensado comprarlas al por mayor pues así va a tener mas ganancias. Además Mauro tiene la oportunidad de construir un local en su casa y así poder exponer la fruta y tenerla mas limpia y fresca

Información Personal

El tiene 40 años y un hijos que vive con el, su casa es de caña. Su principal meta es construir su casa de cemento y progresar en el negocio

loans.use: To purchase fruits on wholesale.

loans.name: Aiméé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aimée B., 37, is married and mother of two children. She sells “pagnes” (i.e., lengths of cloth used as a sort of sarong or to sew traditional dresses in Africa), using her income to contribute to the support of her family. With great care in managing her micro-business, she has managed to make it profitable. She has already taken out and repaid four small loans successfully. In order to satisfy her customers’ demands and keep up with the latest fashions, she is now asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which will permit her to build a shelter where she can display her cloth since walking around with it in the hot sun fades the colors. This loan will also allow her to buy her cloth from wholesalers and thus have a higher profit margin on each sale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 37 ans, Madame B. Aimée est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. C’est une revendeuse de pagnes et elle arrive à contribuer aux besoins du foyer grâce à ses revenus. Par la gestion rigoureuse de ses activités elle arrive à la rentabiliser. Elle a à son actif 4 crédits bien remboursés. Pour être à la hauteur de sa clientèle et suivre les nouveautés, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour construire un hangar et exposer les pagnes car le fait de se promener sous le soleil agit sur la couleur des pagnes. Ce crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner chez les grossistes et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Building a shelter where she can display her African cloth Construction d'un hangar pour vente de pagne

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
I am Ishrat P. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I have four children, all of whom are in school. I stitch clothes on order for my neighborhood clientele to support my husband and share his financial burden.

My husband is a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle) driver and now he wants to open a car battery store. There is no such store in our neighborhood and the people have to go to markets at a distance to buy their car batteries. I am quite confident that our business will do well as it will be the only store of its kind in our area. Please lend us US$ 350.

loans.use: OPEN UP A CAR BATTERY STORE

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Mrs. Ban Y., 43, is a widow who works selling groceries in her community, making about $5.40 per day. Her husband is a teacher. They have three children; two are teachers like their father and one is a student. She is asking for a loan of $1000  to expand her inventory and meet increasing client demand.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell in her grocery

loans.name: Inés Maria

texts.es:
Ines Maria Davila C. is married, has completed through the sixth year of primary school and has three children of school age. As all Nicaraguan women she is the pillar of her home and always looking for ways to help her family cover their living expenses.

Eighteen years ago, as a result of her desire to get ahead, she started selling seafood. She started as a peddler selling her products in the streets. She has now established her business in the municipal market with the proceeds of twenty loans that she obtained. She tells us that the goals that she achieved were due to the loans that she obtained from Ceprodel.

This business started with a very small amount of inventory. In time she has acquired more and her sales have increased. Her initial investment was of C $2,000 cordobas (approximately USD $110), which were loaned to see how her business would turn out.

Mrs. Davila has been working with CEPRODEL for three years. She is satisfied with the loans that she has received, they have been appropriate and processed in a timely manner. They have enabled her to cover the expenses of her business and satisfy her clients. She has a history of twenty loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Inés Maria D. C. es una señora casada, cursó hasta el sexto grado de primaria, tiene 3 hijos, los tres se encuentran en la edad escolar. Como todas las mujeres Nicaragüenses siempre están siendo el pilar de la casa y buscando siempre una forma de de cómo ayudar a la familia para poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar.

Producto de la necesidad de salir adelante ella comenzó a vender Marisco hace Dieciocho años, comenzó a vender de manera ambulante, es decir andaba en las calles con su pana, en la actualidad ella ya tiene establecido su negocio en el mercado municipal, con veinte créditos obtenidos, ella nos expresa que los logros alcanzados han sido a través de los créditos que ha obtenido en Ceprodel.

Este negocio lo comenzó con una pequeña pana, con el tiempo fue obteniendo más hoy en día sus ventas han incrementado, su capital inicial fue de C$ 2,000 (córdobas) los que un día presto para ver como le iba, fue a si que comenzó con la venta de marisco.

La señora D. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace tres año, nos manifiesta que se siente satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, los cuales le han servido para suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela, Ella tiene un record de 20 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of seafood.

loans.name: Nalukolongo 1(B) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Hadijah is 32 years old and married with four children. She has a poultry business. With the extra business profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To expand the poultry business

loans.name: Mirna Maribel

texts.en:
Mirna Maribel Garcia D. C. owns land where she raises and sells pigs in the town of Picota, San Martin. She started the business 6 months ago because she wanted her family to have a second income. Although she has no prior business experience, she has already experienced much success. She is very friendly and loves building relationships with clients.

Mirna is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. She is happy to have started her business. She now feels useful, has more friends, and greater sense of self-esteem. She is proud she can help her family and save for her children’s education.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Los Claveles, Mirna is requesting a loan of S/. 800 to be repaid over a period of 6 months. She will use her loan to purchase more piglets because there is a high demand for pork in Picota.

loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: Nurmuhammad

texts.ru:
Nurmahammad A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 33 years old, is married and has 4 children. He has a High School education and is self employed. He is in the business of raising cattle. When the animals are grown, he sells them on the market. Currently the prices have slightly dropped and it's a perfect opportunity to increase turnover. This will allow Nurmahammad to earn a little more and thus take better care of his family. This business also helps the development of cattle raising in the region as a whole. This is why Nurmuhammad has come to Kiva for a loan. He plans to repay the loan within a 6 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Эрганов Нурмухаммад проживает в городе Яван . Клиенту 33 год , он женат и имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее , нигде не работает. Но несмотря на это он зарабатывает на жизнь животноводством. Клиент имеет небольшое хозяйство, в котором разводит бычков. После того как они подрастут , клиент выводит их на базар и продает. Но в данный момент цены на животных немного упали. Поэтому ему необходимо купить бычков . Это поможет увеличить поголовье скота . Кроме того это поможет зарабатывать немного больше , что даст возможность прокормить свою семью.А еще занятие животноводством отдельно позволит развитию животноводческого сектора в целом. Для этого клиент должен получить дополнительное финансирование путем кредитования. А погасит кредит клиент в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase several additional animals

loans.name: Bella Vista Group

texts.es:
Seventeen women constitute part of the Bella Vista Association, which belongs to the main Los Andes Group. The Los Andes Group has worked in partnership with Pro-Mujer for the last eight years and it has always complied with the terms of the loans granted to it.

Almost all the children confirm that the financial support of their families is basically the responsibility of their mothers since, unfortunately, most of the women were abandoned by their husbands, forcing them to become heads of their households.

Handicraft is the main activity of the group and original garments woven in Alpaca wool are in great demand by their customers. In addition, members of the association also produce quilts, blankets, scarves, etc. They need more capital to buy raw materials for making more products and to enable them to export these products.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

17 mujeres forman parte de la asociación Bella Vista que pertenece al centro focal Los Andes que trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace ocho años, demostrando siempre cumplimiento en cuanto a sus créditos. Casi todas hijos afirman que la economia de sus hogares depende basicamente de ellas ya que lamentablemente a la mayor parte de ellas sus esposos las abandonaron teniendo que ser jefes de familia. La artesanía es la actividad principal del grupo, originales prendas tejidas en lana de alpaca son la mayor atracción para sus compradores,, además también producen mantas, mantillas, chalinas y otros. Necesitan mayor capital para la compra de materia prima para, realizar mayores productos y poderlos distribuir al exterior.

loans.use: Require more capital for the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu K. is 39 years old and married with five children. She has been running her clothing business for more than four years. With her previous loans, she expanded her business and started selling the materials wholesale to a few retailers in Makeni town. During this period, she advertised her products to clients in Freetown and now has many customers who would like to purchase the materials wholesale.

Isatu is requesting a loan of Le.3,500,000 ($US1,200) to increase her production. She would like to see her children through their education.

loans.use: Purchase cotton materials, dyes, caustic soda and starch.

loans.name: Yakpadan Stéphane

texts.fr:
Mr. Yakpadan Stéphane P. was born in Bolou on 29 May 1985. He lives with his wife Mawussi AKPO, who is a seamstress. In 2006, he opened a store selling Fan brand milk in the Adidogomé district in Lomé.

The first loan he obtained from WAGES allowed him to establish himself in the district as a seller. After quickly repaying his first loan, he is asking for this second one to supply himself by buying 3 bags of Fan milk.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur P. Yakpadan Stéphane est né à Bolou le 29 mai 1985. Il vit avec sa femme AKPO Mawussi qui est une couturière. Depuis 2006, il a ouvert un magasin de dépôt de fan milk dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé.

Le premier prêt qu’il avait obtenu auprès de WAGES lui a permis de s’installer dans le quartier en tant que opérateur économique. Après un prompt remboursement de son premier prêt, il sollicite ce second pour faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de 3 sacs de fan.

loans.use: To buy "Fan" brand milk

loans.name: Sindiya (La Fraternité) Group

texts.fr:
United by geographical proximity and business partnership, the members of the Sindiya group are married women, mostly from polygamous households. Their average age is 38, and most have two children. They live in the Médine neighborhood of the city of Sikasso, in the third economic region of Mali. The group buys and sells wax-printed cloth (a favorite of Malian women) and food products (oils, bananas, eggs). This is their first foray into microfinance, and are collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso. The women of the Sindiya group want to use their loan to buy ten units of wax-printed cloth, a 25-liter drum of oil, ten sacks of yams, one hundred bunches of bananas, a supply of chicken eggs, etc. They purchase food products exclusively in the villages surrounding Sikasso, while they buy cloth and oil from wholesalers in the city market. They then sell their goods retail and wholesale in Sikasso, selling door-to-door and often on credit. The merchandise is sold from carts or from their stall in the Médine marketplace. Their clientele includes members of all social levels. They foresee a profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which they will use in part to support their families and pay off the interest on the loan; they will reinvest the remainder in their business.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Liées par des liens de voisinage et des liens professionnels, les membres du groupe Sindiya sont des femmes mariées vivant en générale dans les foyers polygames avec en moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, et 2 enfants. Elles résident dans le quartier Médine de Sikasso(troisième région économique de la république du Mali). L’activité principale de ce groupe est le petit commerce de pagnes wax (tissus preférés des femmes du Mali) et de produits alimentaires (huiles, bananes, ouefs de volailles). Elles sont à leur prémière expérience de collaboration avec une institution de micro finance notamment Soro Yiriwaso. Les femmes veulent acheter avec ce prêt 10 pièces pagnes, 1 bidon de 25 litres d’huiles,10 sacs d’ignames, une centaine de régimes de bananes, 10 alvéoles d’oeufs de poules etc.) Elles se ravitaillent exclusivement dans les villages environants pour les produits alimentaires. Par contre l’huile et les pagnes wax sont achetés auprès des grossistes du grand marché de Sikasso. Elles revendent dans la ville de sikasso en détails, en gros et au comptant très souvant en ambulant. Les marchandises sont souvent mises dans des tasses pour les vendre de porte en porte ou etalées sur des tables sous des hangars au marché de Médine. La clientèle est constituée de toutes les catégories sociales de cette ville. Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice de 20.000FCFA, quelles utiliseront en partie pour subvenir aux dépenses familliales, à payer les intêrets du prêt et investir le reste dans leurs activités.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs and printed cloth

loans.name: Chorm

texts.en:
Mr. Chorm K. is 37 years old and his work as a driver of a plowing machine earns him 10,000 Riel (US $2.50) a day. His wife, Mrs. Pot Kear, is 50 years old and she has been selling fish for six years. She earns approximately 10,000 Riel (US $2.50) per day. They have five children; two are married and the oldest one helps her selling fish. They live in Chi Kreng Commune, Siem Reap Province.

To increase his family's income, Chorm is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Riel (US $375.00) to purchase piglets to breed.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Auxiliadora tiene 44 años de edad, con domicilio en el barrio Santa Rosa, tiene tres hijos de 19, 23 y 25 años de edad, uno de ellos ya es independiente y dos están cursando la universida. Es casada, su esposo es contratista en una empresa de Managua. El negocio de Doña Maria es un pequeño restaurante en su casa de habitación. Tiene 44 años de experiencia en este negocio, el cual fue heredado de su mamá. Este pequeño negocio tiene un significado especial ya que es familiar y han hecho mucho esfuerzo para poder sacarlo adelante y de esta manera poder tener ingresos para sustentar a la familia. La solicitud del préstamo es la inverisión en el negocio, será usado en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los platos que ofrece a sus clientes. Sus planes a corto plazo son poder invertir en la infraestructura del local, para así poder ofertar un mejor servicio. El mayor anhelo de Maria Auxiliadora es poder darles a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que estos lleguen a convertirse en personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora is 44 years of age living in the neighborhood of Santa Rosa. She has three children who are 19, 23, and 25 years of age. One of them is independent and two are studying at university. She is married. Her husband is a contractor for a company in Managua. Maria's business is a small restaurant in her house. She has 44 years of experience in this business, which she inherited from her mother. This small business has special significance since it is a family business and they have put a lot of effort into making it succeed and, in this manner, have income to support the family. The loan will be invested in the business and will be used to purchase ingredients for the dishes that she offers to customers. Her short-term plans are to invest in the restaurant's infrastructure so that she may offer better service. Maria Auxiliardora's greatest wish is to give her children the education that is necessary to become contributing members of society.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make her dishes.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is divorced with two children. She lives in her home town of Ordzhonikidze and sells footwear in the central marketplace there. She has been in this trade for 13 years. Larisa currently has over $5,000 in turnover capital, and her net profit is little over $600.

Larisa's business has always boasted a nice variety of merchandise, resulting in high demand. She is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivna to help her generate additional income and keep her sales stable. Larisa has a long history of good credit. She is known as an entrepreneur of integrity. We believe her good record and honest approach to business will guarantee prompt loan repayment.

Note: This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase her footwear inventory

loans.name: Assad

texts.en:
Assad is a 43-year-old man who lives with his wife and their two children in Bourj El Barajneh in southern suburbs of Lebanon. 

Assad owns a taxi. His taxi needs maintenance. Therefore, he has asked for a loan of $1000 (USD) from Al Majmoua. Assad has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua from 4 years and his reputation is very good.

loans.use: Assad wants to do maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en:
Sanobar M. is 45 years old. She works purchasing and reselling cows with her husband. She has 3 children, two of whom are already students. Sanobar would like to request a loan of $ 750 for the term of 12 months in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and to meet customer demand. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and to increase their income further. Sanobar and her husband plan to use the increased income to fund their children’s education.  

About Tajikistan: 

Tajikistan is one of the poorer of the 15 former Soviet republics, with a GDP per capita of less than $600. The civil war, which took place soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., severely damaged the already weak economic infrastructure and caused a sharp decline in agricultural production and the manufacturing sector.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  All of these factors have resulted in a severe lack of jobs and have forced hundreds of thousands to leave Tajikistan to find work in other countries, mostly in Russia.  While Tajikistan has experienced some economic growth since the end of the Civil War, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty. 

About IMON International: 

IMON International's mission is to promote sustainable economic development and improved quality of life in Tajikistan by insuring reliable access to financial services for the economically active members of the population. IMON International has 8 branch offices throughout Tajikistan and their entrepreneurs work in many parts of the country's economic sector including trade, manufacturing, agriculture, and services. As of October 2008, IMON International had 27,802 active clients and a total portfolio of $28,405,549.  Approximately 44% of these clients are women and 65% are from rural areas.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for sale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana L., 60, is married with 8 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Susana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is a good carpenter and he earns money to help out with the business and supporting the family.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, bush knives, and seedlings, etc.

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.en:
Mhamad is a 50-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Mhamad has owned a grocery store for five years. He also sells vegetables. He requested a loan of $500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store, such as vegetables and cigarettes. 

This is Mhamad's second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him to diversify his products and improve his business. Mhamad is special in his work because he is open until late in the evening. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he lacked cash. In the future, he plans to expand his business and lower his prices.

loans.use: Mhamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Cordila

texts.en: Cordila is an industrious fashion designer and she also sells sarongs in her shop. Cordila learned this business for 2 years and she has been in the business for the past 9 years. Cordila has 5 apprentices in her shop and she has 4 sewing machines. Cordila is 28 years old and married with a child. Cordila needs a loan to purchase one sewing machine and sarongs. She says thanks to Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and one sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs. She is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan of N 80,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs, and provisions to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. sells tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Grace is 36 years old and married to a businessman. She has 4 children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado por el barrio pampa, son personas que no tenían accedo al sistema financiero y están agradecidas con la institución por apoyo que brindan con créditos con intereses bajos y sobre todo porque les da la oportunidad de crecer económicamente en sus negocios. Menciona la tesorera y la presidenta que si en esta oportunidad les va bien seguirán trabajando con la institución para mejorar su calidad de vida. De la mayoría sus negocios son la venta de comida.
texts.en:
The community bank is located in the barrio pampa; these are people who didn't have access to the financial system, and who are very grateful to the institution for the support they provide in the form of low interest loans, and mostly for the opportunity to grow financially in their businesses. The president and the treasurer have indicated that if they are successful this time around they will continue to work with the institution to improve their quality of life. The bulk of their business is the sale of food.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Annah from Mwanza. She is married with two children, between the ages of 3 and 9 years old. Annah has been running a shop business since 2008. She sells cloths such as kanga to women in her community. She works 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more kanga to sell to her customers. In the future, she plans to open another business and improve her income. Annah thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more kanga to sell

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with a son and lives in Zaporozhye. She sells clothing in the local market called Voznesenovskyi and a runs a small store in the main Lenin Avenue. She offers affordable merchandise at reasonable prices and invests much of her time in development of her business. She has been in business for 15 years. Oksana currently has about 10,000 Grivnyas in gross income. 

Oksana is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise (tunics, t-shirts and tops) to increase her sales and profits this summer. She is hoping to invest her newly-generated profits in further expansion of her venture.

We believe Oksana’s responsible approach to business and current financial assistance will be beneficial for her business by keeping it competitive and promoting growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for her and the family.

loans.use: To increase her inventory for summer

loans.name: Zibira

texts.ru: Муродалиева Зибира проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Зибира  более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Она у себя во дворе имеет торговую точку, где торгует продуктами питания. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Zibira M. lives in Kurgan-Tube city. She is 42 years old, married and has six children. Her husband works in Russia to support his family back home. Zibira has over six years of experience trading. In her courtyard, she has a small shop where she sells food. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her trade turnover.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase trade turnover

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is married with four children and they are all in school. Felicia is a 42 year old trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty. She is very serious with her business. 

She trades in food items like plantain. She started this business eighteen years ago and she has been very resourceful to her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains to serve her customers throughout the season. She has been facing increased prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes that with this loan she can buy bunches of plantain directly from the farmers, preventing middlemen who retail to her at high prices.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of plantains.

loans.name: Uñatatasiñani Group

texts.es: “Uñatatasiñani” significa “ nos daremos cuenta” así se hacen llamar un grupo de diez señoras que se agruparon por la necesidad de  acceder a un préstamo para mejorar sus negocios, todas tienen negocios diferentes de comercialización, es decir, compra y venta de calzados, ropa de bebe, ferretería, herramientas de soldadura, papa y accesorios de relojería, es el caso de Emiliana López, con 37 años de edad, que vende ropa de bebe, hace 3 años, ella compra su mercadería en la “Tumusla” y lo vende en la ferias de la ciudad de El Alto,  como la “Feria de la 16 de Julio”, una de las más granes de Bolivia y necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
“Uñatatasiñani” means “we realize,” and it is a group of 10 women, who came together because they needed to get a loan to improve their businesses. All of them have different businesses, including buying and selling footwear and baby clothing, a hardware store, tools for welding, potatoes, and accessories for a watch store. Emiliana López is 37 years old, and she has sold baby clothing for 3 years. She buys her merchandise in “Tumusla” and sells it in fairs in the city of El Alto, like the “Fair of July 16,” which is one of the largest fairs in Bolivia. She needs a loan to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (baby clothing, tubes, potatoes, watch accessories)

loans.name: Mrs. Sokun Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people who live in Chrouy Slaeng village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokun C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy an ice-creA. box to conduct a new business. Her husband, Mr. Yang T., is a construction worK. who can make only a meager income to support the family. Mrs. Sokun C. has two children; one is attending the local school, while the other stays at home and helps her in the current business.

Five members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to re-sell and an ice-cream box to conduct a new business

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is married with a son. She lives in Zaporozhye.

Aya is in the footwear sales business. She launched her trade eight years ago and today she owns a vending kiosk in one of the biggest markets of her home town. She set a reasonable pricing policy which helped her gain a solid client base. Currently, she has about 16,000 Grivnyas in stock and her net profit is about 1,500 Grivnyas a month.

Aya is requesting a loan of 9,100 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal footwear for further retail sales. She is a very outgoing and cheerful person which helps her face the daily routine with a smile and handle business issues with a calm spirit. She believes the current loan will help her business keep its stable standing in the market and develop further in the future.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal footwear

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es: Las Socias del grupo “Margaritas” están representadas por la señora Alejandrina y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales 11 son mujeres y 3 los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta D. joyas D. fantasías, cosméticos, comida, abarrotes, Dulces, al servicio D. limpieza y los varones se dedican a la construcción D. viviendas y al transporte publico D. pasajeros. La competencia dentro D. su rubros es alta pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero saben el trabajo en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en otras instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The “Margaritas” Group is led by Sra. Alejandrina and consists of 14 members (11 women and 3 men). They are involved in different retail business selling products such as costume jewelry, cosmetics, food, groceries, and candy. Some have service businesses such as housekeeping. The men are involved in construction and public transportation. The competition in their area is high but they know how to succeed in their respective businesses.

This loan is intended to increase their businesses through the purchase of merchandise, supplies, and tools needed to improve their earnings. This will enable them to give their families a better quality of life. Regarding their credit experience, the members are starting their first loan cycle, but they know how solidarity groups operate because they have worked with other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en: Clementina sells foodstuffs and provisions. She is 33 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora A. is from the village of Argayoso, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Nora owns and operates a business buying and selling "copra", or dried coconut meat, in the local area. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Nora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa U. de 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija la cual es ya casada pero trabajan juntas en un pequeño comedor que tiene en donde vende desayuno, almuerzo, últimamente las ventas están bajas y abecés pierde la comida debido a que no la vende, pero cada día es la lucha por mejorar su economía, vive en un barrio llamado Waspan Sur en la capital de Managua, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su casa ya que poco a poco ha ido construyendo por que es lo mas caro. Lleva tres ciclos en Afodenic el cual con este comprara carnes, pollo, verduras, frutas, granos básicos, gaseosas y otros para mejorar el servicio de la venta de comida y elevar las ventas, ya que mucho capital esta invertido ya que da crédito para la quincena y es por eso se necesita la inversión. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios otorgados que gracias a estos ha hecho posible las mejoras en su negocio como en su vida personal en sastifcer las necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa U. is 51 years old and is the single mother of one daughter, who is already married. They work together at Rosa's small restaurant, where she sells breakfast and lunch. Her sales have been slow lately, and she sometimes has to waste food when she can't sell it; she struggles each day to improve her economic situation. She lives in a neighborhood called South Waspan in the Nicaraguan capital city of Managua. Her goal is to finish the home improvements she has been making, little by little. She hasn't been able to do all of the construction at once because it would be very expensive. She has been with Afodenic for three loan cycles now, and in this loan cycle she plans to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, fruits, basic grains, sodas, and other items to improve service at her restaurant and boost sales. She has already invested a lot of money in her business, and since she allows her clients to pay on credit, she needs the money up front in order to make this investment. She is grateful to Afodenic for the benefits she has obtained through loans; she has been able to make improvements to her business and in her personal life, and she is now better able to satisfy her own personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, chicken, vegetables, and basic grains to prepare meals

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina B. has been a fish vendor in her village for the past year. She usually purchases her products in the public market of Cauayan, Isabela, and then sells them at retail prices. Lina is married and she resides with her husband in Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She hopes that through their mutual cooperation, they can survive life’s difficulties and uplift their living condition. 

Lina is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to expand her retail business. She plans to increase her merchandise by having more kilos of fish available for sale in her village. She believes that in this way, her business will become profitable and she will be able to provide for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: For the expansion of her retail fish business.

loans.name: César Carlos

texts.es:
César es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en el sector San Martín de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cuatro años de dedica a la carpintería. Nos comenta que aprendió este oficio de un amigo. Usualmente trabaja en base a pedidos aunque también trabaja independientemente en algunas ocasiones. Esta actividad es el único ingreso con el que sustenta a su familia por lo que siempre da todo de si para sacar su negocio adelante

César nos comenta que desea ampliar su negocio con la venta de mesas y sillas, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar la madera que necesita para elaborarlas, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad se solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su sueño es seguir haciendo crecer a su negocio para terminar de construir su casa y brindarle una mejor educación a sus hijos. El ya ha trabajado con nuestra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerado un cliente excelente.
texts.en:
César is a 49-year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in the San Martín neighborhood in the city of Lambayeque, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For four years now César has made a living as a carpenter. He tells us that he learned this trade from a friend of his. He usually works on a custom-order basis, though he also makes furniture independently on occasion. This activity is his only source of income and is how he supports his family, and that is why he does everything he can in order for his business to get ahead. César tells us that he wants to expand his business by selling tables and chairs, but he does not have enough capital to purchase the wood that he needs to make them. That is why he has asked Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles. César’s dream is to keep growing his business so that he can finish construction on his house and provide his children with a better education. He has already worked with this lending institution before—he demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making his payments, and for that reason is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wood for making and selling chairs and tables

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una socia muy trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 40 años, es madre de cinco hijos (4 son mayores) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es agricultor.
Liliana se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas de la región, actividad que realiza por las tardes. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace cinco años y empezó con un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que pudo comprar productos para su venta.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà mesas y sillas para brindar una mejor atenciòn al cliente y a su vez comprarà productos al por mayor para su negocio. 
La meta de Liliana es tener un restaurante bien implementado.
texts.en:
Liliana is a very hard-working and dynamic client who lives in the Campo Verde district in the region of Ucayali. She is 40 years old, is the mother of five children (four of whom are grow-up), and she lives with her husband who is a farmer. Liliana's business is the sale of her region's typical food every afternoon. She has been part of the Communal Bank “Las Nazarenas” for five years and started with a loan of 300.00 new soles which she used to buy products to facilitate her sales. She now needs a loan of 3000.00 new soles to be able to buy tables and chairs in order to offer better service to her clients and she will also buy ingredients wholesale for her business. Liliana's goal is to have a well-established business.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use this loan to buy ingredients wholesale for her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria P. is a 40-year-old woman with the determination and faith to get out from the ties of poverty. She is a mother to four young children. She lives on Talim Island, Binangonan, in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. She is married to Eliezer, a fisherman.

She joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap Inc.), a Kiva field partner in the Philippines, and the organization she have grown to love since 1995. ASHI helped her to start a business that helps her husband to pay for their daily expenditures. She and her husband had been in the fishing business for more than ten  years. 

For her eighth loan, she is requesting Php 28,000.00 to continue her fishing business with the support of her husband. She will purchase assorted supplies for her fishing business, such as fishnet, rope, steel, bamboo, threads, and a fishing boat.

She dreams that, some day soon, she will have a larger space to store her fishing materials, a bigger fishing cage, and a stall in the market to sell her fish. She dreams also that she will be able to send her children to school and see them finish their studies. Gloria wants to thank ASHI for all its initiatives for the poor and thank the Kiva lenders who fund this loan. 

Like most families here in the Philippines, they want the best in life and a happy family. Now, she enjoys seeing how her ASHI loan changes their lives and gives them more opportunities to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her fishing business

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa lives with her husband and three children in Tosontsengel in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. Her husband herds cattle in the wintertime and works for a private construction company in the summertime. Her two older children, 16 and 11, attend a local secondary school and the youngest child, 3, stays at home with her mother.

Tsevelmaa is planning to start a business with her sister selling dairy products. Her sister has five years of experience in this type of retail business so Tsevelmaa is confident that the business will be successful and that she will be able to learn valuable skills. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to buy milk and dairy products at wholesale prices for her start-up business.

Tsevelmaa is very hardworking and open-minded and her dream is to one day start her own business and sell a variety of dairy products to local residents.

loans.use: To buy milk and dairy products to sell

loans.name: Arlen María

texts.es:
Arlen G. es una dama muy trabajadora que se desempeña como maestra de primaria en una  escuela a unos 15 km del municipio de El Sauce, donde tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta labor porque siempre le ha gustado enseñar a los niños.

Ella ha iniciado a construir su casa de habitación porque ha estado en malas condiciones y ella está comprometida con el bienestar de su hijo en edad escolar y por ende debe de llevar a cabo la tarea de construcción de vivienda. Para ello está acudiendo a Ceprodel con el fin de recibir un crédito el que será otorgado para la  compra de los materiales de construcción y así suplir la necesidad a su hijo de tener un techo digno.
texts.en:
Arlen G. is a very hard-working lady who works as a primary teacher in a school that is 15 kilometers from the El Sauce municipality. She has done this work for eight years because she has always liked teaching children. She has started to build her house because it has been in bad condition. She is committed to the well being of her school age child, and she therefore needs to get working on the construction. She is coming to Ceprodel to get a loan to buy the construction materials. This way she will provide her son with a decent roof over his head.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya G. is a single mother in Nikopol, Ukraine. She owns a clothing business offering merchandise at retail prices at two different markets of her home town. She launched this business five years ago. Presently, Lidiya has 30,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital and her income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas. 

Lidiya is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to diversify her clothing and footwear merchandise and boost her sales this spring following the slack, slow winter season. She is hoping to open a third sales facility and expand her trade as a result. Lidiya is a borrower of integrity and responsibility with a good credit record.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 33-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ali has owned a nut roasting shop since 1980 because it is a family business, therefore, he took up his father’s work. He sells all sorts of nuts like almonds, cashews, pistachios, macadamias, pecans, hazelnuts, seeds, peanuts, coated peanuts and more. 

Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his customers and offers a big variety of products, and his customers feel comfortable purchasing from him. His customers are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. 

When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulty since he took up his family’s business. Ali decided on doing his business because of his experience. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a roaster for his shop. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 

In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his shop by selling outside of Lebanon.

loans.use: To purchase a roaster for his shop.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng K., 46, has an annual business planting rice crops, which she harvests and sells when the rice ripens. She has been farming for many years. Usually, she depends on income from her husband, who is a fisherman at the river.
Sreng K. has seven children, one of whom is married and lives separately while the others are single. To make a more comfortable life, one of her daughters works sewing clothes in the garment industry. Sreng K. will use her loan to purchase a pump to pump water for her crop.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to pump water for her crop

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Thy M. is a 30-year-old married man and he is the leader of this group loan which consists of four-members located in Preaek Ksev village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mr. Thy M. is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support his family living. For this business, he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to purchase a motorbike for his business.

Mr. Thy M.’ wife, Mrs. Sreyneang Run, is a farming laborer who receives a small salary to support her family. This couple has three children: one is a student in the local school while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is married with two adult children. He owns a retail business selling food at one of the open markets in Uzhgorod town. Victor has been in this business for 16 years. Hard work and persistence helped him to develop his business well and make it a stable source of income for his family. Victor would like to borrow 6,500 hryvnia to increase his assortment and make additional income.

loans.use: To increase his assortment

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
