Mrs. Merlyn G. is from Linconan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Merlyn is 32 years old. Mrs. G. is engaged in different business activities. Her husband is a farmer, which serves as their main source of income. She earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to be engaged in other business activities. She successfully repaid their previous loan taken from PMPC. This previous loan was for the expansion of their business. As of now, Merlyn has a new loan of 10,000 taken from PMPC. This loan is for  additional capital for their business and also to expand their farming. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Towards additional capital for her farm and fish vending businesses.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia P. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 47 years old. Cynthia is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cynthia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling food and daily-use products in the local community. Cynthia has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Cynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Cynthia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manh Tan1-1 Group

texts.en:
Ngan T. D. was born in 1957. She has three children who are grown up. The oldest child and the second are married; the youngest child is working for Electric Power. Her husband is a worker. Not only does she grow rice, but also she raises seven pigs and poultry.  Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong. This is the first time she is participating in SEDA, hoping to have a better life. She needs 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

 About other borrowers in her group:

Thom V. D. was born in 1981. He is married with two sons. His wife is a worker who makes shoes. He has a hairdressing shop. He is a hairdresser. He has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. He wants to expand his shop. So he participates in SEDA. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND and tries to repay punctually.

Huong T. H. was born in 1988. She has a daughter. She is a farmer and she sells bread in the morning. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her small business.

Thiet T. V. was born in 1990. Her husband is a carpenter. She sells fast food in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her business.

Quyen N. P. was born in 1980. He sells chicken in the market. He has a daughter. He has a monthly income of about 4,500,000 VND. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for his small business.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: John Koileken Ole

texts.en:
John Koileken Ole K. is 44 years old. He is married to Sempeo K. and is the father of four children.

John is a farmer, which he does on his own piece of land. He has been doing this for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET through a friend, who is already a registered member of KADET, a Kiva partner. This will be his first loan. He is planning to  spend 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to plow; 20,000 KES on harrowing; 20,000 KES on seeds; and 15,000 KES on planting his 10 acres of wheat. Wheat has proved to be doing well in the area due to favorable weather conditions and adequate rainfall.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. John's dream is to do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: For plowing, harrowing, buyings seeds and planting 10 acres of wheat

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María Antonia tiene 43 años, reside en Concepción Batres, Departamento de Usulután, vive con su hija de 26 años y un nieto de 2 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos.
Ella aprendió este negocio, por la madre desde muy joven le enseño  sobre el cuidado y alimentación de Cerdos, no posee horario de trabajo, su experiencia es una de las ventajas del negocio. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar Cerdos y concentrado, para alimentarlos y cuidarlos, hasta que estén listos para la venta, esto contribuirá a mantener el negocio de María, generando estabilidad económica a esta familia.
Los sueños de María son ampliar la granja, que la economía familia sea sostenible para apoyar en las necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is 43 years-old and lives with her 26 year-old daughter and 2 year-old grandson in Concepcion Batres (in the Department of Usulutan) where she raises pigs. At a very young age, she learned about the care and feeding of pigs from her mother. She doesn't have a set work schedule, but she possesses a lot of experience running this business. She's requesting a loan to buy more cattle and feed so she can raise them until they are ready to be sold. This loan will allow her to maintain her business, and to provide for her family's well-being. Maria also hopes to one day expand her farm so she can continue to support her family's basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Odinahon's Group

texts.en:
Odinahon Z. is the leader of her group. She is 33 and married. She has three sons and all of them are in school. Three years ago, with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Odinahon and her husband began to breed livestock and sell it after fattening for a higher price. In this way, they make 4,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Odinahon wants to purchase sheep for breeding. In the future, she is planning to increase the number of livestock and save money to be able to pay for her children’s education at the university.

Gulnara J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 35 and married. She has three daughters and a son and all of them study at school. Seven years ago, with the initial investment of 10,000 soms, Gulnara and her husband started to breed cattle. By selling the cattle after fattening, they make 4,000 soms per month.  Gulnara applied for the loan because she wants to purchase a bull and resell it at a higher price after fattening. 

Almazbek A., 29, is married. He has two sons and a daughter and all of them are preschool age (In Kyrgyzstan, children go to school when they are seven). Four years ago, with the initial investment of 10,000 soms, Almazbek rented a place and started to sell convenience goods. He makes 4,000 soms per month.  With the money received from the loan, he wants to purchase foodstuffs to increase the turnover of his business. In the future, Almazbek plans to expand his business and wants to build a big house.

Ulpat K., 44, is married. She has two daughters and two sons. The older daughter and her Dad went to work in Russia to make some money, and the other children are students.  Six years ago, with the initial investment of 10,000 soms, Ulpat rented a place and started to sell convenience goods. She makes 8,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for her to repair her house and pay for her children’s education. Ulpat also breeds livestock and now the price for livestock is low. So with money received from the loan, she wants to purchase sheep for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie T. is a 35-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a spices & vegetables vending  business.  She lives in Prk. Gumamela, Brgy. Calumangan, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her  spices & vegetables vending  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.

Emilie is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she  can  stock up on her inventory of spices and buy more fresh vegetables to sell.   This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Emilie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional stock to sell

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Jenifa A. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs, including Sudanese local beans (ful) and kombo (a vegetable), in her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in her restaurant. 

Jenifa is 23 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel F. is from Labuyo, Tangub City. She is 39 years old. Raquel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products like lotion, face powder, soap and others in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Raquel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Raquel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Erupe Ellim

texts.en:
Erupe Ellim I. is a 25-year-old gentleman who is married to Susan Nekesa with three children aged 9, 6 and 2 years respectively. He has been running a hotel business for the past 12 years and is able to make a profit of about Kshs 18,000 every month.

Erupe was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs 10,000. He is planning to use the amount to buy video cassettes which his customers want so they have something to watch in the hotel and some more hotel utensils. He hopes to make a profit which he will use to boost his business.

Erupe has future plans of opening other branches so that he can improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy video cassettes and hotel utensils

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 59 years old and married. She is engaged in farming and hog-raising. She continues to work hard to help provide for her family. Fely is thankful for the rainy season because it helps her in farming, and she hopes to increase her yield. Fely also hopes her pigs will be healthy so she can sell them easily.

Fely joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Fely is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to buy hog feed and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Siatta

texts.fr:
Madame Siatta Koné est une femme mariée de 30 ans qui vit  dans  une famille traditionnelle avec ses douze enfants, ses co-épouses et leur  mari  dans le village Socourani dans la Sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du Mali. 
Pour augmenter son capital elle décide d’aller au  prêt  individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son troisième  cycle, après avoir correctement remboursé les deux prêts précédents. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Socourani et dans les villages environnants.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 10.000  kilogrammes de riz, 1000  kilogrammes de maïs.
 Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  150.000 FCFA qui  sera investi dans l’achat de petits animaux.
texts.en:
Mrs. Siatta Koné is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives in a traditional family with her twelve children, her co-spouses, and their husband in the village of Socourani in the sub-prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.

To increase her capital she decided to seek an individual loan from Soro Yiriwaso to stock and sell cereals. She is on her third loan cycle, having fully repaid the two preceding loans.

She gets her supplies in Socourani and surrounding villages. With this loan, she plans to buy 10,000 kilograms of rice and 1000 kilograms of corn.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA, which will be used to purchase small animals.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras”  ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con 05 hijos. La señora realizó estudios de educación secundaria completa.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de comidas y bicicletas de segunda mano.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de insumos para su negocio venta de comidas y también en la venta de bicicletas de segunda mano.
	
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una casa y mejorar el negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las charlas y capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Flavia is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Mensajeras” (The Messengers), which is located in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. She is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children. Flavia completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which helped increase her business capital for selling food and secondhand bicycles.

Now she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of supplies for her food business as well as merchandise for her other business of selling secondhand bicycles.

Flavia dreams of having a house and improving her business in the future. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the discussions and the training seminars.

loans.use: Operating capital for her food business & her other business of selling secondhand bikes

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda P. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Bongalonan, Basay, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  selling knitted nipa palm leaves and a tailoring businesses. Her husband Jose, who is 52 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's businesses. They have eight children who are between 11 and 30 years old. Raymunda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Raymunda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,400, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to buy raw materials for the knitting of nipa leaves so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children. Raymunda P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for knitting of palm leaves.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila A. is from the village of Inasagan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 62 years old. Teofila is married. To make a living, Teofila owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as sardines, pancit,sugar, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Teofila is just starting this business.

In 2008, Teofila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofila has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC.  Teofila is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Teofila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional daily use products to sell

loans.name: Roberto Isaias

texts.es: Roberto es agricultor, su esposa atiende la parte comercial, sus hijos lo mayores le apoya en el trabajo agrícola. El cliente considera hacer mejoras en su vivienda poco a poco como planes. Desde hace 22 años se dedica a la agricultura. El principal problema es la afectación de plaga y enfermedades, así como el robo de la producción. Inicio con apoyo de la reforma agraria por medio de la organización cooperativa. Como proyecto para el negocio es  hacer trabajos de conservación de suelo. Este préstamo será invertido en compra de fertilizantes para brindarle el mantenimiento agronómico al cultivo de café. Agradeciendo a la institución ya que le permitirá obtener una cosecha productiva.
texts.en: Roberto is a farmer, his wife handles the business side, and his oldest children help in agriculture. The customer wants to make improvements in his home little by little. He has been a farmer for over 22 years, the biggest problem that he faces are plagues and disease to his crops as well as the theft of production. Roberto began with the help of agrarian reform through a cooperative organization, and as a project for the business they have a conservation project for the soil. This loan will be used to buy fertilizers to give his coffee crops the best care. Roberto is grateful to the institution since it will allow him to have a productive harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to take care of his crops.

loans.name: Iriskul

texts.en:
The agriculture business is one that requires much effort. It requires exposure to the sun, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. For the past 15 years, Iriskul has dedicated himself to breeding cattle, a business which supports his humble family. Currently, Iriskul has turned to IMON International for a loan of 10,000 TJS to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him but also his children and wife whom he loves greatly.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, es un hombre soltero y trabajador de 31 años, que vive en compañía de sus padres Lucia y Alejo, a los que ama mucho. En armonía familiar ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Siendo joven, él tiene muchas ambiciones; estudió Farmacia en un instituto reconocido de la localidad; pero sus deseos son consolidarse en un negocio propio, por ello hace 4 años comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura. Desde entonces trabaja en los terrenos de sus padres, donde siembra una variedad de productos como: arveja, papa y flor de gladiolo a gran escala. Asimismo, posee una pequeña botica, que vende a los pobladores de su localidad cuando se sienten enfermos. En todo este tiempo le fue muy bien, tanto así, que logró obtener un auto propio con el que también hace trasporte público. Ahora desea aprovechar el buen precio que tiene sus productos agrícolas que quiere venderlos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma, asimismo mejorar la calidad de su cosecha. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizado, ya que el apoyo económico y las constantes charlas que recibe la ayudan a progresar. Wilfredo dentro de muy poco cosechará arveja y flor de gladiolo, para poder sembrar sin perdida de tiempo, así que invertirá el crédito otorgado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a hardworking young man who is single and 31 years of age. He lives with his parents, Lucia and Alejo, who he loves very much. They live in harmony in their own home in the village of Patay. Being young, Wilfredo has many ambitions. He studied pharmacology at a well-known local institute, but his hopes are all consolidated into his own business. Four years ago he began farming. Since that time, he has been working the land owned by his parents where he grows a variety of products: peas, potatoes, and gladiolas on a large scale. At the same time, he operates a small drugstore where he sells to the local villagers whenever they become ill. Throughout this period he has done very well and was able to obtain his own car which he uses for providing public transportation. Now he wants to take advantage of the good prices offered for agricultural products sold at the central market in the city of Tarma. He also wants to improve the quality of his harvest.

Wilfredo is a member of the Communal Bank “Picaflores de Patay” and receiving his fifth loan from MFP. He is satisfied with the financial support and frequent seminars conducted to help him make progress. Wilfredo will soon harvest his peas and gladiolas so that he can plant his next crop without delay. Therefore he will invest this loan in the purchase of a sack of seeds for planting peas.

loans.use: Purchase a sack of seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Phap

texts.en:
Phap S. is a sewing worker at a garment factory in Phnom Penh City. She has had experience in this sector for over one year, and has a formal salary every month. 

She has a life partner in her husband, who is a driver in the factory. The couple makes an average profit for their work of $8 US a day for use for the whole family. 

Presently, her husband is concerned because he wishes to buy a motorcycle (Tuk Tuk) for starting a motor taxi service besides his currently work for additional income. To motivate her husband, Phap S. has decided to request funds from Kiva. 

Phap S. has two young children who are enrolled in public school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle (Tuk Tuk) for starting a motor taxi service for her husband

loans.name: United Business Associate Group

texts.en:
Austine S., who is holding the sign in the photo, is the leader of this group of three borrowers called United Business Associate. He is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages of 5 and 15 years old. He is a high school graduate.

For 2 years, he has been involved with soap making and selling in New Georgia outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his portion of this 45,000 LRD loan to buy more gallons of red oil and caustic product used in the soap production process. He describes himself as a devoted man whose goals are to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil and caustic product to produce more soap for sale

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven members who will use their portions to support different purposes. Mr. Ly was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. 

Mr. Ly was born in 1967. He and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow different vegetables to earn a living. They don’t have enough money so Mr. Ly would like to ask for a loan to grow more crops. Aside from farming, they also sell sugar cane juice in the local village. With this business, they are able to earn a small amount of income to help support their family. The couple has three children who attend the local school.

loans.use: To grow more crops on their land

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.en:
Altagracia is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She is selling clothes. She runs a clothing business in her house. She is a mother of two and she lives together with her children and her long-term partner, who is also her children's father. Altagracia tells us that the most difficult challenge is to build an extra room onto her house; she needs it because the main structure is small for her family and her business.

Altagracia is very excited to be receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has had her business for around three years. She is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza because in this moment, her business needs to have more capital, and with this loan she will buy jeans, shirts, blouses, etc, to increase her business inventory. She plans to use her business profits to buy materials to start building the extra room her house needs. Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, blouses, etc, to increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Tamba Group

texts.en:
Magret Y. is in her early twenties and is single. She has a food vendor business which she opens from 6:00 am to 1:00 pm daily (seven hours only) and is able to make a reA. small monthly profit.

This will be Magret's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy rice, wheat four, and cooking oil.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants another loan to further increase her food inventory.  Her dream is to one day be able to take care of her parents.

Magret will share this loan with her loan group "Tamba" which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Magret is in front to the far right wearing a pink and white dress.

loans.use: to increase the food stall's inventory

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members. Mrs. Hun, who was born in 1949, is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. 

Mrs. Hun is a farmer who rents a plot of land that she uses to grow peanuts for a living. She doesn't have enough money to grow her farming business, so she is asking for a loan to cultivate peanuts. Aside from being a farmer, she also sells Khmer noodles for a small income to improve her family's living. 

Mrs. Hun is a widow with three children: two are seamstresses in the garment factories and one is a student.

loans.use: to cultivate peanuts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz y Progreso.

La señora Rosa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque siempre se ha llevado muy bien con todas sus compañeras del banco. Tiene 59 años de edad, es madre sotera y de una  relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene tres  hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero aún viven con ella, una de sus hijos estudia en Universidad.

Ella trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud Pública, pero además de esto es comerciante, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de sabanas y edredones, nos cuenta que ella por las noches se va a visitar a sus clientes para venderles sus productos, ella les deja a crédito y cobra en dos partes, los cobros los realiza los fines de semana. Nos cuenta que cuando ya no tiene mercadería se va a Guayaquil para comprar lo que necesita. Se dedicada a esta labor cerca de 6 años y empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar sabanas y edredones.
 
Su meta es comprar un carro para ir a vender sus productos con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The village bank Luz y Progreso meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the captial of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the authentic tamarinds.

Rosa is a founding member of the village bank and she likes it because she has always gotten along well with her colleagues at the bank. She is 59 years old and a single mother to three children from a relationship she had some years ago. The children are now grown but still live with her. One studies at the university.

She works for the Ministry of Public Health, but is also a merchant. In her free time she sells sheets and comforters. She tells us that at night she goes to visit customers to sell them her products. She leaves them on credit and collects payments in two parts. She collects money on the weekends. She tells us that when she runs out of merchandise she goes to Guayaquil to buy what she needs. She has been doing this for around 6 years and began with one of the loans that she got from the bank.

This loan will be used to buy sheets and comforters. 

Her goal is to buy a car so that she can go out to sell her products in greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 53 years old. Vilma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Melanie has a piggery and sells the grown pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy feed for the pigs. Melanie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Melanie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La Señora Veronica tiene 25 años. Esta casada con Aldo Javier de 31 años. Tienen dos hijos menores de edad. 
Ellos son propietarios de un taller de confecciones donde emplean a tres personas y realizan la confección de prendas para negocios que ya les traen sus telas cortadas y modelos a confeccionar.
Su negocio esta ubicado en el Barrio Laurelty, San Lorenzo.
Ella necesita del crédito para la compra de fardos de telas y otros accesorios para iniciar una confección autosuficiente de prendas. Pues pudo adquirir una nueva maquina, por lo que desea incursionar en el mundo de la confección con su propia marca.
Para el futuro desea poder ser dueña de una gran industria en la que confeccione prendas de diseño propio y pueda ganar espacio en el mercado con sus propios productos.
texts.en:
Veronica, 25, is married to Aldo Javier, 31, and they have two young children. They own a garment workshop where they employ 3 workers and make clothing for businesses that bring them pre-cut fabric and models to put together. 

Their business is located in the Laurelty neighborhood in San Lorenzo. 

She needs the loan to buy bulk packages of fabric and other accessories to make individual garments. She was able to get a new machine and so she wants to break into the world of garment-making with her own brand. 

In the future she wants to be the boss of a great industry where they make clothing of her own design and to gain a spot in the market with her own products.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk and other inputs for making clothing.

loans.name: El Hadji Ali Ndiaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune agée de 31 ans. Il est marié et pére d'un enfant. Il vit avec ses  deux soeurs, son frére,sa mére et son pére. Il prend en charge les dépenses de location de la maison , l'alimentation de la famille, les frais de santé de sa mére ainsi que le paiement des factures d'eau et d'électricité.Il pratique l'activité d'aviculture depuis 2 ans.Il a demarré l'élevage de poulets de chair avec des économies faite sur son activité de menuisier ébeniste qui est sa véritable profession et dont il dispose d'un atelier dans sa localité.Il pratique aussi l'élevage de moutons entre deux opérations d'élevage de poulets.L'aviculture et l'élevage de moutons lui rapportent toutefois des revenus supplémentaires pour faire face aux besoins de la famille et à ses propres besoins.Il est sociétairte de l'IMCEC depuis 2008 et a obetenu quatres préts remboursés intégralement sans retards. Il sollicite pour son activité avicole un pret de   150 000f pour l'achat de 2 caisses de poussins de chair, de 4 sacs de 50kg d'aliment de poussins et des produits vétérinaires. La vente des poussins àprés deux mois d'élevage devrait lui rapporter des bénéfices substantiels qui l'aideront à faire face à ses dépenses de location, d'alimentation, de santé, d'eau et d'électricité.Il ambitionne plus tard de construire un grand poulailler sur un terrain qu'il a acquis reccement mais aussi et surtout de construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en: The borrower is a 31-year old man. He is married and the father of one child. He lives with his two sisters, brother, mother and father. He takes care of the house rent, food for the family, his mother’s healthcare expenses as well as water and electricity bills. HE has been raising poultry for two years. He started raising broiler chickens with the savings he was able to put together thanks to his work as a cabinet maker, which is his proper trade. He has a workshop in the village. He also raises sheep between two cycles of breeding chickens. Raising poultry and ship bring him necessary additional income to support this family and himself. He has been a member of IMCEC since 2008 and obtained four loans in the past, all fully reimbursed without delays. He is seeking a loan of 150,000 for his poultry business, in order to buy two cases of chicks, two 50-kg bags of chicken feed, and veterinary products. After selling chickens two months later, he should receive substantial income helping him to meet the costs of rent, food, healthcare, water and electricity. His future goal is to have a big chicken coop built on the land plot which he had recently bought, but also, and above all, to have a house built for is family.

loans.use: to buy two cases of chicks, 4  bags of chicken feed, and veterinary products

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de piscigranja que es un lugar donde cría pescados y truchas y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados, a restaurants y también al público en general, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de piscigranja. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los peces y truchas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "Mama Simona". It is located in the district of Cusco, of the department and province of Cusco. 

Her name is Fortunata. She is 44 years old, married, and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her fish farm business. A fish farm is a place where fish and trout are grown and later sold to the different markets, restaurants, and to the general public. She wants to expand her fish farm business. she requests a loan to purchase feed for fish and trout.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fish and trout.

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala is married and her husband operates a grocery store in the market. He has recently started this business three months ago and needs a loan to put stock in his store such as spices, sugar, rice and cooking oil. Therefore, Ghazala has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for this purpose. 

She operates a plastic bottle making business. She receives orders from different factories and fulfills their orders on time to earn profits. She is very supportive and started her business in order to share the financial burden with her husband. She is the mother of four children. Only her eldest son is able to attend school. The others remain at home. 

She is hopeful that with the extensive grocery stock, her husband will be able to increase his clientele base and his income as well. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Ghazala.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 60-year-old married woman who has 5 adult children. She lives in Bangko, Panaon, Mis. Occ., Philippines. She has spent 20 years of her life buying and selling coconuts from her home and also in neighboring places. Approximately, she makes a monthly income of PHP 3,000. 
In 2010, Rosie became an official GDMPC member. In her 4th loan cycle with the cooperative, she has requested PHP 10,000. She will use the money to buy more coconuts to sell. The more stock she has, the higher her returns. Rosie hopes to increase the selling price for coconuts in the future and to further expand the business to increase the family income.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 73 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos, todos independientes.  Aurelia no cuenta con educación.
Desde hace tres años  trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo  fue por la suma de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales caseros como ovinos y vacunos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 400.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres ovejas  para su respectivo engorde por tres meses.  Nos cuenta que trabaja junto con su esposo, también cuenta que se dedica a la chacra, a la producción de papa, avena, habas, etc.
Su sueño es seguir y mejorar con los ganados así podrá obtener más ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca (The United Starlets of Titicaca)", located in the Pilcuyo District, El Collao Province, Puno Department.  Aurelia is 73 years old and married with 6 children, all of whom are independent. Aurelia does not have an education.

For three years Aurelia has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 nuevo soles.  She invested the money in her business of buying and selling animals such as sheep and cattle.

With this new loan of 400 nuevo soles, Aurelia will buy three sheep which she will fatten over three months.  She tells us that she works with her husband, and that she also works on the farm producing potatoes, oats, beans, etc.

Aurelia's dream is to continue and improve the livestock so that she can make more profit.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of getting loans.

loans.use: to buy three sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy craft materials

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Nget, 57 years old, is a cake seller.  She earns $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns $3 per day. They have five children, two of whom are studying and three of whom are working.  Each of these earns $5 per day. Every month, Nget has to spend $85 on food, $80 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a hand tractor for doing farming. She farms in the rainy season because at that time can get a good output. In the future, she wants to plant yams on the land when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for doing farming

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a divorced woman with three children who are all grown up. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and medical expenses. 

She has operated a water selling business (borehole) for the past two years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where during the rainy season there is low demand because people trap rain water for use. She dreams of owning a well-built borehole in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase blocks for construction of her borehole. She decided to join Yehu to uplift her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase blocks for construction of her borehole.

loans.name: Duo Renacer Group

texts.es:
DUO RENACER 2
Este grupo esta formado por doña Maria Clara D. 43 años D. edad casada,siendo ella la lider D. este duo ella tiene 6 hijos y se dedica a la venta D. blusas elásticas D. forma ambulante y también en su casa, desD. hace 6 años, ella solicita el crédito para poder Comprar mas Mercaderia en ropa e invertir ya que viene la época D. octubre, y las graduaciones se acercan y a ella le piden blusas, también esta doña Gloria Esperanza, D. 34 años D. edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo, y se dedica al bordado D. cortes y blusas, además hace delantales y los venD., tiene su negocio desD. hace 19 años, ella dice que necesita el crédito para poder comprar material, hilo, y tela ya que si le dan la tela, ella solo cobra la mano D. obra pero si ella pone todo el producto, pueD. tener mas ganancias, las dos señoras confían en que fape pueda brindarles el apoyo que están necesitando esperan no defraudar a la institución cumpliendo con todos los pagos además dicen que confían en Dios que las bendice siempre y las va ayudar a salir adelante.
texts.en: The "DUO RENACER 2" communal bank is comprised of doña Maria Clara, 43, who is married and has six children.  She is the leader of the group and sells elastic blouses as a street vendor and on a door-to-door basis.  She has been in business for six years and is requesting a loan to buy more clothing for the October season, when graduations begin and orders for blouses are placed.  Doña gloria Esperanza, 34, is married and has a son and is in the business of embroidering fabric and blouses.  She also makes and sells aprons.  She has been in business for 19 years.  She needs a loan to buy fabric and thread.  If the customers give her the fabric she only charges for labor but if she furnishes all the materials she makes a better profit.  The two women are confident that FAPE can help them.  They are committed to paying back the loan on time and hope God will bless them so they can get ahead.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rohani

texts.en:
Rohani is 31 years old and married with two children. They are eight and three years old. The older one, Krisna, is going to school. From Rohani's house, she sells things such as clothes, sandals and Tupperware on credit.  She has been doing this for seven years and her business is going well. By doing this business, she can help her husband to pay for her child's school fees. Now, she gets more orders for Tupperware. With this loan, she will buy more Tupperware to sell on credit. She enjoys promoting her business in her neighborhood.

Her future plan is to begin selling electronic goods on credit. The main problem with this is having enough starting capital. Over time, with her savings and another loan, maybe she can achieve this. Her hopes for her family are that they'll continue to have enough savings to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: to buy more tupperware to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La señora Elsa tiene un pequeño taller de imprenta. El crédito lo requiere para la compra herramientas de trabajo como ser: una maquina dobladora y caladora. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en casa propia la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Villa El Carmen de la ciudad de La Paz, es viuda  y  tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que Elsa obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también en Kiva.
texts.en: Elsa has a small printing shop.  She needs the loan to buy work tools like a folding machine and a collator.  This is the source of income she has to cover her expenses.   She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Villa El Carmen zone; she’s a widow and has a son.  This is Elsa’s first IMPRO and Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a collator and a folding machine for her printer.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 57-year-old married woman with 4 children. Her husband works as a Barangay official.

Carmelita runs a retail shop located near her town's market. She sells clothing items like dresses for kids, jeans and shirts. Each month, Carmelita earns 10,000 PHP with her business.

Carmelita has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as shirts, jeans and slippers. Carmelita is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shirts, jeans and slippers

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 and a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Cesar, a driver. Marilyn is the mother of three children.  Together with her husband and children, she manages the household while also operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  
                          
Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: Azucena, originaria de Granada, de oficio comerciante. Comparte su experiencia vivida atravez del prestamo Kiva pues logro mejorar sus ingresos, lo invirto en compra de mercaderia tales como ropa de niños,adulto y ropa interior que necesitaba vender esta muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado. Ahora esta solicitando un segundo credito para comprar ropa para vender durante esta epoca navideña donde la afluencia de clientes es mayor y las ventas se incrementan y quiere aprovechar la temporada. Su objetivo es siempre seguir en su negocio y mantenerlo prospero y estable.
texts.en:
Azuenca, originally from Granada, is a merchant. She shares that her experience with her last Kiva loan allowed her to increase her earnings and invest in merchandise such as children's and adult clothing and underwear for sale. She is very appreciative for the support that loan has afforded her. 

She is now requesting a second loan to buy clothing to sell during this Christmas season when her customers have more to spend and sales are higher, so as to make the most of the season. Her objective is, as always, to continue her business, keeping it prosperous and stable.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Jennifer Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar vive la señora Jennifer, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, todavía no tienen hijos. El marido trabaja en un depósito de gas.  Esta en el Banco Comunal desde que se inicio el grupo, es la tesorera del Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en la institución. 

Ella para ayudarse y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cría de animales, para lo cual y con la ayuda de los créditos ha construido un pequeño galpón donde mete hasta 200 pollos cada tres meses, en la actualidad tiene esta cantidad de pollos que los piensa vender en la época de Navidad Y Año Nuevo.  Cuando están listos los lleva a entregar a los comerciantes del mercado de Calceta, lleva con esta actividad por más de 6 meses y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar alimentos para los pollos que tiene en su granja. 

Sus sueños son tener un carro y una familia bien formada.
texts.en:
The Friendship Community Bank meets every other week in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city known by the name of "Calceta without equal" for the beauty of its women and because, for the citizens, there is no city more beautiful in all the world.

Mrs. Jennifer lives in this place. She is 21 years old and lives with her common-law husband. They do not yet have children. Her husband works at a gas station. She has been in the community bank since it began, and she is the treasurer, and she likes it for the help the institution has provided to her.

To help herself, and also her husband with the expenses of the home, she works raising animals. With the help of loans, she has built a small shed where she raises up to 200 chickens every three months. She currently has that amount of chickens and she plans to sell them around Christmas and New Year's. When the chickens are ready, she will deliver them to the market to be sold by the merchants of Calceta. She has done this work for more than 6 months and it is going fairly well for her. This loan is to buy food for the chickens she has on her farm. Her goals are to have a car and a nice family.

loans.use: buy chicken food

loans.name: Viateur

texts.fr:
Viateur fait le commerce des poules. Il a 42 ans, marié et ayant 3 enfants. L’enfant  le mois âgé a 3 ans et le plus âgé a 11 ans. Il a une personne en charge. Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école. Viateur a 8 ans de primaire.
C’est le premier cycle de crédit que Viateur fait avec ACB Ltd. Il va utiliser le crédit pour acheter en grande quantité des poules.
Viateur veut être le fournisseur des poules dans toute la région. Pour y arriver, il a une stratégie d’augmenter son capital pour acheter les poules en grande quantité.
Avec le profit, Viateur se propose d’éduquer ses enfants et les faire soigner.
texts.en:
Viateur sells hens. He is 42 years old, married and has three children. The youngest child is 3 and the oldest 11 years old. He has one dependent. Two of his children go to school. Viateur completed eight years of primary school.

This is the first loan cycle that Viateur is requesting from ACB Ltd. He is going to use the loan to buy a large quantity of hens.

Viateur wants to supply hens to his entire region. To make it happen, he has a strategy to increase his capital to buy a large quantity of hens.

With the profit, Viateur is going to educate his children and take care of their health.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of hens.

loans.name: Flor De Azucena Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE AZUCENA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Zulema es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de licores, venta de calzados, venta de pollos, a la brosther, venta de fruta, venta de pantalones.

La señora Zulema,  indica que es la primera vez trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de venta de pollos a ala brosther que viene trabajando hace años y aprendiendo el mismo de sus anteriores trabajos.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de pollos) que adquiere de la Ceja  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la forografía no aparese la señora Raquel, por razones culturales.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Azucena” (Easter Lilly) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada focal center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Zulema, the President.  The members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: food sales, liquor sales, shoe sales, Broaster-style chicken sales, fruit sales and pants sales.

Zulema indicates that this is the first time she’s worked in Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution through an invitation from a friend.  She currently sells Broaster-style chickens, a business she’s had for several years having learned it from previous jobs.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her working capital.  She’ll buy chickens in La Ceja and once ready will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family since she’s single.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.  

Raquel, for cultural reasons, does not appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Isseu's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Association femme sengaz n°10" est composé de cinq femmes qui vendent toutes des produits cosmétiques.Elles achètent en gros dans la capitale ou dans les pays limitrophes pour amoindrir les charges.Elles vendent séparément leurs marchandises et parviennent à générer des revenus.Elles prennent ainsi en charge une bonne partie des dépenses d'alimentation de leurs familles ainsi que leurs propres besoins.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter des produits de cosmétiques.
texts.en: The "Femme Sengaz no. 10" association is made up of five women who all sell cosmetic products. They buy their goods wholesale in the capital or in neighboring countries to reduce their expenses. They sell their goods separately and manage to generate income. They are thus able to take care of a large part of their families' food expenses as well as providing for their own needs. In order to strengthen their businesses, they are requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy cosmetic products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Holiday Inn Group

texts.en:
Jumanne, who is in his early 40's, is a widower with one child who is in school.   He has been running two businesses--fishing and also selling charcoal. He has been in his business for ten years now.  He works from 11 a.m to 2 p.m. daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more trees for making more charcoal and bought fishing net, and he has paid back all his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to increase his charcoal selling and to sell more fish.  His dream is to one day be able to become an international businessman.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Holiday Inn," which has a total of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on charcoal selling and to sell more fish.

loans.name: Nyamosense B Group

texts.en:
This group is a Nuru International group of five farmers called Nyamosense B. They came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Stephen, who is raising up his hand, is 32 years old. He is married with five children. He solely depends on farming to earn a living and is therefore keen on practicing better farming methods. During the 2014 long rains, Stephen will plant a one acre farm with maize on ½ acre and sorghum and millet on ¼ acre each. He is requesting a loan to enable him to purchase farm inputs. With the farm inputs, he is hopeful that the harvest will be good and he will ensure food security for his large family.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Jesukpego3 Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO3 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Reine Marie Cyrille (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 46 ans. Reine Marie Cyrille ne vit plus avec son mari. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge.  Reine Marie Cyrille vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Reine Marie Cyrille produit du savon qu'elle revend à son domicile et de façon ambulante depuis seize ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Reine Marie Cyrille s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu,  Reine Marie Cyrille sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUKPEGO3, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des ingrédients pour la production du savon.

loans.name: Victor  Hugo

texts.en:
My name is Victor Hugo, and my wife and I have had a business in clothing sales for the past 3 years. This allows us to cover various expenses One day, I'd like to have my businesson the sidewalk of one of the parks in my city.

Mi Nombre es Victor Hugo, tengo un negocio de venta de ropa usada en el centro de mi ciudad es que es administrado junto con mi esposa, cuento con 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que nos genera ingreso para cubrir los diferentes gastos familiares y demas compromisos, mi mayor anhelo es tener un local ya que donde tengo el negocio es en la acera de uno de los parque de mi ciudad.

loans.use: Compra de ropa usada clasificada

loans.name: Khanum Gul

texts.en:
Khanum Gul is 44 years old and lives in a household of 15 in district 5 Kabul Afghanistan

Khanum Gul lost her husband during the war. She is living with her sons who are selling mobile cards in the bazaar. Her first two sons have a mobile shop in the market and the 3rd one, whom Khanum Gul took out the loan for, sells in the street. 

With the help of neighbours, Khanum Gul took a 1st cycle loan for her son. She hopes to repay her installments of her 1st cycle loan so she can take more loans and cover the family financially.

loans.use: To buy mobile cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent a permanent store and buy more stocks for her herbal medicine business

loans.name: Keit

texts.en: Mr. Keit S. is 20 years old and works as a farmer in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia.  He tends to a large plot of land, and has had considerable success with his harvest so far--earning about $3/day on average.  He will use this loan to purchase a tractor for harvesting his crops.

loans.use: To purchase a tractor for harvesting his crops

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Huệ is considered by the people in the village Nghi Hoa as an examplary businesswoman. She is 50 years old. She owns an acre of rice field, a fish farm and a paddling of 60 ducks. Her husband is a construction worker, her 3 children still go to school so she has to take care of all her business alone. Everyday she wakes up at 5 am and she rarely goes to bed before 11 pm. She works in her rice field all morning then in the afternoon she has to tender the ducks and work on the fish farm. On average, she makes about 3-4 USD from selling the duck eggs. Combining this revenue and all her savings, Mrs Huệ requests a loan of 325 USD to buy a buffalo which will be a big help to her for the manual labor in the rice field

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ luôn được mọi người trong xã nhắc đến như một hình mẫu về phụ nữ làm kinh tế giỏi tại xã Nghi Hoa, tỉnh Nghệ An. Năm nay 50 tuổi, quy mô sản xuất của chị bao gồm hơn một mẫu ruộng, một ao cá cùng hơn 60 con vịt đẻ. Chồng đi làm thợ xây, 3 con còn đi học, một mình chị phải nỗ lực làm việc để có thể duy trì được mô hình VAC của mình. Hàng ngày chị thường dậy từ 5 giờ sáng và ít khi đi ngủ trước 11 giờ. Sau thời gian làm việc buổi sáng ở ngoài đồng, chị dành phần lớn buổi chiều cho việc chăm lo cho đàn vịt và ao cá. Trung bình mỗi ngày chị thu nhập khoảng 3-4 USD từ lượng trứng vịt bán ra. Cộng với số vốn tự có chị đang làm hồ sơ xin vay thêm 325 USD để mua một con bò cày nhằm tăng thêm hiệu quả kinh tế trong lao động.

loans.use: buy a bull for filed work

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
Rustam S., 25, is married and has no children. Rustam owns a trading spot where he sells SIM cards and ring tones, makes copies and computer scans, etc. Rustam has been in business for more than a year. To expand the portfolio of his services, Rustam wants to add another computer to his business. He will use this loan to purchase the computer and buy SIM cards for the rest of the money. Rustam plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипов Рустам, возраст – 25 лет, образование среднее техническое, женат, детей не имеет. Рустам имеет торговую точку по продаже сим-карт, а также клиент оказывает услуги по записи мелодий для мобильных телефонов и услуги ксерокопии, сканирования и т.д. Этим бизнесом занимается уже в течение 1 года. На сеголняшний день клиент имеет один компьютер, который не позволяет ему обслуживать большое количество клиентов, поэтому клиент на полученную сумму кредита хочет приобрести дополнительно ещё один компьютер, который он будет использовать для записи мелодий на мобильные телефоны, а второй компьютер будет использовать для пополения баланса мобильных телефонов и других компьютерных услуг, на оставшуюся сумму кредита приобретёт сим-карты для мобильных телефонов. Владельцы сотовых телефонов получат возможность производить пополнение баланса своих мобильных телефонов, а желающие смогут приобрести для себя сим-карты. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase computer and SIM cards

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum S., age 45, sells fish at a market, earning around $12.5 per day. She lives with her ailing husband in Kompong Chhnang province. They have three children, two who help her with her business and one who is a student. She requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a small van for carrying fish. This will increase the quantity of fish she can sell and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a van to transport fish.

loans.name: Blanca Mariela

texts.es:
Blanca B. suffered for many years at the side of a man who beat her. Fortunately she found the courage to leave him and now is responsible for her two children, 3 years old and 3 months old. She would like to raise them and give them an education so that the same thing doesn't happen to them as happened to her. Determined to get ahead, Blanca began to sell shoes and women's clothing to her friends and acquaintances. She currently has clients who seek her out and ask for products.

However, Blanca does not have an adequate space with display cases to show her clients her products, and for this reason she is requesting a loan, which she is going to repay in 6 months. With this money Blanca will buy a mannequin and some display cases, as well as products so that she can offer greater variety and a better image to her clients. With your help, Blanca will be able to raise her children and make sure that they don't want for anything.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca B. sufrió muchos años de su vida alado de un hombre que sólo la golea, afortunadamente se armó de valor para separarse y así quedarse a cargo de sus dos hijos de 3 años y 3 meses a quienes desea sacar adelante mediante los estudios para que a ellos no les pase lo mismo que a Blanca. Con el firme propósito de salir adelante Blanca comenzó a vender zapatos y ropa para dama, entre sus amistades y amigos. Actualmente ya cuenta con más clientela que la busca para pedirle productos.

Sin embargo Blanca no cuenta con un espacio adecuado con vitrinas para poder mostrarle a sus clientes los productos, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Blanca podrá comprar un maniquí y unas vitrinas, además de productos para poder ofrecerle mayor variedad y con más presencia a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Blanca podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante y procurar que no les falte nada.

loans.use: Purchase display cases and a mannequin.

loans.name: Masanda C(I) Group

texts.en: Margret is a 40 year old widow with four children. She has a charcoal selling business. With the extra business profits, she intends to construct a residential house. Rehema offers tailoring services and wants to use the loan to buy a sewing machine. Mary sells firewood and wants to use the loan to expand business. Florence sells fish while Juliet owns a beauty salon.

loans.use: To add in charcoal business

loans.name: Kireka B7 B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hamidah N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Hamidah is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a builder. She has 7 children ranging from age 10 to 29 and her children go to school. Each week, Hamidah makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for her children's school fees. Hamidah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hamidah is joined in her small group by Rebecca N., Jane N., Justine N., and Kawala J.. Rebecca N. has a business in charcoal sales and wants to increase stock and construct a charcoal shade/store. Jane N. is currently operating a business in poultry farming and wants a loan to buy chicken feed. Justine N. operates a restaurant business and wants to invest and improve her business. Kawala J. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to add to the business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell and also put up a boutique

loans.name: Anastazia's Salasala D Group

texts.en:
Anastazia, age 28, is single and makes a living selling clothing door-to-door. She started this business in 2005 and now makes a monthly profit of about $30. She works from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. daily.

In the past, Anastazia took outy a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and used it to buy more clothes to sell. Having paid this loan back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for $1,575 that she will use for the same purpose. She will also share this loan with the members of her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in food, timber, chicken, snacks and store sales.

In the picture, Anastazia is in the front row on the right.

loans.use: To buy clothing that can be sold door-to-door and help fund several other small businesses.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao K. and his wife live in Thnal Village, in the Siem Reap province. K. makes about $5 a day from making furniture. He and his wife live with their three children, who all attend school. Mao would like to apply for a loan of $800 to increase the volume of his furniture production, in order to support his children’s education and further expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make furniture

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long S. is 45 years of age. She sells traditional Khmer noodles from her roadside shop in Siem Reap province. She does fairly well, earning $5 USD per day of profit.

Her husband, Sek Saren, is a construction worker. Construction work is readily available in a developing province like Siem Reap, which draws over a million tourists each year. He earns $7 USD per day. They have a somewhat large family with five children. Two of the older kids are already employed, one as a teacher, and another as a construction worker alongside his father.

Long S. wants to take out a loan to buy rice in bulk, which she will then resell. Rice prices are currently high and she thinks this will be a reliable source of extra money.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga has operated a cosmetics sales business for five years. She has a son and raises him by herself. The business provides the sole source of income for her family. Olga has received and successfully repaid all her loans from Nadiya Ukraine. She earns approximately $500 each month. 

In addition to her marketing skills, Olga is efficient and focused and is able to provide affordable and high quality merchandise. She is friendly and gracious, always seeking opportunities to meet the needs of her clients. Olga is requesting a loan of 5000 grivnas to purchase additional inventory including facial creams, body lotions, cleansers and shower gels for further retail sale. With the increased profits, Olga plans to rent more vending facilities and expand her business.

loans.use: to Increase her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase 8 sets of rings, 8 piston units, 10 thrust units, 10 O'rings, 10 retainers for oil, 2 propeller units, 10 boxes of gear lubricant, and 10 units of spark plugs NGKB8HSUS for outboard motors.

loans.name: I Made Indra

texts.id: Indra B. (37) memiliki usaha sebagai petani agrobisnis yang bergerak dibidang pertanian padi dan palawija. Lahan yang dimiliki ditanam bergantian dengan tanaman lain seperti padi dan kedelai, tetapi yang dominan adalah padi. Usaha ini sudah dijalaninya beberapa tahun, dan untuk kali ii dia memerlukan dana untuk dipakai sebagai modal member sarana pendukung pertanian seperti traktor dan pupuk. Dia sangat berharap dari modal yang didapat dari KIVA kali ini bisa meningkatkan hasil dari panen padi nantinya.
