Selain itu, pendampingan dan penyuluhan bagi para petani di sekitarnya sering dilakukan, dengan tujuan agar mereka juga bisa mendapat hasil maksimal dari usaha pertanian mereka. Saat ini Indra B. tinggal di Buana Kubu - Denpasar dengan istri dan dua anaknya. Dengan menempati rumah sendiri, mereka tidak harus membayar sewa seperti kebanyakan orang dilingkungannya.
texts.en:
Indra B. (37) is in the business of agriculture. He grows paddy and soy bean. He needs fund to buy farming equipments such as tractor and fertilizers.

He hopes the capital that he gets from KIVA can help him improving the output of his agriculture business.

In addition, training to local farmers are given regularly to enable them to get optimum result from their farms.

Indra together with his wife and 2 children live in Buana Kubu - Denpasar. They live in their own house.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy agriculture and farming equipments (Membali Sarana Pendukung Pertanian)

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala baji is the widow of N. A. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places. She has been living in this city for the last 25 years. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son has a donkey cart which he uses for loading. Her younger son is a daily wage laborer. Ghazala baji has a business of selling milk. She has a buffalo at her house and she gets milk from her and sells it in a milk shop. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another donkey cart for her son.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shukria baji wants a loan to buy tools to repair air coolers. Razia baji and Nazia baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, sketches and clothes) for her decorative embroidery business. Kiran baji wants a loan to buy plastic to make plastic frames. Razia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for loading

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita R. B. tiene 34 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal San Luis, al Vaso de leche y al Comedor Popular. Vive en el barrio Las Flores s/n del caserío de Motil, distrito de Agallpampa, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Curso primaria completa y no continuó estudiando debido a la  falta de apoyo de sus padres. Se casó a los 18 años con Aquelino Haro y tienen 4 hijos que aún son estudiantes.
Empezó su negocio comprando pescado y galletas en Trujillo, pero debido  a que el pescado se malogra rápidamente, adoptó por vender abarrotes en una pequeña bodega, sin embargo sigue comprando pescado, pero en menor cantidad. Su trabajo lo realiza en su casa.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles, el cual devolvió en 4 cuotas, compró abarrotes para su negocio. 
Con este crédito de 300 soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas,  comprará arroz por sacos.
Margarita sueña con tener una gran tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maragarita R. B. is 34 years old, belongs to the community bank of San Luis. She lives in the Flowers neighborhood in the Agallpampa district in the Otuzco province in Peru. She didn’t finished school because she didn’t have her parents’ support. She got married when she was 18 years old and has 4 children who are in school. She started her business buying fish and cookies in Trujillo, but because fish spoils quickly, she decided to sell grocery store supplies and keep on buying fish in smaller quantities. She works at home. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she returned in 4 payments, she bought supplies for her business. With the new credit of 300 soles, which will be paid in 4 quotes, she will buy rice at wholesale prices. Margarita dreams on having a big store.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun M., 35, is married and resides with her two young school-aged children and husband in Battambong in Cambodia. Since 2006, she has been selling roast beef and boiled duck eggs to earn a living and is able to make around US$5 each day. Every day she always prepares stuff and then walks her trailer from house to house to sell beef and duck eggs. Her husband is a construction worker building houses and makes US$3.50 per day. She said on average she spends around US$40 on food each month, US$10 on utilities and US$30 on children’s education.

Chhun M. would like to take out a loan of US$1200 from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work, and sometimes he can take this bike to operate a motor-taxi whenever he is free from construction.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella A. S. is a 39-year-old mother of two, who are currently in school. The elder one, a son, is now in his fourth year at the medical school of the University of Science and Technology Ghana. 

She is very supportive to her husband in taking care of her children in school. She has been operating a seamstress shop for the past five years. She is training one young lady in sewing to equip her with the skills and experience for a future career. She sews all forms of women's wear with various kinds of styles like kaba and slit (a variation of the European long skirt and tailored top), wedding dress, funeral clothes, etc. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc., in order to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase savings to support the kids in school. She is a member of the community group called “Boldness” Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. She does not sell on group meeting days and her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Kathya

texts.es: Kathya tiene 24 años, vive con su hijo y su conviviente quien la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta abarrotes y verduras en un puesto del mercado de su localidad, también envía a otra persona a vender sus productos por los distintos caseríos del río Ucayali, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años, le gusta porque conoce a muchas personas y siempre está pendiente de darles un trato amable para que regresen a comprarle. Hasta el momento este negocio le da dado buenas ganancias, suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, pero ella quiere mejorar y seguir creciendo por lo que no duda en seguir invirtiendo su tiempo y dinero en ello. Es la primera vez que pertenece a un banco comunal, y también es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido a ser muy responsable y puntual. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a ampliar su puesto, comprar mercadería, para que posteriormente con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo cumpla su sueño de tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Kathya is 24 years old. She lives with her son and her partner who supports her a lot. She is dedicated to selling groceries and produce from a stall in her local market. She also sends another person to sell her products in the different villages of the Ucayali river. She's had this business for four years. She enjoys it because she knows a lot of people and is always ready to provide friendly treatment so that they become return shoppers. Up until now, this business has generated good income, enough to pay the bills. However, she wants to improve and continue to grow for which she does not hesitate to continue to invest her time and money. This is the first time that she has belonged to a community bank. This is also her first loan with MFP. She has promised to be very responsible and punctual. With the money that she is requesting, she will expand her stall and purchase merchandise so that later, with a lot of work and effort, she can achieve her dream of having a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her stall and purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Los Reyes Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "LOS REYES"  REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEÑORA EMILENE ESTA COMPUESTO POR 12 INTEGRANTES LOS CUALES SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES DE COMERCIO DE DIFERENTES PRODUCTOS COMO COSMÉTICOS, ABARROTES, ROPA, ZAPATOS, COMIDA, Y OTROS SE DEDICAN A ACTIVIDADES COMO LA REPOSTERÍA, SERVICIO DE NIÑERAS Y AL TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO DE PASAJEROS. DENTRO DEL ÁMBITO COMERCIAL LA COMPETENCIA ES DE TODOS LOS DÍAS Y PARA PODER COMPETIR SE DEBE CONTAR CON PRODUCTOS DE CALIDAD Y A BAJO PRECIO ES ESTO LO QUE MANTIENEN EN PIE LOS PUESTOS DE VENTA. EL FINANCIAMIENTO ESTA DESTINADO AL INCREMENTO DE INSUMOS Y MATERIALES PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SUS PRODUCTOS Y PODER INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS Y MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SUS FAMILIAS. A PESAR DE QUE LOS SOCIOS (AS) CURSAN SU PRIMER CICLO EN LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL ELLOS (AS) CUENTAN CON EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS Y SABEN COMO ADMINISTRAR LOS FONDOS A OTORGAR, ASÍ COMO LA RESPONSABILIDAD Y PUNTUALIDAD QUE SE REQUIERE PARA CUMPLIR CON SUS OBLIGACIONES.
texts.en:
The "Los Reyes" group is represented by Ms. Emilene and comprised of twelve members who sell different products like cosmetics, groceries, clothing, shoes and food, and others who work at different activities like baking pastries, child care and public transportation. Within the commercial sphere they must compete daily and in order to compete they must be able to depend upon high-quality, low-cost products. This is what keeps their sales stands running. The loan will be used to increase supplies and materials to improve their products and be able to increase their earnings and better the quality of life of their families. Even though this is their first loan with FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL, they rely on a supportive group experience, knowledge of managing loaned funds, and also their responsibility and punctuality to fulfill their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Expenses

loans.name: Fedalia

texts.en: Fedelia sells cooked food and drinks. She has been in this business for 15 years. Fedelia opens her shop by 6:00 A.M. to prepare for workers going to work by 8 A.M., and she closes by midnight, from Monday to Sunday. Fedelia lives at Ilaje, is 40 years old, married and has 5 children. Fedelia is requesting a loan for $550 (80000 NGN) to purchase more drinks and food items to cook and sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Buy more drinks and food items to cook and sell

loans.name: Amankwaah

texts.en:
Amankwaah B. is forty-one years old. He is married and has three children, two sons and a daughter. Two of his children are already in school – junior high and primary school. The last however, has yet to start. His wife is a seamstress by profession.

Amankwaah lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Amankwaah owns a cocoa, palm nut, and orange plantation. He does not sell the harvested palm fruits in the raw state but adds value by producing palm oil. He also procures additional palm fruits from nearby farms to increase his production.

Amankwaah distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. He wants a loan to procure palm fruits in large quantities so that he can produce in bulk and distribute to the increasing number of his customers. He aspires to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget T. is 37 years old and married with three children.  She sells medicines to her retail customers.  Bridget is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell.  Bridget says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Caminantes Group

texts.es: Todas las mañanas muy temprano comienzan su día las señoras de la asociación caminantes, llevando su mercadería a distintas  ferias de la ciudad, ellas venden ropa, comida, joyas, muebles, pastelitos, dulces y otros. Esta asociación trabaja hace mas de dos años en el centro focal Juan Pablo II, que esta ubicada en la zona Ferropetrol de  la ciudad de El Alto. Necesitan capital para  compra mercadería para ampliar sus ventas, están seguras que generaran mayores ingresos, con lo que podrán responder  a sus créditos
texts.en:
The ladies of the collective "Caminantes" begin their days very early in the morning to take their merchandise to the various city markets. They sell clothing, food, jewelry, furniture, pastries, sweets and other items. This collective has worked at the Juan Pablo II center for the past two years, located in the Ferropetrol zone in the city of El Alto. They need capital to buy merchandise in order to expand their sales. They are certain they will gain greater profits with which to pay their loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
“Be patient and you will become successful,” said Erlinda B., who is married to Francisco B.. They live happily with their two children in Barangay Quirino of Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Through her patience and sacrifices, their two children have successfully graduated college. Erlinda is very proud of them because they were able to complete their studies.

Erlinda receives her daily income from the village store she manages. She sells many goods to her regular customers. She purchased most of her products from the Public Market of Solano. Her average net income monthly is PHP3,000.00 which she uses to satisfy the family's daily basic needs.

She is now applying for a loan of PHP12,000.00 to improve her store. She plans to buy additional products for her store. Through this financial assistance and her patience, she believes that someday she will become successful in her business and will be able to make a healthy profit.

loans.use: To improve her store

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame Y. is married and has one child. She did not receive a formal education. Maame sells soft drinks such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and assorted fruit juices in Elmina, which she has done since 2004. Maame uses all her income for paying utility bills. Maame will use the loan to buy more soft drinks to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: Maame will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Бердиев  Азимжон,  молодой  человек  1971  года  рождения.  Жена  Хасанова  Дилором  помогает  ему  поднимать  на  ноги  троих  детей.  Вот  уже  более  года  занимаются  торговлей  продуктами  питания  и  хозяйственными  товарами.  Это  помогает  им  прокормить  семью  в  условиях  финансового  кризиса.  Для  расширения  ассортимента  продаваемого  товара  они  обратились  в  нашу  организацию  за  финансовой  помощью.  В  этом  году  они  собираются  накопить  денег  и  открыть  дополнительную  торговую  точку.
texts.en:
Azimjon B. is a young man, born in 1971. His wife, Dilorom Hasanova, helps him raise their three children. For over a year, Azimjon and Dilorom have been involved in the sales of food products and household goods. This business helps them support their family during this financial crisis. They reached out to our organization for financial assistance in order to expand their product assortment. Azimjon and Dilorom plan to save enough money this year to open an additional retail outlet.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a stock of cleaning agents

loans.name: Jesus Joaquin

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Joaquín es soltero y vive con sus papas, donde contribuye con los ingresos para los gastos familiares. 
El es propietario de un taller eléctrico de nombre “Hermanos tres G. “donde realiza la reparación de televisiones, radios, esteros, bocinas, etc. 
Negocio que tiene establecido desde hace 5 años, fructífero con la dedicación que se le debe de dar a un negocio propio, ya que cuenta con su clientela establecida. 
Esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de mercancía y tener en bodega las partes y herramientas para sus reparaciones.
texts.en:
Jesús Joaquín is single and lives with his parents to whom he contributes money for the family's bills. He is the proprieter of an electronic shop named "Hermanos tres G." (The Three G. Brothers) where repairs of televisions, radios, stereos, speakers, etc. are conducted. His business was established five years ago, now fruitful from the dedication that one ought to give to his own business and with an established clientele. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise and to have parts and tools on hand for his repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the business.

loans.name: Bertilia

texts.es: Bertila tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes ya tienen sus propias familias. Desde hace 30 años se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa, la cual lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Gracias a la demanda de sus prendas, Bertila puede comprar mercadería variada según la temporada y las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que la mantiene activa y se siente una persona útil para la sociedad. Ella considera que su negocio es rentable porque obtiene ganancias diarias con las que puede solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Adicionalmente a las prendas de vestir, Bertilia también vende cubrecamas, sabanas y otros de este tipo, con los que incrementa sus ganancias. Y para un futuro cercano no descarta la posibilidad de tener una tienda de ropa, pero para ello hay que trabajar muy duro, menciona. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas buenas, se entienden entre sí y trabajan con mucha responsabilidad. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará cubrecamas, colchas y las prendas que le han pedido sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bertila is 53 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children, who already have their own families. She has been selling clothing for 30 years and brings the clothing to different places in her area to sell. She has the help of her husband.

Thanks to the demand for her pieces of clothing, Bertila can purchase a variety of merchandise according to the season and the needs of each one of her customers. What she likes about her job is that it keeps her active and she feels like a useful person for society. She considers her business to be profitable because she has daily earnings that she can put towards household needs. In addition to pieces of clothing, Bertila also sells bedspreads, sheets, and other similar items that she uses to increase her earnings.

For the near future, she hasn’t ruled out the possibility of having a clothing shop, but to have one requires hard work, she mentions. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she likes her community bank. Her fellow members are very good people, they understand one another, and they work very responsibly. With the loan she is asking for she will purchase bedspreads, blankets, and the pieces of clothing that her customers have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Sanavar

texts.ru: Санавар Усмонова 1982 года рождения , замужем имеет 2 сына. Торгует на рынке 4 года женским бельем. Бизнес начала еще девочкой, до замужества   торговала на рынке с матерью. Когда вышла замуж сидела почти 2 года дома. Муж был против ее торговли на рынке. Когда он уехал в Россию на заработки ее мать помогала с деньгами. Со временем  уговорила мужа что бы выйти и помогать в торговли матери. Он согласился и  теперь она сама ездит за товаром и привозит с Бишкека и Уратюбе  женскую одежду и белье.  Деньги получает на расширение бизнеса и  увеличение ассортимента.
texts.en:
Born in 1982, Sanavar U. is married and has 2 sons. She has been selling women's undergarments at a market for 4 years. She started her business when she was a girl, prior to the marriage, and sold at the market with her mother. When Sanavar got married, she stayed home for almost 2 years. Her husband was against her selling at the market. When he left to go work in Russia, Sanavar's mother helped with money. With time, Sanavar convinced her husband to let her go and help her mother with the sales. He agreed, and now Sanavar travels for the merchandise by herself and brings women's clothing and undergarments from Bishkek and Uratube. Sanavar is requesting a loan for expanding the business and merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business and merchandise selection expansion

loans.name: Suma Qhana Ura Group

texts.es:
Elsa M., vende carne y los días jueves y domingo alista su  mercadería para dirigirse a la feria “16 de julio” donde vende su producto hace dos años, otros días vende en la zona de “San Roque”, y para hacer crecer su negocio necesita del préstamo y comprar mercadería ya que con el capital que cuenta actualmente no le es suficiente. 
Las demás integrantes del grupo “Suma Qhana Ura”, también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de velas, chompas, escobas, ají y otras se dedican al lavado de autos. Todas se agruparon recientemente para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus ingresos, así también esperan estar mucho tiempo juntas y asistir a sus reuniones puntualmente en el Centro Focal “Panamericana”.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde es socia del Bancomunal un Nuevo Día, es casada, tiene 39 años y tres hijos de 21, 19 y 8 años, los mayores trabajan y estudian en un instituto y el último está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Matilde estudió contabilidad, consiguió un trabajo de conciliadora extrajudicial, trabaja en una casa de bienestar social en Pamplona (ubicado al sur de Lima) desde hace diez años, también se dedica  a las ventas de productos de belleza por catálogo.
Desde que ingreso a FINCA, ya no depende económicamente de su esposo, ahora tiene su propio capital y puede invertir, se siente más segura y muy contenta de pertenecer al Bancomunal.  
Matilde necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de productos de belleza.
El sueño de Matilde es poner  un bazar de ropa  en su casa.
texts.en:
Matilde, 39, married, is a partner of Bancomunal un Nuevo Día (Communal Bank of a New Day) and has three children, aged 21, 19 and 8. The eldest children work and study in an institute and the youngest is studying in a state school. Matilde studied accounting which led to a job in out-of-court settlements and now she works in a social well-being house in Pamplona (to the south of Lima) where she has been for ten years. She also works selling beauty products through a catalogue. Since joining FINCA, she no longer depends financially on her husband. She has her own money to invest and feels more secure and very happy to belong to the Bancomunal. Matilde needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy beauty products. Matilde's dream is to have a clothes shop in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou D., une femme mariée demeurant à Thies au Sénégal, est une couturière agée de 39 ans.  En plus de sa profession, elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus, sac, vetements etc pour renforcer ses activités et accroitre ses revenus. C'est ainsi qu'elle sollicite un pret de 200 000 frs cfa. Avec l'argent de ce crédit, elle compte se ravitailler pour satisfaire sa clientèle vue l'approche de la fete de Korité et de l'ouverture des classes ainsi de se positionner et de gagner de nouveaux marchés.

loans.use: acheter des tissus, sacs, chaussures, vetements etc et les revendre

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline E. is a 62-year old widow living with her three adult children in a middle-class subdivision in Caloocan City.

Evangeline has been in business for twenty years now.  She has a very competitive general store located just in front of her house.  Business was doing well when her husband passed away.  His loss took its toll on Evangeline and her business.  But she was able to eventually move on and her general store came back to life.  She is now earning P14, 000 a month.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004.  She has been active in inviting other women in her community to her group.  She just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative.  And now on her 11th loan cycle, she has applied for a loan of P29, 000.00 as additional capital for her store. She dreams of having a larger grocery store some day.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazones Unidos está formado por hombres y mujeres que viven en la ciudad de Cuenca,  su centro  histórico  se ha caracterizado por ser la zona residencial más antigua y más bella siendo considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, arquitectura, paisajes, gastronomía y amabilidad de  su gente atrae al turista nacional y extranjero.

El señor Carlos Campaña  tiene 50 años, es socio del banco comunal Corazones Unidos, vive en la urbe de la Ciudad de Cuenca con su esposa y su hija aún soltera, sus otros dos hijos ya son casados y viven independientes, aún no tienen casa propia.

Carlos tiene un  negocio de venta de revistas desde  hace 20 años y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado sacar  adelante a su familia,

Este es  su  segundo ciclo y nos comenta que los crédito  recibidos le han servido para  incrementar un poco su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le  entregue va a invertir en la compra de revistas de economía y negocios, de hogar, infantiles, didácticas,  etc para mantener un stock surtido para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Su meta es de seguir creciendo en su negocio y dar un mejor presente y futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
The Corazones Unidos communal bank is made up of men and women who live in the city of Cuenca, whose city center has been characterized as being the oldest and most beautiful residential area, having been declared a World Cultural Heritage for its architecture, scenery, gastronomy and kindness of its inhabitants. It draws tourists both locally and internationally. Carlos Campaña is 50 years old and a member of the Corazones Unidos communal bank. He lives in the large city of Cuenca with his wife and single daughter. His other two children are married and live independently; they don't have their own homes yet. Carlos has been a magazine merchant for the past 20 years and tells us that he has good days and bad days but his efforts at work have allowed him to get his family ahead. This is his second loan with us and he comments that the prior loan allowed him to increase his sales somewhat. The new loan from FUNDACION ESPOIR will be used to diversify his inventory adding economics, business, home, children, and how-to magazines to his stock so that he can offer his customers a better selection. His goal is to continue growing in his business and provide a better present and future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy business, economics, home, children and how-to magazines to offer his customers more choice.

loans.name: Chhai

texts.en:
Mr. Chhai P. is 40 years of age and a married man. He is a local farmer and is also hired by neighbor to cook meals for their parties or ceremonies. He normally makes around US$ 5 in income each day to support his family. His wife stays at home to care for three teenaged children and does housework and also works on the farm.

Chhai P. grows his rice crop over months and he has to deal with the fact that his field is far from the water system. Therefore, Chhai P. would like to ask for a loan of US$ 1000 in order to buy a pump for irrigation. He proposes to use the rest of his loan to purchase a used motorbike for a traveling. Chhai P. was busy at his farm so his wife is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy a pump for irrigation

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. is a simple and loving woman to her husband and children as well as to her fellow poor women in their community inside and outside KIVA's field partner in the Philippines, ASHI. Maria has been dreaming of nothing more than giving her children a better kind of living and supporting her group members and center members in ASHI alleviate their poverty. Living up to these personal expectations gives her courage to bear paying the interest rate required by ASHI for every loan she requests and attending the weekly center meetings.

Maria is also determined to grow her business and profits to be able to meet the demands of her family, which includes five children, whose ages range from three to 15. Maria wants to earn enough business profit, in addition to her husband’s sporadic income being a farm laborer, that she will be able to support the education of her children until they graduate from college.

The opportunity ASHI offers for poor women to access loans for a business is Maria’s key to achieving her dreams in life, and people around the world wanting to support her endeavor gives her reason to hold on to her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to raise

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Wilfredo Antonio tiene 42 años de edad, este joven tiene 3 hijos de los cuales todos están estudiando y están a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, inicio con muy pocos productos a pesar de no tener mucho que ofrecer a sus clientes no ha desistió con seguir adelante con este negocio, el tuvo mucha paciencia pues logro aumentar sus productos y obtener la pulpería en su vivienda, lo más difícil para él es proporcionarle a sus clientes todos los productos que le solicitan. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de juguetes, gaseosas, jugos, pan, y un poco de ropa para niños ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y sus clientes compran sus productos por los ofrece manera favorable. el sueño de este hombre es que su negocio se mantenga y además que sus hijos lleguen a lograr administrarlo.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Antonio, 42, has three school-age children who are all dependent on him and under his care. Wilfredo has a small general store which he began with just a few items. Despite not having much to offer his customers, he persevered. With much patience he managed to increase the variety of his stock items and set up his store in his home. His greatest difficulty is being able to stock everything his customers ask for. The financing he is requesting will be used to buy toys, soft-drinks, juices, bread, and a little bit of clothing for children because the Christmas season is approaching and his customers buy his products because he offers them at reasonable prices. His dream is that his business lasts and that his children run it some day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel in Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Gemma is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over one year, and she earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer que le sonríe a la vida a pesar de las dificultades, tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo en una humilde casa. Sus 4 hijos ya son mayores y tienen sus propias familias.
Desde que se casó empezó a vender salchipapas (platillo que trae papas y salchichas fritas, acompañadas de diversas cremas). Pero por motivos de salud, tuvo que dejar de lado este negocio, aunque le era muy rentable. Desde entonces, hace 2 años, implementó una tienda de dulces, gaseosas y cervezas, siendo los fines de semana cuando tiene mayores ventas.
En adelante, Luz desea comprar un aparador para poder exhibir mejor sus productos, asimismo planea instalar una puerta interior para evitar el ingreso de sus nietos, quienes suelen comerse los dulces cuando ella está en el mercado.

Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y hace compromisos de seguir siendo muy puntual, como hasta ahora lo ha sido. Además menciona estar contenta con su banco comunal, puesto que todos son muy responsables y trabajadores. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar los productos de su tienda para tener mayores ventas en los próximos meses.
texts.en:
Luz is a woman who always smiles at life no matter the difficulties. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband in their small home. Their children are grown up now and have their own families. From the time she married, Luz began to sell a local snack called salchipapas - potatoes and fried sausages, along with different sauces. Two years ago, she also set up a small shop to sell sweets, sodas and beers, especially for the weekends when sales are better. Going forward, Luz would like to buy a glass display case to better show the merchandise. She would also like to install an extra door, so her grandchildren don't come in to eat the sweets while she is at the market. This is the 12th loan she has had with MFP, and she has always made her payments on time. She says she is happy with the communal bank because everybody is very responsible and hardworking. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase more merchandise for her store so that she can increase sales in the coming months.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her small store, so that she can increase sales in the coming months.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Bismark M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de embutidos como huevos y pollo en su propio establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua donde se ha ganado la confianza de muchos clientes por ser una persona muy tranquila y trabajador.

Está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los embutidos como huevos y pollo para continuar en su venta y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes que a diario le visitan en el mercado.
texts.en:
Bismark M. sell eggs and chicken in his own establishment in Managua's Mayoreo market; he has won over the trust of many regular customers because he's a calm and hard-working person. He is asking for funds to buy eggs and chicken to sell thereby meeting daily customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs and chicken.

loans.name: Oluwole

texts.en:
Oluwole has a pig farm where he rears pigs to sell. He loves this business because it is highly profitable. He has been in this business for a long time and he is well known in his community. He hopes to expand his business in the future by adding a fish pond.

Oluwole is married and he is 45 years old. He has four children and they are excelling in school. He is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more feed for his pigs. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Oluwole is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more feed for his pigs

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort V. produces palm kernel oil for sale at Elmina. She is married and lives with her three children. She has received senior high education.  Comfort uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase palm nuts and a nut processor instead of having to pay for the nuts to be cracked. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to save to buy other equipment which will enable her to produce much palm kernel oil for sale.

To prepare her palm kernel oil she shells the palm nuts. The shelling used to be performed using two stones to crack each nut, separating the kernel and shell simultaneously. This manual operation has been largely superseded by the use of nut-cracking machines.

The traditional oil extraction method is to simply heat the dried nuts to release the palm kernel oil. The released oil is periodically skimmed from the top as heat is applied. This process is continued until almost all the oil is skimmed out of the palm kernels.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase palm nuts and a nut processor

loans.name: Debbie Lizzette

texts.es: Debbie Lizzette S. D.
texts.en:
29-year old Debbie Lizzette S. D. Ardón lives in San Antonio del Monte which is located in Sonsonate Department. She lives with her 4-year old and 6-year old children who are students in the local school. Her husband lives in the United States and sends money back to her. In spite of this, Debbie is an enterprising young woman who desires to get ahead and be able to have a better life both for her own and her children's sake. She has run a stall selling men's clothing for seven years. Debbie is asking for a loan so that she can buy more men's clothing and in this way increase sales even more. Despite her age, she is a hardworking person who gets good references from her neighbours and friends since she is well-known for being responsible and looking out for the wellbeing of her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

location.town: San Antonio del Monte, departamento de Sonsonate

loans.name: Luis Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Luis L. es casado y con una carga familiar de 3 varones y una niña todos en edad escolar, su esposa es ama de casa, don Luis es trabajador de la Compañía Licorera desde hace 23 años en donde se desempeña como Blendificador.
El nos expresaba que todos los créditos le han sido de gran ayuda, ya que han mejorado las condiciones del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
El señor Luis L. es casado y con una carga familiar de 3 varones y una niña todos en edad escolar, su esposa es ama de casa, don Luis es trabajador de la Compañía Licorera desde hace 23 años en donde se desempeña como Blendificador. El nos expresaba que todos los créditos le han sido de gran ayuda, ya que han mejorado las condiciones del hogar y de su familia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para mejoramiento de Vivienda. (Láminas de Zinc, Cemento, Arena, Clavos)

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla N. and her husband, Mr. Vit Sou (pictured together), live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh city. They  married in 1987 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. One daughter works in a garment factory and the other children are in school. Besides her children, Mrs. Phalla N. also has her elderly mother living with her. 

Mrs. Phalla has been running a grocery store at her house and selling fruit for more than three years. Mr. Vit Sou is a mason. Phalla used to request Kiva loan several times already, she hopes to continue expanding her business. So, she is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase grocery items for her stock and buy fruit under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her stock and buy fruit under contract for resale

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en:
Bernalda C. is from the village of Canitoan, Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Bernalda is married and has 4 adult children. Bernalda owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community through peddling. Bernalda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bernalda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Bernalda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and as additional working capital. Bernalda is requesting a new loan, her fourth, for 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make more products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make more products for sale

loans.name: Chieu

texts.en: Chieu T. D. was born in 1965. She has two children (a son and a daughter). Not only does she grow rice but she also is raising five pigs and two cows. Her family has difficulties. She wants to have a better life. So, she joined SEDA to have the opportunity to borrow money. This is the first time she has borrowed money from SEDA. She wants 5,014,000 VND to buy food for the pigs and she will try to repay punctually.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 36 años de edad y vive en pareja con Jorge de 44 años de edad hace mas de 17 años, tienen tres hijos, una mujer y dos varones en edades escolares.
Ella se dedica en la venta de ropa, dicho negocio empezó después de su vuelta de Buenos Aires  donde trabajaba como empleada doméstica. 
Su pareja es constructor y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Blanca se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir de todo tipo y con los ingresos de dicha actividad ayuda al sustento familiar. 
A pesar de que tiene mucha competencia ella no se queja y afirma que tiene buena clientela ya formada a quienes surte en forma diaria, semanal o mensual. 
El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio tales como: jeans, remeras, conjuntos, camperas, buzos, suéter, botas,etc. que traerá en base a los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes y luego les cobrará en cómodas cuotas.
texts.en:
Blanca is 36 and lives with her partner Jorge, 44, for more than 17 years. They have three children, one girl and two school-aged boys. Blanca works selling clothes; she began this business after her return from Buenos Aires, where she worked as a housekeeper. Her partner is a builder and helps with household expenses. Blanca sells all kinds of clothing and with the income from this activity helps support her family. In spite of having a lot of competition, she doesn’t complain; rather she says that she already has a good customer base to whom she caters daily, weekly or monthly. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of business merchandise such as jeans, shirts, suits, jackets, tracksuits, sweaters, boots, etc. that she will supply according to her customers’ requests. Later they will be charged in easy installments.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is a married woman with two boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house with no electricity or piped water, and her greatest monthly expense is food. Rose's husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's needs. 

For the past ten years, Rose has operated a tailoring business from home. Her customers are mostly neighbors. She faces the major challenge of seasonality and low turn up of clients. She decided to work with Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business. 

With this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), Rose wants to purchase material, lingerie, and thread. In the future, she hopes to open a dress-making college.

loans.use: To purchase material, lingerie, and thread.

loans.name: Sila

texts.en: Sila is 36 years old and married with two children.  He has been selling scrap metals for four years.  He gets his metals from worn out vehicle parts from insurance companies.  He joined Ukweli Baraka group in Faulu Kenya to get financial support.  He has been guaranteed a loan of 20 000 KES by the group.  This will be his first loan and he will use it to purchase more scrap metals.  Sila hopes to provide a quality education to his children in the future.  He dreams of opening other outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima lives in a small city called Borewala which is located in Punjab province in Pakistan. She lives in a three-room brick house with her husband and three children. Two of them are illiterate and her youngest daughter is studying in kindergarten. Her husband sells plastic crockery. He operates his shop in a nearby market. 
 
Fatima supports her family by doing sewing for neighborhood clients. She gets a good number of orders every month which gives her a reasonable amount of income. 

Fatima is on her 4th loan and has maintained good credit record in the past three years,  never missing any meetings. Now she has applied again for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy crockery in bulk for his shop. Fatima is hopeful that by using his 5 years of experience, her husband will be able to successfully upgrade his business and increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase crockery for reselling

loans.name: Be's Group

texts.en:
Be H. T. is 54 years old with five children. Four of them are married and live on their own. She has been farming for many years. Her main activities  are growing rice and raising pigs for meat. She sells these agricultural products to earn money. Currently, she wants to have a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pig feed.

Hai T. T. N. is 32 years old with four children who attend high school and secondary school. She is running a small shop that sells fresh fruit and wants a loan to invest in her shop. Thu T. H. N. is 25 years old with one small child. She is providing a taxi service and wants a loan to pay for maintaining her service. Thinh T. N. is 26 years old with two children. She is raising 200 chickens for meat and wants a loan to buy food for them. Quyen T. L. is 33 years old with two children. She is running a shop that serves ready-cooked food and needs a loan to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and pig feed

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina B. is from the city of Macupa Tangub City. She is 54 years old, married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products such as soap, sardines, shampoo, cooking oil, vinegar, and more in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josefina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josefina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Judy Lee

texts.en:
Judy Lee P. owns a small rice farm. She has three children. She dreams of a good life for her family, which is why she wants to earn more in her business. The reason why she joined CEVI is that she likes the program so much because of the insurance and savings offered. 

She wants to apply for another loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. She is optimistic that someday, she will be able to acquire more land so that she can plant more rice and earn a bigger profit.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Le Thi Nguyen's Group

texts.en:
Le T. N. is 42 years old with two children. She has been a farmer for a long time and has much experience in raising chickens for eggs. Currently, she has 300 laying hens. Eggs production is high. A local merchant comes to her house to buy eggs from her at wholesale.

As a client of SEDA since 2004, she has effectively used her loans to invest in her business. Currently, she wishes to borrow 1,090,000 VND to invest in raising her hens.

About the Other Borrowers:

1)T. T. Le is 39 years old with two children who are in high school. She has a shop that sells aluminum frames. She is in need of a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy materials. 2) Huong T. H. is 38 years old. Her two children are in secondary school. She grows rice and raises 200 chickens. She would like a loan of 4,142,000 VND to buy feed for them. 3) Luyen T. N. is 39 years old with two children. She is raising 100 hens and ten pigs for meat. She would like a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy feed for them. 4) Thuy T. N. is 27 years old with two young children. She is raising many kinds of fish in a lake of 480 square meters. She is in need of a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: To invest in raising her hens

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 20 years old. Mary Grace is single and has a 2-year-old baby. To make a living, Mary Grace operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Mary Grace also opened a sari-sari store where she sells products like soy sauce, sugar and other items.

Mary Grace joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Teresa Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a  la señora Teresa,  ella tiene 54 años de edad y hace varios años su esposo falleció, pero de esta relación tuvo dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, tiene a su cargo a un nieto de 16 años  que es como su hijo y estudia en el colegio.

Además de ser una ama de casa también tiene una pequeña fábrica donde fabrica y vende chifles, también prepara  comida, trabaja todos los días, desde las 6am se dedica a la fabricación de los chifles que luego con la ayuda de su nieto se encarga de entregar a distintos lugares de Rocafuerte, vende en cebicherías y tiendas.  La comida vende es en las tardes.

Este crédito es para comprar plátanos, aceite y otros ingredientes para la fabricación de los chifles y además productos para la preparación de los alimentos que vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde los inicios y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a los bancos.  Su sueño es tener una microempresa con maquinarias.
texts.en:
The members of the cooperative bank Mujeres Organizadas (“Organized Women”) meet every fifteen days in the zone of Rocafuerte.  This place is known for its delicious sweets, which are made by area residents and recognized throughout the country.

This is where we find Teresa, who is 54 years old and a widow for several years.  However, from her marriage, she has two grown children.  She is caring for a 16-year old grandson, who is like her own son, and who is in school.

In addition to being a homemaker, she also has a small workshop where she makes and sells chifles (fried plantain chips) and prepared foods.  She works every day from 6 am, making the chifles and then, with the help of her grandson, delivering them to different locations in Rocafuerte.  She sells to food stands and stores.  She sells the food in the afternoons.

This loan is to buy plantains, cooking oil, and other ingredients for making the chifles and the other foods she sells.  She has been with the cooperative bank since its inception, and she likes it because the loan interest rates are much lower than other banks.  Her dream is to have a micro-enterprise with machinery.

loans.use: To purchase plantains, cooking oil, salt and other supplies.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Mr. Hak T. is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. He has another partner in his wife, who appears in the picture above. She sells flowers in her community to earn additional profits. Mr. Hak T. has two children; both of them are students and dependent on him. 

Currently, Mr. Hak T. is managing his investment more smoothly. He has many regular customers who put in orders for him to build their houses. Mr. Hak T. hopes to be able to earn extra income by using a Kiva loan to purchase a machine for splitting wood in order to provide his construction services.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for splitting wood in order to provide his construction services

loans.name: 01- Mật Sơn 1- Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Huyền Lê Thị (01) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Huyền is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 01- Mật Sơn 1- Đông Vệ (08.09.01- Đông Vệ).


Huyền is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To making a living, Huyền owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector running a manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling  to local businesses and community members.  Huyền has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huyền is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    She is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND,  which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Huyền from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị Nam (02) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


2.  T. Thị lợi (03) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huyền Lê Thị (01) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Huyền là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 09.01-Đông Vệ (08.09.01- Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huyền thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huyền kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Huyền đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huyền đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. Thị Nam (02) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  T. Thị lợi (03) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make products

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de colchas, cubrecamas y sabanas y también se dedica a la venta de ropa en general, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria e independiente, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda para que pueda vender cubrecamas y sabanas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nancy, 42, is a member of the “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” communal bank which is located in Urubamba in Urubamba province, Cusco department.

She is single and has four children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business selling comforters, bed spreads and sheets.  She also sells clothing in general.  She sells both independently and as a street vendor.  Through this business she is able to help her children get ahead.  She wants to have a store where she can sell bed spreads and sheets.  She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise.

She is happy for the loan and commits to repay her installments.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Go Befo Group

texts.en:
M’balu D. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. M’balu was born in Kamakwe, a town in northern Sierra Leone, twenty-five years ago. She is married to a policeman and the couple has one child. For six years now, she has been selling body lotions, sprays, shampoos, etc. 

This is the first loan that M’balu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. M’balu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business she will buy creams, sprays, shampoos, etc., at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Buys creams, sprays, shampoos, etc., at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot, es una mujer honesta de 33 años, que junto a su esposo Elmer, cuidan de sus 2 hermosos hijos. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Patay. Para poder mantener a su familia, está valerosa mujer se dedica a la agricultura y al trasporte público. Todas las mañanas su esposo Elmer, sale a trabajar con su auto; trasladando a los pobladores del caserío a la ciudad de Tarma. Mientras que Margot dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo a cuidar de sus sembríos de habas, arvejas y flor de gladiolo, ya tiene 14 años realizando está labor. Lo que más le gusta a ella es viajar a la ciudad de Tarma, donde comercializa su producción. “Estar en el campo es maravilloso, no se ganará mucho pero vives tranquila”, afirma; por esa razón desea seguir mejorando sus sembríos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Picaflores de Patay”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde es una socia trabajadora y cumplida. Margot dentro de muy pronto cosechará flor de gladiolo, por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para así obtener una buena cosecha de esta flor.
texts.en:
Margot is a modest 33 year-old woman who, together with her husband Elmer, cares for their 2 beautiful children.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the village of Patay.

In order to support her family, this brave woman works as a farmer and provides public transport services.  Every morning, her husband Elmer goes out working with his car.  He transports residents of their village to the city of Tarma.  Meanwhile, Margot spends her time caring for her bean, pea and gladioli crops.  She has been in this line of work for 14 years.  What she most enjoys is travelling to the city of Tarma where she sells her produce.  "Being in the countryside is marvellous.  You do not earn much but you live peacefully" she says.  For this reason, she would like to continue improving her crops.

Margot is a member of the "Picaflores de Patay" (Patay Hummingbirds) community bank and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She is a hard-working and responsible member of her community bank.  Very soon Margot will harvest her gladioli flowers.  She will use her loan money to buy several sacks of organic manure so that she can obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei lives and works in Kamenka, which is a predominantly agricultural region of Ukraine. Andrei owns three large greenhouses and a separate one for seedlings. His farming business has been around for 15 years. He has invested 60,000 Grivnyas in this business. His annual expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 35,000 Grivnyas. Andrei is married with two children. 

Andrei is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to construct a new greenhouse and to purchase the film to cover it, as well as to reconstruct one of the three greenhouses he already has. One of Andrei’s plans for the future is to build an additional greenhouse and generate extra income.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse and purchase polyethylene film

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

She has been operating a retail shop business for the past four years, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Elizabeth faces a major challenge in the  high cost of transporting merchandise to her place of operation. She hopes to expand her business and establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of its loan products.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour

loans.name: Edgard

texts.en:
Edgard G. is from the village of Olango. He is 44 years old. Edgard is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Edgard owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice to sell. Edgard has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP every cropping season.

In 2011, Edgard joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgard is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edgard from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 51-year-old married man living with his wife in Baalback. Ali has owned a grocery store for six years. Most of his clients are his neighbors, friends and relatives. Ali is a hard worker. He introduces new products from time to time to keep his business improving.

Ali is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to have the ability to buy more quickly more cigarettes to sell. It is the law to buy cigarettes with cash, not credit, and for a storeowner like Ali, turnover in cigarettes is very quick.

Ali is an honest person with a good reputation that is based on his clients’ good opinion of him. Ali hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his ability to buy more cigarettes to stock

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 30 years old, married and has three children.  He has been selling second-hand clothes and has two employees in his business.  He was previously working as a mechanic to earn his living.  He also runs a taxi business for extra income.  

Isaac works hard in his business so that he can provide quality education to his children.  He hopes that one day; he will have a big business.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy more used clothes and repair his taxi.

loans.use: To buy clothes and repair his taxi

loans.name: Emmanuel S.

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Emmanuel S. K..  He is single.  He has five dependents who live with him because they help him with his business.  In 2003, Emmanuel established his drinks business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant.  Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Emmanuel requires a loan to buy more drinks for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Emmanuel plans to educate his dependents and buy a piece land. He is very serious and dedicated. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 50 crates of assorted drinks.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.es:
Erlita tiene 45 años de edad. Vive en casa propia con 3 hijos a su cargo, ubicada en un centro poblado menor llamado Primero de Mayo en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Cliente vive en la parte urbana de este distrito. Cuenta con los servicios (agua y energía eléctrica).

Erlita se dedica a la comercialización de tubérculos como papas y camotes en un puesto en el mercado Moshoqueque.  Erlita  cuenta con muchos años de experiencia en el mercado menorista, con muy buenos resultados.  Ella se ha dado cuenta del crecimiento de su negocio y de la gran cantidad de clientes que ha ido captando, por eso necesita ampliar su negocio para cumplir con la demanda de su público.

Erlita  esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de s/. 1200  nuevos soles, para que pueda implementar su negocio con  mas mercadería y nuevas clases de tubérculos, esto le ayudará a tener una mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, abastecer a pequeños distribuidores y convertirse posteriormente en una distribuidora mayorista.

Erlita, es una clienta recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Sus prestamos anteriores han sido cancelados de manera puntual, por ello se tiene muy buenas referencias de la responsabilidad y puntualidad de erlita.
texts.en:
Erlita is 45 years old and has three dependent children. She owns a home in the central town of Primero de Mayo in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz. Erlita lives in the urban part of the district and receives services such as water and electricity.

She sells tubers, such as potatoes and yams, from a stand at the Moshoqueque Market. Erlita has many years of experience working at the retail market and has achieved very good results. She has noticed the growth of her business and the large number of customers she has attracted. Erlita needs to expand her business so that she can keep up with public demand.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN so that she can keep her business running with more merchandise and new types of tubers. This will help her have a wider variety of products to offer to her customers and to small distributors. Eventually she would like to become a wholesale distributor.

Erlita is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa. Her previous loans were repaid on time and she has good references who can attest to her responsibility and promptness.

loans.use: to purchase new types of tubers and other merchandise.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 43 years old and from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province.  She is married with five school-aged children.  Marisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  Her main source of income comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, beverages, shampoo, soap, and detergent in the local community.  Marisa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marisa joined Kiva partner Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  She has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan of 17000 PHP, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Marisa requests a new 20000 PHP loan to purchase additional canned goods, junk food and beverages to sell in her shop. This loan will be her sixth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI):

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk food, and beverages for sale in her shop

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry, 38, is a villager living in a rural area of Siem Reap province. She is married with three single children, one of whom works in the construction field. Ry is a construction foreman, earning an income of around US $4 each day to use for the family’s needs. To help provide more food for the family, her husband is also employed as a construction leader. Ry is requesting a loan to buy some piglets for breeding and more planks to repair her old house.

loans.use: to buy some piglets for breeding and more planks to repair her old house.

loans.name: Mildred Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Mildred Alejandra es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada de 29 años se dedica al comercio de artesanía y realiza pulseras tejidas. Este negocio lo inicio su madre hace 30 años y ella junto a su hermana hace 9 años que lo continúo.
Mildred tiene un puesto en el mercado de Masaya e invertirá el crédito en artesanías de madera y cerámica. Ella tiene la meta de tener otro tramo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mildred Alejandra is a hard worker, age 29, who sells crafts and makes woven bracelets.  She began the business 30 years ago with her mother and, for the last nine years, has been running it with her sister.

Mildren has a stall in the Masaya Market and plans to use the loan to buy wooden and ceramic crafts.  Her goal is to open another stall.

loans.use: To buy wooden and ceramic crafts.

loans.name: Yaciris Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yaciris de 24 años vive en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio,  barrio que combina espacios productivos formales e informales, zonas comerciales, edificios, conjuntos residenciales, viviendas, supermercados, y principalmente es un lugar conocido en toda Colombia, porque muy cerca se encuentra uno de los escenario más importante de la ciudad y de Colombia: “El estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla” donde se juega el buen futbol profesional y es la sede  del Junior de Barranquilla,  equipo amado en la costa Norte de Colombia. 
Yaciris desde el año 2006 inició su negocio con un punto comercial ubicado en la parte externa de un centro comercial importante del sur de la ciudad, donde vende chancletas, calzado deportivo para damas caballeros e infantil  y próximamente estará ubicada en la nueva galería de la avenida principal.  Sus clientes son transeúntes a quienes les vende de contado aunque tiene clientes con los que ha realizado transacciones a crédito. El negocio lo atiende en compañía de su esposo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará en mayor volumen  y de contado, sandalias y calzado para damas pues se provisionará para dar respuesta a la gran demanda que se avecina a propósito del segundo semestre del año, época en la cual en la cual ocurre un importante incremento de sus ventas.  Su sueño más adelante es tener una casa propia para ofrecerle a su hijo de 7 meses, excelentes  condiciones habitacionales y de bienestar .
texts.en:
Yaciris, 24, lives in the "20 de Julio" neighborhood, which is an area that contains both formal and informal activities, commercial zones, buildings, residential complexes, houses, and supermarkets.  This is an area known throughout Colombia, because it is very close to one of the most important venues in the city and in Colombia, the Metropolitan Stadium of Barranquilla, where professional soccer is played.  This is the home of the "Junior de Barranquilla" team, which is much loved on the northern coast of Colombia.

Yaciris started her business in 2006 with a store located outside of an important mall in the southern part of the city.  Here she sells flip-flops and sneakers for men, women and children.  Soon she will have a location in the new galleria on the main avenue.  Her customers are passers-by to whom she sells on a cash basis, although she has some customers to whom she sells on credit.  She attends to this business along with her husband from 9am until 9pm.  This Kiva loan will be the second loan that she has received from the  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it she will purchase sandals and shoes for women in large quantities on a cash basis.
