This will allow her to stock up her business for the high demand that comes in the second half of the year, the season when she generally sees a big increase in her sales.  Her dream for the future is to have her own house, so that she can provide her son, who is 7 months old, with excellent living conditions and a good life.

loans.use: to buy sandals and women's shoes in large quantities on a cash basis

loans.name: Geraldine Doris Emma

texts.fr:
Commercante de 36 ans, mariee et mere de 2 enfants dont l'age varie 2 et 10 ans, elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie en 2000, quand elle arrete ses etudes en classe de troisieme, elle s'approvisionne dans les grands magasins de friperie de la capitale, elle a des revenus de 30.000 a 80.000 frs par vente, ses potentiels clients sont les vendeurs du marche de la gare routiere .

A l'octroi de son pret elle va acheter des ballots de serviettes , draps non utilises, des sacs, jupes et pantalons.
Tres entreprenante, elle veut aller loin dans l'exercice de son activite pour soutenir son foyer et aussi prendre en charge la scolarite de ses enfants et aider son mari a construire une maison .
texts.en:
A 36-year-old businesswoman, married with two children 2 and 10 years old, she began selling used clothing in 2000, when she ended her studies in her fourth year of secondary school.  She buys her goods in large used-clothing stores in the capital and makes 30,000 to 80,000 frs per sale.  Her potential clients are sellers at the train station market.

On receiving her loan, she will buy bales of towels, sheets, bags, skirts and pants.  A very hard worker, she wants to go far in her business in order to support her family, pay her children’s school fees, and help her husband to build a house.

loans.use: to buy bales of pants, skirts, bags, sheets and towels.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
With a bicycle, Silvina, 59 years of age, sells her native cakes and vegetables in their village. With her perseverance, she generates an income of PHP 2,000 a month in these activities, which she spends for the needs of her family and for paying her obligation to ASKI.

To further improve her business and sustain the needs of her family, Silvina would like to ask for additional capital amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy additional raw materials to make native cakes and additional vegetables such as string beans and squash.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make native cakes and to buy vegetables such as string beans and squash

loans.name: Janessa

texts.en:
Janessa is 30 years old and separated from her husband with one child.  She lives in Calalinan, Siquijor, Siquijor.

She sells in a sari-sari (convenience) store to earn a living and has had this business for 6 months.  Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Janessa has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since July 13, 2011.  In the future, she hopes to have a savings deposit for her one child.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Edgar Reynaldo

texts.es:
Edgar, de 31 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, su nivel de estudios es básico solo termino el cuarto grado de primaria, es soltero, de oficio comerciante vende chinelas para damas, tiene 20 años con este negocio. Cuando el inicio fue con ayuda de un tío de el que le presto capital para que comprara mercadería y empezara a vender. Así lo hizo y fue haciendo su clientela poco a poco fue levantando su pequeño negocio, el cual lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de la estación de buses de León.    
Requiere el préstamo para comprar chinelas para damas. Pues necesita invertir su inventario presentar estilos diferentes de chinelas para damas que son las de mayor demanda y el necesita cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen, para no perder clientes, así mejorar sus ventas. El no solo desea vender chinelas sino también quiere vender zapatos de mejor calidad, estilos y tener una línea para zapatos de niños.
texts.en:
Edgar, age 31, lives in the city of León. He only has a basic education, having finished school only through the fourth grade. Edgar is single and earns his livelihood by selling women’s slippers. He has been in this business for 20 years. His uncle helped him start this business by lending him capital to buy merchandise so that he could start selling. Edgar carried out his plans and gradually built up his customer base so that he could establish his small business. His business is located at the market in the bus station in León.

He is requesting this loan to buy women’s slippers. Edgar needs to invest in his inventory so that he can offer different styles of women’s slippers that are in high demand and fulfill his orders. This will prevent him from losing customers and help him improve his sales. Edgar does not want to sell only slippers, so he plans to sell shoes of high quality and of various styles. He also wants to offer a line of children’s shoes.

loans.use: to buy women's slippers.

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es: Carlos es socio del Bancomunal Los Laureles, tiene 39 años, se dedica a la venta de zapatos y a la fábricación de zapatos para caballero, tiene 3 hijos. Es socio de FINCA Peru desde hace dos años, él siempre trabajó haciendo zapatos porque es un negocio familiar, agradece mucho por todo lo que le han enseñado, a traves de las capacitaciones ha aprendido a ser mas responsable en todos aspectos, las capacitaciones le gustan porque ha aprendido mucho sobre los valores lo cual inculca en su hogar, ahora su mayor deseo es poder ampliar su negocio y poder tener una sucursal.
texts.en: Carlos is a member of the communal bank Bancomunal Los Laureles. He is 39 years and has 3 children. He sells shoes and makes shoes for men. He has always worked making shoes because it is a family business. He has been a member of FINCA Peru for 2 years. He appreciates everything they have taught him. Through the training he has learned to be more responsible in all respects. He likes the training sessions because he has learned alot about values which he instills into his home. His greatest wish now is to expand his business and have a branch.

loans.use: to buy materials for his business.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with three children. 

Rizza has a bakeshop that sells breads & pastries. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries.

Rizza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rizza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries

loans.name: Artur

texts.ru:
Артуру 45 лет. Вместе со своей женой и дочерью он проживает в деревне Тсовагюх (Tsovagyugh), Севанского региона. Дочь Артура посещает среднюю школу. 
Артур разводит коров, овец и кур. А начиная с 2005 года он начал торговлю продовольственными и хозяйственными продуктами в вагоне-магазинчике по соседству со своим домом. Жена не работает и помогает Артуру в магазине и на ферме. Благодаря совместным усилиям они содержат свою семью и надеются развивать свой бизнес и в дальнейшем. 
Артур получает кредит от организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon) во второй раз, и сейчас ему необходимо 500.000 драм для увеличения ассортимента своего магазина: а именно для покупки большой партии прохладительных напитков, круп, кофе и чая, а также партии  мыла, шампуней и т.д.    
Благодаря будущей прибыли, Артур надеется приобрести использованный автомобиль для доставки товаров для своего магазина, что существенно уменьшит расходы его бизнеса в будущем.
texts.en: Artur is 45 years old.  He lives with his wife and daughter in the Tsovagyugh village of the Syunik region.  Artur's daughter attends a secondary school. Artur breeds cattle, sheep and chickens.  He started to sell food and household products in a wagon-store nearby his home in 2005.  His wife does not work and helps Artur in the store and on the farm.  Thanks to their joint efforts, they are able to support their family and hope to continue developing their business in the future.  Artur is requesting a second loan from the Nor Horizon organization and now needs 500,000 dram to expand the assortment of his store and especially to buy a large inventory of cold drinks, grans, coffee, tea and also an inventory of soap, shampoos, etc. Thanks to the future profit, Artur hopes to buy a used car to deliver goods for his store, which would significantly reduce his business expenses in the future.

loans.use: to buy a large inventory of cold drinks, grans, coffee, tea and also an inventory of soap, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Duo Camino De Luz Group

texts.es:
CAMINO D. LUZ
Este grupo esta formado por doña  Margarita D. 42 años casada y tiene 7 hijos,y es la lider D. este grupo ella se dedica a la agricultura tiene una siembra D. tomate desD. hace 15 años su esposo y ella trabajan juntos y gracias a Dios ha podido salir adelante y por eso  necesitan este crédito para poder  comprar demillas y sembrar chile pimiento y venderlo necesitan invertir mucho por eso necesitan el crédito para comprar todo lo necesario para la siembra y esperan que se les pueda apoyar en todo lo que ellos necesita confían en que fape les pueda seguir apoyando ya que con eso obtienen ganancias y pueden seguir trabajando.
Maria Guadalupe, es dueña D. una tienda desD. hace dos años es casada y tiene 1 hijo,ella venD. productos D. consumo diario po eso esta solicitnaod este credito para su tienda.
texts.en:
"Camino D. Luz" Group

This group is formed by Margarita and Maria Guadalupe. Margarita is 42 years old, married, and she has 7 children. She is the leader of the group and she is an agriculturist who has been cultivating tomatoes for 15 years. She and her husband work together and Thanks be to God that they have been able to move forward. She needs this loan to be able to purchase seeds and to plant green peppers for later sale. She hopes that they will be supported in getting all that they need. They trust that FAPE (Kiva Field Partner) will keep supporting them. I it is with their support that they are able to obtain their profits and they are able to keep working.

Maria Guadalupe is has been the owner of a store for the past two years. She is married and she has 1 child. She sells every day consumer goods and she requests this loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase tomato and green pepper seeds.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. She has been running a green grocer business to make a living. Anna has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fumbatukha Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Fumbatukha Group in Western Kenya! Martin is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to the best prices offered by the firm and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest one bag of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Martin will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Fumbatukha group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is a 52-year-old married woman with two adult-aged children. Agapita is from Baranggay 5, Tangub City. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like milk, soap, shampoo and so on in the local community. Agapita has been 15 years in her business and she earns about 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Agapita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and have working capital. This will be her sixth loan taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and have working capital.

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en:
Altansuvd is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Gobisumber Province, Mongolia.  Her husband is an electrician, her elder son is a college student and her younger son is a student. Altansuvd started her meat retail business in 2004 by renting a counter in the market. She has many trusted suppliers and many regular customers. Now that winter is approaching, Altansuvd needs to save some meat supply before the price increases as it usually does. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my son is a college student, I have to do everything I can to pay my son's college fees." 

Altansvud requests 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more meat that she can store because in the winter meat will be less available.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to store because meat is less available in the winter.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalya is married. She sells women's clothing at Yulana market in Pavlograd town. Natalya started her own business 13 years ago. A small salary that was not paid on time forced her to think of having her own business. She began to sell women's clothing and her business began to grow. Recently she opened a second location. She is glad she can increase her turnover as well as give a job to someone who needs it. Natalya would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián, de 43 años, natural de Santa Rosa, vive en casa propia con su esposa Celsa de 41 años, padres de 02 hijos, Karina de 17 años y Ana de 13 años, quienes son la felicidad de su hogar. Fabián, es un hombre de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo es labrar la tierra, pues es campesino y cuenta con un terreno en la cual tiene cultivos de  cacao y café. Viene trabajando 16 años y es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el agro; Fabián en tiempos de cosecha busca el apoyo de los jornaleros para que le apoyen en las extracciones de los frutos. Sus plantas más rentables son: los granos de cacao y café, por lo cual las empresas acopiadoras le pagan muy bien por cada kilogramo. El problema de su trabajo radica en, no poder combatir con los insectos quienes dañan los frutos de las plantas. Con el crédito solicitado priorizará en comprar plantas de cacao para incrementar  sus cultivos y así pueda aumentar su producción. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por tanto agradece su colaboración para seguir trabajando. En su banco comunal es puntual con sus pagos y se siente alegre por trabajar con personas responsables. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles podrá comprar plantas de cacao para incrementar  sus cultivos y así pueda aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Fabián is 43 and a native of Santa Rosa. He lives in his own house with his wife of 41 years, Celsa. They are the parents of two children, 17 year old Karina and 13 year old Ana, who bring happiness to the house.

Fabián is a high-functioning man. He puts a lot of care into the work he does. His job is working the land, since he is a country person and has a field where he cultivates cacao and coffee. He has been working for 16 years and he knows the meaning of hard work in agriculture. During the harvest, Fabian looks for the support of day laborers who can help him with fruit picking. His most profitable crops are coffee and cacao beans, which gathering companies pay very well for per kilogram. The problem with his work stems from the fact that he cannot fight the insects that want to hurt the fruits from the plants. 

With the requested loan he will prioritize the purchase of cacao plants in order to boost his crops and thereby increase his production. This will be his second loan with MFP, and he is very grateful for their collaboration, which allows him to continue working. At his communal bank he is punctual in his payments, and he feels happy to work with responsible people. With the 3,000 nuevos soles he will be able to buy cacao plants to boost his crops and thereby increase his production.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants.

loans.name: Nico Vive Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso se han unido 13 mujeres con muchas ganas y deseos de poder progresar y salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, comentan que tienen como objetivo obtener mayores ingresos, para que de esa forma puedan ayudar a sus familias.
Una de estas mujeres luchadoras es Luz, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas de todo tipo. Comenta que tiene buena venta ya que las frutas que vende tiene muy buena salida. Ella se define como una mujer muy sacrificada, ya que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y vuelve a casa ya nuy tarde.
Luz solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas de estación, como ser melones, sandias, ciruelas, manzanas, naranjas y demás, con las cuales podrá tener más variedad y productos frescos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Mariano Roque Alonso, thirteen women have united with tremendous willingness and desire to make progress and move forward. They are hardworking and determined women who say that their goal is to earn more income so that they can help their families.

One of these determined women is Luz, who sells all types of fruit. She says that she has had good fruit sales because she has gotten off to an excellent start. Luz defines herself as a very self-sacrificing woman. She begins each work day in the early morning hours and returns home very late. Luz is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits such as melons, watermelons, plums, apples, oranges, and other goods so that she can have more variety and fresh produce to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits for eventual resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nelly wants to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en: Rafig G. lives and runs a barbershop by the bazaar in Aghsu city. He has been running his own barbershop for almost 12 years. Rafig is married, living with his two children and their families. One of his sons was killed 14 years ago during the war. Rafig hopes to expand his business by purchasing a new location and eventually opening a women's salon.

loans.use: To purchase a larger barbershop and open a women's salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase used clothes and to pay suppliers for new clothes and accesories.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs Seng R. is a 45 year old housewife. Her husband is a carpenter and earns around 1 dollar per day. They have 6 children. Three of them work in a big groceR. store. Mrs Seng R. needs a motorcycle to take her children to their workplace or to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Akouyouvi

texts.fr:
Aged 38, Mrs. Akouyouvi A. is single and has no children. She stopped her studies at elementary school level because of lack of money, and took on an apprenticeship. Now a master seamstress, she offers a quality service to a growing number of clients. In order to improve this service and meet her clients’ needs in a timely manner, Mrs. A. wishes to buy two sewing machines and an embroidery machine. This requires substantial financial means, which she does not have. She is therefore asking for a loan of $1,200 to enable her to buy these tools of her trade.

Agée de 38 ans, Madame A. Akouyouvi est une femme célibataire sans enfant. Elle arrêta ses études au cours primaire à cause du manque de moyens et entra en apprentissage. Aujourd'hui maîtresse couturière, elle rend un service de qualité à sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus grande. En vue d'améliorer ce service et satisfaire à temps ses clients, Madame A. Akouyouvi désire acquérir deux (2) machines à coudre et une machine à broder. Cela demande des moyens financiers important dont elle ne dispose pas. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $1200 qui lui permettra d'acquérir ces outils de travail.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy 2 sewing machines and 1 embroidery machine

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy A. is an experiences businesswoman. She has been in business for 6 years and with LAPO for 3 years. She has a fashion shop where she sows and sells clothes. This is a trade she learned for 3 years. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more clothes for re-sale. She is 38 years old, married with 5 children and lives in Benin City.

loans.use: To buy more clothes & tailoring material

loans.name: Thi Luong

texts.vi:
Ms Lương, 26 years old, has 2 young children. She is a young lady but she works hard. Everyday she sells vegetables at the market. She also raises poultry at home. Her husband is a construction worker, he makes a small salary but it does help his family. They wish to obtain a loan to buy chicken feed. They will save money to pay back the loan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lương 26 tuổi, có 2 con nhỏ. Tuy còn trẻ nhưng chị rất chăm chỉ làm ăn. Hàng ngày chị đi bán rau ở chợ, ngoài ra gia đình chị còn nuôi gà thịt để bán. Chồng chị là thợ xây , thu nhập của anh tuy it ỏi nhưng cũng giúp đỡ được khá nhiều cho cuộc sống gia đình. Anh chị rất mong nhận được vốn để hỗ trợ việc mua cám cho gà. Thu nhập từ đi chợ và chăn nuôi gà, chị sẽ để dành để hoàn trả vốn.

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
A high sense of cooperation and team work are values that have allowed Enrique to work in association with a group of friends for the past seven year spending their savings on the purchase of cattle and sheep. With effort and planning today he can see the fruits of his hard work. As part of a family of farmers, he has always had close ties to agricultural activities and has inherited the values of cooperation and hard work in the field from his family, and therefore he enjoys his daily work as it allows him to support his family and he expects to continue progressing. He wishes to improve and increase the benefits for society and his family and is requesting your support. Help Enrique move on with his noble wish to better himself and his team.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Un alto sentido de cooperación y trabajo en equipo son valores que a Enrique le ha permitido asociarse hace siete años con un grupo de amigos para comprar con sus ahorros animales de ganado vacuno y ovino; luego de mucho esfuerzo y planificación hoy ve con satisfacción los frutos de su laborioso trabajo.Él siempre ha estado ligado a las actividades agrícolas porque es miembro de una familia agricultora que inculcó los valores de cooperación y trabajo esforzado en el campo en cada uno de los miembros de su gran familia, ahora hace una réplica de lo aprendido diariamente.Enrique disfruta de ese trabajo diario porque le permite sostener a su familia y espera seguir progresando.Desea mejorar e incrementar los beneficios para su sociedad y su familia, por esta razón solicita tu ayuda.Apoya a Enrique a seguir adelante con sus nobles deseos de superación en conjunto.

loans.use: Increase stock of cattle and sheep.

loans.name: Kabojja B1(B) Group

texts.en: Ephrance has a market stall and sells raw foods like matooke, cassava and sweet potatoes. She intends to use the extra business profits to complete her rental houses that are under construction. Justine and Mayimuna both sell used clothes for a living and want to increase stock with the loan. Nulu has a bar business.

loans.use: To purchase more foods for sale.

loans.name: Subdra

texts.en:
Mrs. Subdra K., a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishapati, is a shopkeeper. Sainu-Bhaishapati is one of the developing villages of the Lalitpur districts of Nepal. Most of the people in this village are engaged in farming. Mrs. K. lives in a single family with her husband and children. Her husband, Ram Kumar K., works in a government office.

Mrs. K. opened her grocery shop four years ago. Her children also help her in her shop. Mrs. K. sells different types of grocery items in her shop. She opened the grocery shop to help her husband meet the needs of their family and also to improve their standard of living.

Now Mrs. K. is requesting for her third loan of Rs20000.00 to buy groceries for her shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A. sells yams. She is married with 9 children. She is 65 years old and hails from Ewohimi in Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1972. She needs the loan of $875 to buy yams to sell.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un H., age 33, lives with her old mother in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has two businesses to meet the daily expenses. First, she owns a plot of farmland and grows cashew nut trees. Cashew nuts are one of the favorite crops and are served around the country. People cook with cashew nuts and also serve them when they drink beer or wine.

Second, she rents a musical instrument to the villagers. She earns the most in the dry season, from January to May. In April, farmers have already harvested their crops, and most couples get married in that month.

Her combined income from both businesses is around four dollars per day. Her elderly mother, Neang Houn, age 65, helps her daughter every day with planting cashew nuts.

Mrs. Un H. would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a small tractor to transport the musical instrument. Whenever she rents her musical instrument, she needs to rent a trailer or horse-cart to transfer musical instrument to the renter's site. This cost decreases her income, and so she isn't able to save a lot of money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor to transport the musical instrument to renters.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat P. is 37 years old. She is married with four children, all of whom are in school except for her oldest son, who is in his freshman year of university. As any mother, she wants her children to have everything they need, and she dreams that all of them will be able to receive higher education.

She and her husband are both farmers. She has been working the land for six years. In fact, she began cultivating her land through her and her oldest son’s efforts, and she has gradually gotten ahead in life with such efforts. On the cultivated land, Muhabbat grows wheat, rice, and maize. When it is prime growing season, Muhabbat works in the field from early morning until late at night. She is proud to say that her business is one of her greatest accomplishments in life.

Muhabbat is planning to cover the higher education expenses of her second son because he is soon finishing school and is about to enter university. Therefore, Muhabbat is applying for a loan for the first time, seeking 2,000 Somoni ($600) over a term of 12 months. With the loan proceeds, Muhabbat is planning to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer, and she use the remaining proceeds to pay the salaries of her hired seasonal workers. Muhabbat thanks everyone who trusted her and for their support, and she promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To pay for her children's higher education fees by purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer, and by using the remaining loan proceeds to pay the salaries of her seasonal workers

loans.name: Agnoko

texts.fr:
Born December 7, 1978 in Lomé, Mrs. Agnoko P. is married and the mother of 3 children. She sells used clothing in the Nyékonakpoè neighborhood in Lomé. Ever since she opened her stall in 2006, she has only been interested in women’s clothes, being of the opinion that women pay better than men.

This first credit that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 4 bales of used clothes and 5 rolls of cloth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née la 07 décembre 1978 à Lomé, Madame P. Agnoko est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est revendeuse de friperie dans le quartier de Nyékonakpoè à Lomé. Depuis 2006 qu’elle a commencé elle ne s’intéressait qu’à la vente de vêtements de femme sous prétexte que les femmes payent mieux que les hommes.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 4 ballots de friperie et 5 rouleaux de tissus.

loans.use:
Purchase of clothing for re-sale

Achat de vêtements

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhun L. is a mother of three and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her famiL. have temporariL. moved to Phnom Penh, where she is employed as a garment factory worker and her husband operates a motor-taxi business. This couple can typicalL. make around $ 6 per day, which is used to cover their food, their house rental, and other expenses.

Mrs. Chhun would like to request a loan from KIVA to help her husband buy a passenger cart in order to convert from a motor-taxi business to tuk-tuk business, which would allow him to carry more passengers and provide him a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy a tuk-tuk.

loans.name: Map

texts.en:
Mrs. Map H. is a 37-year-old farmer and lives in Ptas Rong Commune, Siem Reap Province, with her husband, Mr. Chen Chon, who is 38 years old. They have three children who are in school. They both earn a total of about 10,000 Riel (US $2.50) per day growing rice and would like to increase their crop.

Because this is now the farming season in Cambodia, they need capital to purchase fertilizer for their rice crop. Map would like to request a loan to help her increase their rice yield and support their family adequately.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop

loans.name: Chanthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthea K., 38, is a farmer who grows rice. Her husband, Mr. Doeun Cheam, is a policeman who has a small monthly salary. They have three children, all of whom are in school. The family's living condition is not very good because of the increasing prices of food and other goods. Chanthea and Doeun both work hard everyday to provide for their family, but their income is insufficient for their daily expenses.

To increase their income, Chanthea needs a loan of 1,000,000 Riel ($250 USD) to purchase piglets to breed and to buy fertilizer for her rice crop. The family lives in Ptas Rong Commune, Pursat Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
El negocio de pulpería es el negocio al cual se dedica la señora Maria del Carmen L. con el objetivo de mantener su humilde familia la cual necesita de su apoyo. El orgullo de la señora L. es su pequeño hijo el cual es un excelente estudiante. Por esta razón es que se esfuerza mucho en el negocio para mejorar su situación económica.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener un crédito para la compra de mercadería para la pulpería. Es necesario destacar que ella ha sido una fiel cliente de Ceprodel debido a que ha cancelado todos sus anteriores créditos y se perfila como una gran comerciante en el negocio debido a sus grandes esfuerzos.
texts.en:
A local grocery mart is the business to which Señora Maria del Carmen L. has dedicated herself with the objective of maintaining her humble family, which needs her support. The pride of Señora L. is her little son, who is an excellent student. For this reason she tries so hard in her business to improve their economic situation. Today she has come to Ceprodel with the goal of obtaining a loan for purchasing merchandise for her grocery mart. It necessary to mention that she has been a loyal client of Ceprodel; she has repaid all of her previous loans and she has has become a great business woman due to her great efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy products for her mini mart

loans.name: Mazalo

texts.fr:
Madame T. Mazalo est née le 13 août 1965 à Adjengré au nord du Togo. Elle est célibataire avec des enfants. Son activité principale est la vente des céréales. C’est une femme qui lutte beaucoup pour la réussite de sa vie. Elle assure aussi la charge de ses petites sœurs avec le peu de revenu qu’elle gagne.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour faire le stock des céréales par l’achat de 200 tubercules d’igname, 3 sacs de mil et 1 sac  de maïs.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mazalo T. was born on August 13, 1965 in Adjengré in Northern Togo. She's single with children. Her business mainly consists in selling cereals. She's a woman who works really hard to succeed in life. Out of her meager income, she also provides for her younger sisters. She's seeking this first loan to create a stock of cereals, by purchasing 200 yams, 3 sacks of millet and one sack of corn.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yams, millet and corn

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty K. sells charcoal. Jenty is 45 years old and widowed. She has one child, who is in school. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more groundnut and make groundnut paste for sale.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts to make groundnut paste.
